title: Painted Hearts Workshop with Artist Tara Dickinson
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
The world could use some hearts right now, especially with Valentine's Day right around the corner! If you don't know what to get your honey, maybe they will enjoy a piece of art from you...

In this fun & easy workshop, you'll paint layers of color with our intentionally messy hearts emerging through the process.
We'll paint one 11" x 14" canvas and a couple of notecards.

Just bring your willingness to explore, let go, and paint from your heart. Your finished art pieces can be a sweet gift, or simply an original piece of art you've created to brighten your life.

100% beginner friendly. No wrong way to do it

A fun art journey available to everyone!

* 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM
* $45, all supplies provided
* Held at Full Circle Studio at 360 Tesconi Circle, Suite C, Santa Rosa
* **PLS REGISTER/PAY HERE:** [https://forms.gle/6oEVvdqYMsnMqMXH9](https://forms.gle/6oEVvdqYMsnMqMXH9)

Tara Dickinson has a background in fine arts and years of teaching expressive art labs to kids & grownups. She enjoys sharing tools to help everyone feel comfortable in the creative process while learning new techniques. She moved to Santa Rosa in late 2021 after growing up mostly in FL and is loving the California lifestyle.

12 spots available, guests are welcome.
The event starts promptly at 6 pm. Please be a little bit early to get settled in with your paper, wine, and supplies

I also encourage attendees to bring snacks, wine or something to drink if they would like (full kitchen on site with wine glasses, small plates, utensils, napkins, hot herbal tea too)..

Brushes up! Wine Down! See you there!

title: The Kitchen Sync - Featuring Andrew Cole | Priest Ranch
description:
The Kitchen Sync: Sips \+ Songs \+ Prix Fixe at Priest Ranch is an elevated dinner and music showcase hosted at the winery’s downtown Yountville Tasting Room, located in the heart of the Napa Valley. Each event features Priest Ranch’s estate-grown wines, a seasonal prix fixe dinner menu crafted by Executive Chef Dan Solomon, and live performances by recording artists in partnership with A&R Worldwide. Guests can expect the unexpected at this intimate and eclectic series that syncs all the senses through wine, food, and the arts.For our February installment, we are welcoming the incredibly talented Andrew Cole. Cole debuted in 2010 with his album Why We Wonder, followed by his 2012 EP Voices, which featured collaborations with artists such as Tom Cochrane, Alex Lifeson, and Kenny Aronoff. In 2014, he was featured on Glenn Morrison’s single “Colourblind,” which climbed to No. 25 on the Canadian Hot 100. Cole has opened for major artists including Elton John, John Fogerty, and Tom Jones, and has recently released two new singles from his upcoming album: “Dreaming” and “Paint.”

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Free talk:  Anne Moller-Racke of Blue Farm Wines shares vine selection tips
description:
Well known, owner/winemaker Anne Moller-Racke of Sonoma’s Blue Farm Wines will offer her educated thoughts on vine selection for your type of vineyard location given your desired outcome  An ampelographer \(vine classification and selection\) of great renown, Anne will both cover the basics and go deep on questions asked at this February talk.

Part of the monthly public education series by the nonprofit Sonoma Home Winemakers club, the talk is no charge, nor is RSVP necessary. 21\+ only please due to wine tasting of our members’ wines during the event. Please bring your own wine glass. I.D. required. Are you a home winemaker? Bring a bottle of yours to share. Want to become a home winemaker? Start here. All welcomed.

In 1981, Anne arrived from Germany to Sonoma, where she worked with legendary winemaker André Tchelistchef. For over three decades, Anne has been farming some of California’s most celebrated vineyards. In 2001, Anne founded The Donum Estate, and over those 18 years she grew Donum to one of the top Pinot Noir producers in California.  

Moller-Racke is one of the top Ampelographers \(identification and classification of grape vines\) in the business.  She and her daughter Hannah Gropman own the seven acre Blue Farm vineyard on San Luis Road in Sonoma.  They make over ten Pinot Noirs and four Chardonnays under the Blue Farm label. 

Celebrating its 40th year, Sonoma Home Winemakers remains one of the region's largest, amateur viticulture and home wine making educational resources. Open to the public, the city of Sonoma based nonprofit promotes on-going education, a speaker series, member-only events and fellowship for beginning and seasoned home wine makers alike. All this in the place where the California wine legend started 200 years ago.  For more information, visit: sonomahomewine.org.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Samba no Pé - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro! Samba no Pé \(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no Pé.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout—all while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM – 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Revolutionary Witchcraft
description:
Where activism meets intention, and change begins with honoring your own power. This monthly gathering, lead by Britt Sandkulla-Sinclair of Golden Thread Alchemy, explores the connection between personal practice and collective action, creating space for those who believe the two are inherently linked. Based on Sarah Lyons' transformative book of the same name, we explore the radical roots of witchcraft as community care, self-preservation, and resistance. From kitchen table remedies to protest protection, historical practices to modern applications, we're reclaiming tools that have empowered the marginalized for centuries. Because let's face it - the world is pretty messed up right now, and looking away isn't an option. We're making a pact with ourselves and each other to stay engaged, even when it's uncomfortable. Join us on the second Thursday of the month from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM at THE EXCHANGE 617 Marin Street in Old Town Vallejo. Revolutionary Witchcraft at The Exchange: Where magic is just change with intention. Tickets: $35 Get Tickets

title: Paint Your Partner Night with Lisa Pedrani
description:
Looking for a Valentine’s celebration that’s a little more memorable than dinner reservations and roses? Join us for Paint Your Partner Night at Barrel Proof Lounge — a fun, guided paint night where you’ll create a portrait of your significant other.

And just to be very clear: you are not actually painting your partner. You’re painting a picture of your partner. This isn't the Playboy Mansion.

An experienced instructor will walk you step-by-step through the process, making this approachable whether you’re an artist or someone who hasn’t picked up a paintbrush since elementary school. The results are always hilarious, heartfelt, and surprisingly charming — no two portraits ever look the same.

This event falls just days before Valentine’s Day, making it a perfect early celebration for couples looking to laugh, sip drinks, and create something together. Expect a relaxed, social atmosphere with great drinks, good music, and plenty of moments you’ll be talking about long after the paint dries.

 All painting supplies included  Free popcorn available all night.  Beer, wine, and Soju cocktails available for purchase.  A fun, creative Valentine’s experience in Downtown Santa Rosa

Pricing: $40 per person $75 per couple

21+ only

Whether your masterpiece ends up fridge-worthy or lovingly unhinged, you’ll leave with a one-of-a-kind keepsake and a great night out.

Check out **www.BarrelProofLounge.com** for all sorts of good times ahead!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: World Ballet Company Presents Swan Lake
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Back to All Shows

World Ballet Company Presents

Swan Lake

Thursday, February 12, 2026

7:00 pm

BUY TICKETS 

The legendary tale of Swan Lake takes flight in a breathtaking production from World Ballet Company, as fate and magic entwine in a timeless battle between good and evil. Featuring a cast of 50 international dancers, over 150 radiant hand-sewn costumes, and stunning hand-crafted sets, this spellbinding performance captures every heart-pounding moment. from the “Dance of the Little Swans” to the Black Swan’s iconic 32 fouettés, and every pirouette in between. 

With Tchaikovsky’s unforgettable score filling the air, immerse yourself in this mesmerizing journey where dreams, heartbreak, and redemption unfold right before your eyes. 

Based in Los Angeles and led by Sasha Gorskaya and Gulya Hartwick, World Ballet Company presents the most beloved and iconic ballets of our time in cities nationwide. Driven by the belief that ballet is for everyone, performances appeal to newcomers and seasoned ballet goers alike. The company attracts many international artists and comprises renowned professional dancers representing over 10 countries. To date, World Ballet Company has traveled to more than 300 cities, reaching an audience of more than 500,000 fans. 

For ages 5 and older. 

 

	          

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Alibi Bookshop February Memoir/Nonfiction Book Club: "The Fire Next Time" by James Baldwin
description:
Please join us on Thursday, February 12th at 7pm for February's Memoir/Nonfiction Book Club, where we will be discussing "The Fire Next Time" by James Baldwin in honor of Black History Month. James Baldwin was a novelist, essayist, playwright, poet, social critic, and His first novel, Go Tell It on the Mountain, appeared in 1953 to excellent reviews, and an influential figure in the growing civil rights movement. Baldwin spent much of his life in France, where he moved to escape the racism and homophobia of the United States. He died in France in 1987, a year after being made a Commander of the French Legion of Honor. A national bestseller when it first appeared in 1963, The Fire Next Time galvanized the nation and gave passionate voice to the emerging civil rights movement. At once a powerful evocation of James Baldwin's early life in Harlem and a disturbing examination of the consequences of racial injustice, the book is an intensely personal and provocative document. It consists of two "letters," written on the occasion of the centennial of the Emancipation Proclamation, that exhort Americans, both black and white, to attack the terrible legacy of racism. Described by The New York Times Book Review as "sermon, ultimatum, confession, deposition, testament, and chronicle...all presented in searing, brilliant prose," The Fire Next Time stands as a classic of our literature. At once a powerful evocation of James Baldwin's early life in Harlem and a disturbing examination of the consequences of racial injustice, the book is an intensely personal and provocative document from the iconic author of If Beale Street Could Talk and Go Tell It on the Mountain. It consists of two "letters," written on the occasion of the centennial of the Emancipation Proclamation, that exhort Americans, both black and white, to attack the terrible legacy of racism. Books are available in the shop, online and ebooks: bookshop.org/shop/alibibookshop and audio: libro.fm/alibibookshop

At once a powerful evocation of James Baldwin's early life in Harlem and a disturbing examination of the consequences of racial injustice, the book is an intensely personal and provocative document from the iconic author of If Beale Street Could Talk and Go Tell It on the Mountain. It consists of two "letters," written on the occasion of the centennial of the Emancipation Proclamation, that exhort Americans, both black and white, to attack the terrible legacy of racism. Books available in the shop, online \(and e-book\), and audio.  Event website

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: David Ramirez
description:
How do you write love songs when you’re heartbroken? How do you sing about hope and passion when yours is lost? How do you finish an album when the relationship that inspired it has ended?

During the Summer of 2017, David Ramirez had fallen in love with a woman who, despite having only just met, felt incredibly familiar to him. There was a scary but comfortable feeling of deja vu within their moments together. “In past relationships, no matter how eager I was to feel loved and to give love, there had always been a hesitation to crawl out of my old life. I didn’t feel this with her,” he recollects.

Ramirez began to pen songs for his next album and hopeful odes to new love spilled out. Songs like “Lover, Will You Lead Me?” filled with vivid images from the heart: I recognized you from some distant dream / Like when it rains on a cold day / I had a chill in my bones / Is it true what they say / “When you know, you know.” 

These were followed by sultry, romantic ballads about how love matures and grows. He wrote “I Wanna Live In Your Bedroom” while sitting on his lover’s bed just minutes after waking up on a hazy fall day. “I was looking around at all the perfectly curated pieces in her room,” he says. “Everything was so intentional and held a story and a place in her heart. I wanted to be one of those pieces.”

One after another, Ramirez poured his soul into a new work of art that covered both the sweet parts of love and the hard times it can bring. He wrote about potential, survival, hope, and encouragement. He wrote about partnership. 

But art is often bred from spontaneity and suffers under the confines of routines and borders. This is a conflicting dynamic that can cause massive problems when you’re building a partnership, when you’re part of a team. A seeming “whatever” attitude can foster insecurity and doubt in a lover. As more and more troubles emerged in his relationship, Ramirez found solace still at the tip of his pen, holding his guitar, sitting at his piano. 

“I was born in August of 1983 just days after Hurricane Alicia had hit my hometown of Houston. As my relationship began ripping at the seams, I started to think of this storm as a precursor to my being born,” Ramirez confides. “Was there something in the universe that imprinted a characteristic of chaos in my blood during my last few days in the womb? Was I destined to wreak havoc everywhere I went?”

Soon, the relationship that had inspired a new burst of creativity in Ramirez and moved him to start writing an album unlike any he had ever attempted before, came to an end. And with that ending, he still had one last song to write. His heart exhausted, he sat on his patio one night and tried to process all of the lyrics that he knew he had written, yet now left him feeling like a stranger to his own story. Through tears and muffled whimpers, he started to write down all of his negative thoughts about love and put the pain of his broken heart into words. From this emotional purge, he began to see the beauty in what he had gone through: the struggle, the pain, the confusion. He soon found himself writing the lyrics that would become album standout “Hallelujah, Love Is Real!”

“I was reminded of a great line in the film Vanilla Sky, ‘The sweet is never as sweet without the sour.’ I decided to celebrate Love,” he explains. “I wasn’t gonna write about how it made me feel in that moment. I was going to write about its existence and how thankful I am having known it.”

This chapter of Ramirez’s life came to a close in the form of his forthcoming 10-song set, My Love Is A Hurricane, recorded with producer Jason Burt at Modern Electric Studios in Dallas, TX. For the first time in his career, he did no pre-production ahead of time, working from gut feelings throughout the process and spending most of his time in the studio on the edge of his seat. The resulting R&B-influenced, piano-driven production is highlighted by heavy basslines and synths with the occasional gospel backing. This experimentation with new melodies and rhythms places Ramirez’s deeply personal songwriting on top of dreamy, groove-driven landscapes that heal the heart and promote positivity while prompting listeners to want to sing \(and dance\) along.

My Love Is A Hurricane is Ramirez’s fifth full-length record and eighth collection of songs. Early albums like American Soil \(2009\) and Apologies \(2012\) put him on the map both locally and beyond, while his STRANGETOWN \(2011\) and The Rooster \(2013\) EPs delivered fan-favorite recordings, “Shoeboxes” and “The Bad Days respectively, that are staple singalongs at his concerts to this day. He made his Thirty Tigers debut with 2015’s FABLES, produced by Noah Gundersen, which features his most widely received single to date, “Harder to Lie.” While this earlier work landed Ramirez firmly in the singer/songwriter canon, a need to do more exploring sonically led to the expansive sound of his most recent album, We’re Not Going Anywhere \(2017\). Influenced by ‘80s bands like The Cars and Journey, it is lyrically reflective of the country’s intense political landscape framed from his perspective as a bi-racial American of Mexican heritage.

As songwriters evolve as people, so does their art, and that could not be more apparent than on Ramirez’s newest offering. The soundscapes utilized on My Love Is A Hurricane may be unlike any recording he has previously crafted, but it's not a departure from his journey. It's a new path created in order to tell a new story. A new canvas needed to hold the scene that his intensely personal lyrics are painting.

“David Ramirez has a voice like a tall tale, one minute strong and thick, the next threadbare and careworn.” — Stereogum

“Mr. Ramirez is a resolutely hesitant singer, never pushing his hurt, letting it instead decay him from within.” — The New York Times

“It's not easy for a writer to maintain the aura of the unspoken in a song. Music and the space surrounding it intensify the impact of confession; the true challenge comes in giving voice to a narrator who's tongue-tied, or simply reticent. Texas singer-songwriter David Ramirez does so beautifully…” — NPR Music

“Quietly mesmerizing” — The Wall Street Journal

“A powerful voice and perceptive pen” — Austin Chronicle

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Paint Your Partner Night with Lisa Pedrani
location: Barrel Proof Lounge, 501 Mendocino Avenue, Santa Rosa, CA
description:
Looking for a Valentine’s celebration that’s a little more memorable than dinner reservations and roses? Join us for Paint Your Partner Night at Barrel Proof Lounge — a fun, guided paint night where you’ll create a portrait of your significant other.
And just to be very clear: you are not actually painting your partner.
You’re painting a picture of your partner. This isn’t the Playboy Mansion.
An experienced instructor will walk you step-by-step through the process, making this approachable whether you’re an artist or someone who hasn’t picked up a paintbrush since elementary school. The results are always hilarious, heartfelt, and surprisingly charming — no two portraits ever look the same.
This event falls just days before Valentine’s Day, making it a perfect early celebration for couples looking to laugh, sip drinks, and create something together. Expect a relaxed, social atmosphere with great drinks, good music, and plenty of moments you’ll be talking about long after the paint dries.
🎨 All painting supplies included
🍿 Free popcorn available all night.
🍻 Beer, wine, and Soju cocktails available for purchase.
💘 A fun, creative Valentine’s experience in Downtown Santa Rosa
Pricing:
$40 per person
$75 per couple
21+ only
Whether your masterpiece ends up fridge-worthy or lovingly unhinged, you’ll leave with a one-of-a-kind keepsake and a great night out.
Check out www.BarrelProofLounge.com for all sorts of good times ahead!

Source: GoLocal Cooperative

title: World Ballet Company Presents Swan Lake
description:
Back to All Shows


World Ballet Company Presents
Swan Lake

Thursday, February 12, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 



The legendary tale of Swan Lake takes flight in a breathtaking production from World Ballet Company, as fate and magic entwine in a timeless battle between good and evil. Featuring a cast of 50 international dancers, over 150 radiant hand-sewn costumes, and stunning hand-crafted sets, this spellbinding performance captures every heart-pounding moment. from the “Dance of the Little Swans” to the Black Swan’s iconic 32 fouettés, and every pirouette in between. 
With Tchaikovsky’s unforgettable score filling the air, immerse yourself in this mesmerizing journey where dreams, heartbreak, and redemption unfold right before your eyes. 
Based in Los Angeles and led by Sasha Gorskaya and Gulya Hartwick, World Ballet Company presents the most beloved and iconic ballets of our time in cities nationwide. Driven by the belief that ballet is for everyone, performances appeal to newcomers and seasoned ballet goers alike. The company attracts many international artists and comprises renowned professional dancers representing over 10 countries. To date, World Ballet Company has traveled to more than 300 cities, reaching an audience of more than 500,000 fans. 
For ages 5 and older. 



	          
THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

description:

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. title: Forró Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of Forró! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forró is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forró.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‘Caminhada’ \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forró—from the mellow ‘Xote’ to the faster, more energetic ‘Pé-de-Serra.’

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Date & Time: Thursdays @7:30PM – 8:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

title: Cheese & Butter Classes
description:
Join award-winning cheesemaker Sheana Davis and wine expert Ben Sessions for unforgettable cheese and butter making classes. Perfect for team building, celebrations, and educational events, our classes are interactive, fun, and easy for everyone. 

From classes on how to make Creme de Ricotta wheel to Mozzarella Pulling to butter-making classes, guests will always leave with a creamy treat to take home \(if it makes it that far!\) – so bring a small cooler with you.  

Food has a remarkable ability to bring people together. 

Cheesemaking classes are perfect for team-building activities, company meetings, team celebrations, staff events, corporate fun, bridal parties, couples classes, girlfriend getaway weekends, LGBT events, EBT education courses, and more. Classes held year-round on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, 12:00-2:00 and 3:30-5:30pm. 

See the full schedule of all our cheese and butter making classes here.  

With each class, we give back to the community by providing meals for food-insecure seniors in Sonoma Valley. After learning how to make cheese, our guests can prepare these meals and write personal notes for the seniors on the lids.  

Join us in making a positive impact while having fun and learning a new skill.   

Your Cheesemaking Experience: 



Begin with local wine and an artisanal cheese tasting.

Learn to make cheese and compound butter with everyday ingredients and tools.

Enjoy specialized classes for dishes like lasagna and gourmet grilled cheeses.

Exclusive guest cheesemakers often share their techniques.

Ideal for corporate events, bridal parties, getaways, and more.



Sheana and Ben pride themselves on using ingredients readily available in any local grocery store, with cooking supplies used reside in most home cooks’ kitchens. Guest cheesemakers are often available to showcase their own cheeses and techniques, making the class a truly unique experience. 

Check the schedule for Wine Country-based cheesemaking classes.  

Customize Your Class:To arrange private or corporate classes at venues like Sonoma Fairmont Mission Inn or Silverado Resort, contact us at sheanadavis@gmail.com. We can help create a unique and unforgettable experience for your entire group! Private and corporate classes may be arranged and are hosted at various Wine Country venues, including The Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn, Silverado Resort, The Lodge in Sonoma, and private homes and estates. 

To register: 

https://theepicureanconnection.com/events/

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?* art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?* is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit’s core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU’s Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Intro to Painting Landscapes in Watercolor
description:
Fridays, January 9 – February 13, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$270 – Registration Fee $10 – Materials Fee $280 – Total Registration Fee

Learn watercolor landscape fundamentals. Build skills in value, color, and composition through a step-by-step layering process.

What you’ll do

This 6 week class focuses on the fundamentals of watercolor landscape painting. Participants will enhance their observational skills and practice watercolor techniques by working from photographs. Instructor Hannah Day teaches a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. The class will focus on strengthening observational skills, training the student to see value and color which provides a foundation to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process. We will cover essential elements of rendering a scenic painting, including composition, color temperature, value, linear perspective, and atmospheric perspective. Gain a new appreciation for the beauty of your surroundings through the process of painting a landscape one layer at a time.  All levels of experience are welcome, including total beginners! Materials are provided, but students are encouraged to bring their own watercolor palette if they have one. 

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 208

title: Big and Small; Pinching Pots with Dan Clauson
location:
North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
Fridays, January 30 – March 13, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Art Departments, Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

$230 Registration Fee $30 Materials Fee $260 Total Registration Fee

A class that is all about pinching! With instructor Dan, students will learn handbuilding methods to coil and pitch their vessels. With specific direction in learning the techniques to build any size of pot, from a large scale vessel to a small cup. We will learn how to support scaling up our forms through drying methods, interior ‘bone’ structure, and mastering directionality with our hands. There will be a focus on how we each make a mark upon a pot, and how to do so with purpose. Each student will create work that reflects the time-honored nature of handbuilding; when intention is given to the silhouette of a form, the lip of a cup, and/or the comfort of a handle. Each class will involve a warmup, a demo, and worktime. Most classes will have \(fun&thoughtful\) homework.

Required Class Supply List

You can view the requires class supply list here.

Room 117, Ceramics Studio

title: 54 Years of the Annex Galleries
description:
An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States. Ranging from the 16th century to today, our inventory also includes oils, watercolors, sculptures, and more. Included will be Gustave Baumann, Stanley William Hayter, Rembrandt, the Yoshida family, June Wayne, Bertha Lum, Hiroshige, Mauricio Lasansky, Claire Falkenstein, Picasso, Whistler, and hundreds more. In addition to our regular hours, we will be offering a guided tour every Saturday beginning at 3p.m.

title: Understanding the History and Use of the Term "Latinx"
description:
Understanding the History and Use of the Term “Latinx”

Los Cien Program

The term Latinx emerged as an alternative to Latino and Latina, aiming to provide gender inclusivity and cultural recognition across diverse identities within the Latin American diaspora. Yet, its adoption has sparked deep discussion and, at times, division within our community.

This program invites a thoughtful, respectful dialogue about the evolution of this term — exploring its linguistic roots, social context, and the varied perspectives it evokes among Latin American, Chicano, and Hispanic communities in Sonoma County and beyond. The goal is to foster understanding, connection, and belonging through an informed and inclusive conversation that honors our community's diversity.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

description:
**WHAT:** Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

**DATE:**            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

**TIME:** 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

**WHERE:**       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

**LINK:**             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

**DETAILS:**

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         **Offered Daily:** 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         **Experience length:** 2 hours

·         **Wines:** Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. In inclement weather, this experience will be hosted in our charming tasting room.

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Valentine's Day Celebration at Coppola
description:
Celebrate  Valentine's Day February 13th-15th with a romantic weekend at Francis Ford Coppola Winery. Guests are welcomed with a complimentary splash of Reserve Rosé, plus special Valentine's pricing on Reserve Rosé 6-packs and cases throughout the celebration. The Tasting Room features 2-for-1 tastings at the main bar, along with a complimentary pour of Port paired with chocolate for a sweet, indulgent finish. At Rustic Restaurant, enjoy a Valentine's Surf & Turf for Two, available in addition to the regular menu. This shareable, family-style platter includes a Stemple Creek Farm New York steak, two locally made crab cakes, and grilled cauliflower, served at the center of the table for a romantic dining experience. Reservations are recommended-celebrate the love of wine, food, and great company at Coppola.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: A Sweet & Savory Valentine's at Pellegrini-Olivet Lane
description:
Sweet & Savory Valentine's Experience at Pellegrini-Olivet Lane takes place February 13-16, 2026, inviting guests and their special someone to celebrate where olive and vine come together in perfect harmony. This Valentine's weekend tasting features Olivet Lane Estate wines paired with the estate's olive oil in a flavorful, indulgent experience. Guests will enjoy artisan bread dipped in estate olive oil, followed by a decadent house-made olive oil cake with whipped ricotta. Each bite is complemented by a curated flight of four wines, encouraging guests to mix and match flavors for a personalized tasting journey.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sparkling Valentine’s Tasting at Cuvaison
description:
Celebrate Valentine’s season with a sparkling experience surrounded by the beauty of the Tai vineyard, where rolling vineyards and tranquil scenery set the mood.

Guests will enjoy a curated flight featuring elegant sparkling wine alongside expressive estate selections, perfect for savoring together. The experience invites you to slow down, toast to February, and indulge in the beauty of wine country.

**Group Size**:

Up to 4 guests, including non-tasters

**Duration:**

Please allow 60-90 minutes for this experience

**Admission:** $60 per person

**Available:** Daily through the month of February, reservation required

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Arts Guild of Sonoma Presents: For the Love of Art
description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Learn more at  artsguildofsonoma.org .

title: Lunar New Year Celebration with Chef Martin Yan
description:
Join us Saturday, February 14th at Rotation by Feast it Forward for a vibrant afternoon honoring culture, cuisine, conversation, and the Lunar New Year.

1:00 - 4:00PM

Legendary chef Martin Yan invites guests on a culinary journey with A Taste of China.

Your ticket includes full access to:

\* 2 LIVE COOKING DEMONSTRATIONS (1:00 & 3:00pm)

\* A tasting of five authentic signature dishes, thoughtfully prepared to showcase tradition, technique, and storytelling.

\* Martin Yan Cookbook (included) for book signing, offering a rare opportunity to connect with one of the most influential figures in global cuisine.

\* Surprise-and-delight entertainment designed to celebrate the energy and symbolism of the Lunar New Year.

Craft cocktails and wine will be available for purchase.

This event marks the soft opening of our Chef Residency series, launching an exciting new chapter at Rotation and setting the tone for an ongoing celebration of culinary excellence, cultural exchange, and shared experience—led by Chef Yan and rooted in community.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Shut Up & Write!™ Santa Rosa REMOTE ZOOM FRIDAY
description:
Shut Up & Write!® Wine Country
**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We’ve discovered that it’s strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it’s true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal

Source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

title: Creations Ling-Yen Jones, jewelry, Jim Docker, wood and Bea Acosta, ceramic & baskets
description:
Gualala Arts invites the community to experience “Creations,” a group exhibition featuring the distinctive works of three local artists—Ling-Yen Jones, James Docker, and Bea Acosta. This compelling blend of art and craft opens with a reception on Friday, February 13, from 4 to 6 p.m. in the Jacob Foyer. The exhibit will remain on view through March 8, offering visitors a chance to explore the unique perspectives and materials each artist brings to their practice.

James Docker, a seasoned woodworker and designer, brings decades of craftsmanship and conceptual depth to the show. With a Master of Fine Arts from San Francisco State University and formative years spent studying in Kyoto, Japan, Docker’s work reflects a rich tapestry of influences—from Japanese boro textiles and tea ceremony aesthetics to the geometric clarity of Piet Mondrian. His pieces often echo the improvisational structure of jazz, a genre he reveres, and his approach to wood has been described as “quilting in wood.” Docker’s career spans over 60 years, including custom home design throughout The Sea Ranch, Napa Valley, and the Bay Area. His knife blocks and boards, originally crafted for friends and neighbors, exemplify his commitment to both beauty and utility.

Jewelry artist Ling-Yen Jones offers a striking contrast with her finely wrought silver, semi-precious stones, and pearls. Based in Mendocino County, Jones creates one-of-a-kind pieces that range from traditional to modern, often incorporating motifs such as leaves, birds, and windows—symbols of growth, hope, and transformation. Her training includes studies with David Laplantz at Humboldt State University, Monterey Peninsula College, and workshops at the Mendocino Art Center. Jones is also the gallery coordinator for the Coast Highway Artist Collective in Point Arena and has exhibited widely across Northern California. Her work, including evocative pieces like “Unmentionables,” draws inspiration from the Ukiyo-E period of Japanese art, blending expressive faces with hidden floral and romantic imagery to explore themes of serenity and everyday grace.

Bea Acosta rounds out the trio with her creations in clay and pine needle basketry. Since discovering her passion for clay in 2000, Acosta has studied under Kay Like of Brandybuck Studios, embracing hand-building techniques and natural finishes such as saggar firing with seaweed and horsehair. Her journey expanded in 2004 to include pine needle basketry, where she now devotes most of her creative energy. Using materials like Watsonia and Amaryllis leaves, sweet grass, and sea grass, Acosta weaves vibrant, one-of-a-kind forms that often transcend traditional basket function. Her “pine needle woven creations” are meditative, free-form expressions that reflect a deep reverence for nature and ancestral memory. Living on the coast continues to inspire her intuitive, organic approach to making.

Together, Jones, Docker, and Acosta offer a rich and varied exhibition that celebrates the intersection of artistry and craftsmanship. “Creations” promises to be a feast for the senses and a testament to the creative spirit thriving along the Mendonoma coast. 

Creations

title: Roberta Weir: A Creative Legacy
description:
The City Arts Gallery, located at the  Arts Council Headquarters, is proud to present a special exhibition featuring Roberta Weir, a Vallejo-based artist whose work reflects a lifetime immersed in creativity, mentorship, and visual storytelling.

Roberta Weir was an art mentor to Jerry Garcia of the Grateful Dead, and this exhibition includes a selection of Garcia’s artwork shown alongside her own. Together, the works highlight a rare and meaningful artistic relationship and a shared creative spirit that bridges visual art and music culture.

“We are honored to feature Roberta Weir at City Arts Gallery,” said Carmen Slack, Executive Director of the Solano County Arts Council. “Her connection to an important chapter of American music history, combined with her own unique artistic vision, makes this exhibit truly special for our community.”

The City Arts Gallery is dedicated to highlighting exceptional regional artists and providing accessible, high-quality cultural experiences in downtown Vallejo. This exhibition continues that mission by celebrating a local artist whose work resonates far beyond the gallery walls.

This thoughtfully curated exhibit offers visitors a unique opportunity to experience the intersection of fine art, mentorship, and cultural history, revealing a lesser-known dimension of Jerry Garcia’s creative life while honoring Roberta Weir’s lasting influence and artistic vision.

The exhibition also acknowledges the broader creative ecosystem surrounding Garcia, including his connection to legendary concert promoter Bill Graham, whose influence extended through many artists and cultural figures. Several local artists in the Vallejo arts community share historical and creative ties to this vibrant era of music and art.

The opening of the exhibition will be during the free Vallejo Art Walk on Friday, February 13, 2026, at City Arts Gallery, 420 Virginia Street, downtown Vallejo.The City Arts Gallery is dedicated to celebrating exceptional regional artists and presenting engaging exhibitions that are accessible to the public and rooted in community.

title: Becoming Independent Hosts Annual Crab Feed Fundraiser
description:
*Sonoma County event features unlimited crab, live auction and performances by program participants*

**WHAT:** Becoming Independent, a nonprofit supporting adults with disabilities live meaningful and independent lives, is hosting their annual Crab Feed fundraiser. Attendees can enjoy unlimited crab, live music, raffle prizes, live  auction and musical and comedy performances by program participants. Beer, wine and cocktails will be available. Dinner includes crab, salad, pasta, and bread.

"The Crab Feed brings together friends, supporters, and partners who believe in the mission of BI and the power of community,” said Luana Vaetoe, CEO of Becoming Independent.. The generosity and excitement in the room directly support and uplift the people we serve, giving meaning and purpose to the evening."

**WHEN:** 5-8 p.m. Friday, Feb. 28, 2026

**WHERE:** The Backdrop  1455 Corporate Center Pkwy, Santa Rosa

**RSVP:** Tickets are available here: https://becomingindependent.thundertix.com/events/256413 

**ABOUT BECOMING INDEPENDENT**

Becoming Independent (BI) is a nonprofit community benefit organization supporting the full spectrum of needs for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) in the North Bay, including the need for education, housing, access to healthcare, food security, and mental and emotional health support. Since its inception in 1967, BI has been committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. Learn more at http://becomingindependent.org.

Our Music, Wine & Dine Night pairs the high-energy, crowd-pleasing sounds of The Renovators with delicious sushi and Japanese-inspired dishes from Sushi Shoubu.

The Renovators bring an upbeat mix of familiar favorites that sets the tone for a relaxed and social evening surrounded by barrels and warm winery ambiance. Enjoy Longboard’s wines by the glass or bottle while Sushi Shoubu serves fresh sushi and beautifully crafted Japanese dishes, made to order with quality ingredients.

title: Grains of Sand - Film Screening, Discussion and Collage Workshop
description:
Grains of Sand is a positive “coming-of-age” story about two women in their 80s. Filmed over eight years, the documentary accompanies the filmmaker’s mother and mother-in-law, artists and close friends, as they enter their ninth decade. The Grains of Sand Film Screening will be followed by a Collage Workshop designed to engage with the themes of the film and use them to reflect on our own lives.

THE FILM

Margot & Barbara, close friends and artists, meet for a work retreat in a stone farmhouse in the German countryside. They are both about to turn 80. As they begin to work on the large stones they have brought to sculpt, they embark on a conversation about creativity and aging, exploring what it means for them to arrive at this stage of their lives. Their wrinkled hands become dusty as they scrape and chisel the stones.

THE DISCUSSION

With humor and empathy, Grains of Sand demystifies the aging process and builds identification with the protagonists. The film collapses the experience of eight years into 85 minutes. This moving narrative arc invites people of all ages to engage with what it means to grow old and what matters most as we do so.

THE COLLAGE WORKSHOP

Art for Barbara and Margot is a way of living. Throughout the film, art transcends the sensual experience to become also a way of reflecting on life itself.

Building on the film, Collage Workshop participants will have a chance to experiment in a tactile, visual realm. We discuss scenes from the film which continue to resonate for us, and at the same time begin to play with color and shapes on the page. We can use the materials in front of us to fold in thoughts, memories and references to lived events. Participants find themselves sharing aspects of who they are and connecting with the other participants in unexpected ways. The conversation with those around us at the table becomes a dialogue with ourselves, a kind of collage self-portrait in the materials we bring to paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Black History Exhibit
description:
Petaluma Blacks for Community Development cordially invites you to our annual Black History Exhibit. Please join us for a wonderful evening of music, a docent lead viewing of the exhibit, food and wonderful champagne. This is a treat you don't want to miss. We are celebrating Valentine's Day and the opening of our 2026 Black History Exhibit. Music by Skylaer Palacios/Dave Amato Skylaer Palacios is a singer-song writer, dancer, actress, model and teacher of the performing arts hailing from Sonoma County. She performs and releases music under the moniker Sky Palace, singing with a warm, earthy tone that can change from soulful to ethereal at a whim. Her work can be seen and heard on screen, stage, and by streaming her music online. Dave Amato is a soulful guitarist that always plays from the heart. For over 30 years he has been performing, teaching, recording, and writing music in the San Francisco Bay Area. Dave draws upon his many influences and experiences to create an original voice. Steeped in jazz, blues, funk and rock, his unique style and sound exists somewhere between Wes Montgomery and Jimi Hendrix.

title: 3 Acre Holler at Redwood Cafe
location: Redwood Cafe, 8240 Old Redwood Hwy, Cotati, CA
description:
3Acre Holler is singer Cori Wood and singer/multi-instrumentalist Layne Bowen. Based in Sonoma County, California, 3 Acre Holler derives it’s name from Cori’s family property near Forestville, CA. Cori and Layne have played in a variety of bands together in northern California for a number of years and began their duet as a way to perform songs that didn’t quite fit the happy band mold. They are drawn to Appalachian inspired material and particularly like those songs with darker themes. Unrequited love, moonshine, tragedy and death are frequent visitors to their song list. In addition to their own songs, Cori and Layne give their take on songs by contemporary writers such as Gillian Welch, Martha Scanlon, The O’Kanes, Casey Chambers and guys named Hank. They do like to sing a few happy songs about love, birds and butterflies as well, so don’t worry about leaving one of their gigs in a mopey mood. Instead, you will likely leave their gig with respect for the talent and material they present and possibly with a copy of their new cd in your hand!

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. No experience is necessary to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Journey Beyond Sound Duos with Sanaz Sounds presents Journey of the Heart

A heart-centered sound ceremony for connection and balance during the season of love. This ceremonial sound bath invites you to slow down, soften, and reconnect through meditative sound and intention, offering space to unwind and settle into a deeper sense of presence.

The experience features crystal and metal singing bowls, gong, chimes, and intuitive sound, creating a calm, supportive atmosphere that honors both the sacred masculine and divine feminine. We will offer tarot card pulls and a sacred tea ceremony as part of the evening, inviting reflection and gentle integration. Bring a small sacred object for the centerpiece. Come solo or with a partner, loved one, or friend to share a meaningful evening of presence, reflection, and connection.

title: Intermediate Salsa with Tyler
description:
Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?

Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. In this class, you’ll go beyond the basics to learn intricate footwork, enhance your leading and following skills, and master the body movement that will make you shine on the dance floor. This class is for anyone ready to learn the techniques and intermediate steps needed to take their dancing to the next level.

You’ll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

Master complex turn patterns and combinations.

Strengthen your lead and follow for seamless, connected dancing.

Adapt to different partners and music with ease on the social dance floor.

What to Expect: Instructor Tyler blends a fun, supportive atmosphere with structured lessons, so you’re always challenged but never overwhelmed. Helping you progress steadily while keeping the joy of salsa front and center.

Details:

No partner necessary—rotations ensure everyone dances.

Please wear non-marking shoes to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

When: Fridays, 6:30 PM – 7:30 PM

Instructor: Tyler Crandall

Where: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8, San Rafael, CA

title: Beginner Salsa Friday
description:
Join our beginner salsa class. No experience or partner is needed. Just comfortable shoes and desire to have fun!

Great for first timers!

No dance experience required

Non-marking shoes soles

No partner necessary

We know it can be challenging to learn something new. As such, the beginner salsa class is geared for people who are starting out or those that are returning to refresh their skills. Our relaxed environment is perfect for learning salsa basics, as we make it fun and enjoyable. In this class you will learn basic directional steps, proper frame for partner-work and simple turn patterns. We organize our curriculum so that the movements are easy to remember. Join us to learn the fundamentals! No experience is necessary and no partner is required. Drop-in fee is $20.

title: The Bleeding Roses--a lights out Valentines Haunted House
description:
sKreamZ Haunted Attractions will set hearts racing this February at The Bleeding Roses, a Limited Valentine’s Lights-Out Haunted House Experience

Walk the haunt with only a single flashlight beam… and a whole lot of nerve.

FAIRFIELD, CA This Valentine’s season, romance comes with a warning: fear blooms after dark. sKreamZ Haunted Attractions is launching an all-new, limited-engagement event — “The Bleeding Roses: A Lights-Out Haunted House” — running February 6, 7, 13, and 14 in Fairfield.

Guests will navigate the haunted house in near total darkness, guided only by the light of a single flashlight beam — and whatever courage they can hold onto. Bring your friends, your date, or anyone brave enough to lock hands and keep moving when the light hits something you wish it hadn’t.

Valentine’s Date Night, Upgraded

If dinner-and-a-movie feels predictable, “The Bleeding Roses” offers a more unforgettable kind of Valentine’s tradition:

·       A true lights-out walkthrough \(one flashlight beam per group\)

·       Limited showing — only four nights running from 7pm to 10pm each night.

·       A free photo opportunity for guests \(limited engagement availability\)

·       No advance tickets — tickets sold at the door only.

Love is in the air… and so are the sKreamZ.

Proceeds Benefit Fairfield PAL’s Career Café

Beyond the thrills, “The Bleeding Roses” supports something bigger: proceeds will benefit the Fairfield PAL Career Café, a program helping local teens build real-world career readiness through coaching, workplace skills, and exposure to career pathways.

In a community where many teens face barriers to employment, mentorship, and professional networks, the Career Café helps students gain confidence, practice communication, explore careers, and connect with adults who can open doors. Funds raised from this event help PAL expand those opportunities — so more teens can move from “not sure what’s next” to “I’ve got a plan.”

Event Details

What: The Bleeding Roses: A Lights-Out Haunted House \(sKreamZ Haunted Attractions\)

When: February 6, 7, 13 & 14

Doors Open: 7:00 PM.  Come early to beat the lines.

Tickets: $14 per person \(sold at the door only; no tickets in advance\)

Where: 1795 Pennsylvania Ave., Fairfield, CA

Website: sKreamZ.com

Notes: Waiver required. Not recommended for ages 10 and under. Parent guidance required for ages 14 and under.

About sKreamZ Haunted Attractions

For 20 years, sKreamZ Haunted Attractions has been creating immersive, high-intensity seasonal haunted experiences designed to push the limits of fear, atmosphere, and storytelling — with special events that give the community a reason to scream together.

About Fairfield PAL

Fairfield PAL is open to all Fairfield, Suisun, and Travis teens ages 13–18 who are currently enrolled in school. Membership is free with a student ID and parent/guardian signature. Interested teens can apply at the Fairfield Community Center or contact PAL at 707-330-8757 for more information.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: SALOME by Oscar Wilde
description:
Banned in England!

A Valentine’s Night of Desire, Decadence, and Mischief

If you’re tired of pink hearts, cupids, and predictable Valentine’s plans—and you’re craving something darker, stranger, and a little more dangerous — SALOME by Oscar Wilde invites you to celebrate love in a far more decadent way. SALOME is an immersive masquerade experience set in the decadent court of king Herod.

This is an intimate, reservation-only experience.

Seating is strictly limited to 20 guests, and tickets will not be sold at the door. Advance purchase is required—reserve your seat now before the experience sells out. Guests are encouraged to dress in costume and become part of the court itself for this outrageous night of dark glamour, forbidden desire, and delicious mischief.

A night out. A story. An experience you'll remember forever.

Perfect for Valentine’s dates, adventurous friends, or anyone who prefers their romance served with a little danger.

Costumes encouraged. Memories guaranteed.

Go to salome2026.wordpress.com for more information and to reserve your seats today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Love Letters
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Love Letters is based on the lifelong, intimate correspondence of these two characters whose entire story unfolds through written words exchanged in the form of letters. In a relationship spanning 50 years, their letters contain their hopes and ambitions, dreams and disappointments, victories and defeats throughout their separate lives.

This production will reprise the performances of Madeleine Keegan O’Connell, CEO of YWCA Sonoma County, as Melissa Gardner, and former Press Democrat columnist Chris Smith as Andrew Makepeace Ladd III. The longtime Sonoma County friends first appeared in Love Letters in 2016.

title: JASMIN ‘IOLANI HAKES
description:
SANTA ROSA -- Copperfield's Books welcomes award-winning author Jasmin ‘Iolani Hakes to Montgomery Village for her stunning new novel - The Pohaku. Embrace the Aloha spirit with a reading and warm discussion followed by an audience Q&A and book signing. This is a free event, registration recommended. From the award-winning author of Hula, a dazzling saga that moves from Hawaii to California and back, about the generations of women tasked with protecting the history and place that made them. A young woman lies in a hospital bed in a coma, watched over by her estranged grandmother. Some say she jumped off the cliff; others say she was swept away by a wave. But her tutu at her bedside suspects something else is wrong, that the reason for the hardship and heartbreak in their family history is tied to a story that she's never told-one about a powerful stone, the pohaku, that her family was tasked with protecting generations ago. In fits and starts, the grandmother begins . . . We travel back in time to the eighteenth century, when the explorer James Cook becomes the first European to visit the Hawaiian Islands. Cook arrives in pursuit of an ancient prophecy, a key that would unlock the mysteries of the world, but he is killed before he can learn about the mysterious stone-a stone born alongside future Hawaiian royalty, the key to something even more powerful than Cook could have imagined. So begins a thrilling family saga of the women charged with protecting the pohaku, as it is taken from Hawai'i to California and possibly beyond, bringing fortune to the well-intentioned and misfortune to the bad. But with each successive generation, the fractures caused by its displacement widen until it becomes clear that the pohaku's story must survive if there is to be any hope at all of the family's-and a nation's-reconciliation with their home, with nature, and with each other. Reminiscent of Yaa Gyasi's Homegoing, Min Jin Lee's Pachinko, and Tommy Orange's There, There, The Pohaku is an immersive and bold novel about the history, perseverance, and resilience of the Hawaiian people. Author: Jasmin ‘Iolani Hakes was born and raised in Hilo, Hawai'i. She is the author of the novel Hula, winner of HONOLULU Magazine's 2024 Book of the Year. She is the recipient of the Best Fiction award from the Southern California Writers Conference, a LoJo Foundation Scholarship, a Writing by Writers Emerging Voices fellowship, and residencies from Hedgebrook, VCCA, and Storyknife. title: YWCA Sonoma County Presents Love Letters
description:
Back to All Shows

YWCA Sonoma County Presents

Love Letters

Friday, February 13, 2026

7:00 pm

BUY TICKETS 

Celebrating 50 years of service to the community, the domestic violence service provider YWCA Sonoma County is presenting for one show only, a fundraising performance of Love Letters, the acclaimed play by A.R. Gurney. 

The production will reprise the performances of Madeleine Keegan O’Connell, CEO of YWCA Sonoma County, as Melissa Gardner, and former Press Democrat columnist Chris Smith as Andrew Makepeace Ladd III. The longtime Sonoma County friends first appeared in Love Letters in 2016. 

Ticket sales for the play will raise much-needed funds for YWCA’s vital and singular domestic violence programs serving local families who find themselves in danger in their homes – the place we should all feel safest. For 50 years, YWCA Sonoma County has been the county’s answer to the need by families for refuge, advocacy, and support with domestic violence. 

Love Letters is based on the lifelong, intimate correspondence of these two characters whose entire story unfolds through written words exchanged in the form of letters. In a relationship spanning 50 years, their letters contain their hopes and ambitions, dreams and disappointments, victories and defeats throughout their separate lives. 

After debuting in 1988, Love Letters quickly moved to both Off-Broadway and Broadway productions. Over the years, the roles were performed by notable actors such as Brian Dennehy and Mia Farrow, Carol Burnett with Dennehy, and Alan Alda and Candice Bergen, as well as Angelica Huston and Stacy Keach, Diana Rigg and Martin Sheen. 

According to Madeleine Keegan O’Connell, “In addition to the basic needs of food, clothing and shelter, people deserve respect, dignity and safety to conduct productive lives and care for their children. YWCA is honored to be a leader in the efforts to address needs so many people take for granted.”  

Chris Smith, who retired from the PD in 2021 but still contributes to the newspaper on occasion, said, “Bringing the power of the written word and the lost art of letter writing together with support for YWCA Sonoma County is a winning combination for me.” 

 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: 7minutesMAX Storytelling
description:

Hilarious or sublime, poignant and personal tales told through the ancient oral tradition of storytelling, this evening will be sure to move, delight & intrigue you. This is an event for mature audiences & not intended for children. Interested storytellers will have a chance to throw their name in the hat to present their story.
