title: Date Night Ceramics with Shoshana Parry
description:
One Night of Handbuilding

Friday, February 13th: 7-9pm

Bring your partner, your bestie or your mom because clay is more fun together!

Cost: $150 for two people – a larger group is also welcome!

Skill Level: All levels, great for beginners. Date: February 13th, from 7-9pm

Want to learn the basics of handbuilding pottery in a relaxed and fun atmosphere? Join me in my Fairfax studio for this one night class. Everything will be provided including as little or as much instruction as you want and need. Fees include clay, tools for your use, glaze, and firing. Be ready to get a little dirty! What to Expect After class your work will be glazed \(using the glaze of your choice\), fired, and ready for pick up within a few weeks

If you love this experience, consider signing up for a whole class session! Individuals will be eligible for $25 off the price of the session.

Please contact me to sign up for class or if you have any questions: shoshanaparry@yahoo.com or \(415\) 302-2559

Source: Press Democrat

title: SALOME by Oscar Wilde
description:
Banned in England!

A Valentine’s Night of Desire, Decadence, and Mischief

If you’re tired of pink hearts, cupids, and predictable Valentine’s plans—and you’re craving something darker, stranger, and a little more dangerous — SALOME by Oscar Wilde invites you to celebrate love in a far more decadent way. SALOME is an immersive masquerade experience set in the decadent court of king Herod.

This is an intimate, reservation-only experience.

Seating is strictly limited to 20 guests, and tickets will not be sold at the door. Advance purchase is required—reserve your seat now before the experience sells out. Guests are encouraged to dress in costume and become part of the court itself for this outrageous night of dark glamour, forbidden desire, and delicious mischief.

A night out. A story. An experience you'll remember forever.

Perfect for Valentine’s dates, adventurous friends, or anyone who prefers their romance served with a little danger.

Costumes encouraged. Memories guaranteed.

Go to salome2026.wordpress.com for more information and to reserve your seats today.

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Social Contractors Rock Murphy's Irish Pub!
description:
"….get ready for the super-entertaining sounds of local band The Social Contractors. They totally rock, in all the right ways…” - Argus-Courier

Join us for an evening of upbeat original rock and classic hits you know and love from the 60s-90s \(e.g. The Beatles, Jimi Hendrix, The Police, Men At Work, The Doors, Pink Floyd, Steely Dan, U2, and more\).

With dynamic guitar and saxophone solos interspersed between melodic vocals and a tight rhythm section that will draw you to the dance floor, The Social Contractors are thrilled to return to Murphy's Irish Pub for another evening of free live music in the heart of historic downtown Sonoma!

The four-piece local lineup for the evening include singer/songwriter/guitarist Jason E. Davies, Travis Thayer of Cozy Cats and Blue 7 \(saxophone, keyboard, vocals\), Chris Oatman of the Receders \(drums\), and special guest artist Alex Fabian-Davies \(bass\)!

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: Thornton Wilder's The Skin of Our Teeth
description:
The Skin of Our Teeth is Thornton Wilder’s bold, three-part allegory of human survival. It follows the Antrobus family through ages of natural disaster, war, and renewal. Blending surrealist comedy with epic drama, the play captures humanity’s continual struggle to endure “by the skin of our teeth”—an urgent message in today’s world of conflict and climate crisis.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description:
In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Scrooge! The Musical
description:
The heroine in this actor’s tour-de-force is an ordinary middle class English housewife. As she prepares chips and eggs for dinner, she ruminates on her life and tells the wall about her husband, her children, her past, and an invitation from a girlfriend to join her on holiday in Greece to search for romance and adventure. Starring Jennifer King \(Bad Dates, Belle of Amherst.\)

Shirley Valentine runs February 6th - 22nd, 2025

Thursday - Saturdays at 7:30pm

Sundays at 2:00pm 

For Tickets Call:

707-484-4874

www.sonomaartslive.org

1989 Tony Award Nominee By Willy Russell

Directed by Sharon Winegar

Starring Jennifer King 

Shirley Valentine” is presented by arrangement with Concord Theatricals on behalf of Samuel French, Inc. 

www.concordtheatricals.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Indie After Dark
description:
Indie After Dark – Vallejo’s Night for Original Music

September 12 performers:

🔥 Agness Twin

San Francisco’s hypnotic post-punk / indie project led by Elisa Ovrahim. Gorgeous layered vocals, ringing guitars, cinematic folk shadows, and minimalist ethereal pop. Their new album Turn To Gold \(2024\) was mastered by John Golden \(Soundgarden, Melvins\) and has already carved its place on indie radio. Fresh from the Love & Rockets tour, Agness Twin’s live set will swallow you whole.

🔥 Pro-Pain!

Bay Area 4-piece that’s “HAVING A BLAST.” High-voltage energy, pure grit, and a sound built to light up the room. With their recent Bombs Away video, they’re proof that Vallejo’s underground scene is very much alive and screaming.

Every Second Friday, Indie After Dark brings the spotlight to independent music at the intimate and vibey 4th Corner Speakeasy in downtown Vallejo. Just steps from the heart of the Vallejo Art Walk, this monthly series invites you to discover bold new sounds in a setting made for connection—where the lights are low, the cocktails are strong, and the music runs deep.

Come early for the art, stay late for the music. It’s a night where Vallejo’s creative soul shines.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: SALSA PARTNER DANCING
description:
Ready to step up your salsa game? Salsa – partner dancing class build on the basics, introducing exciting new turns, footwork, and partner patterns to elevate your dancing.

Must have intermediate steps in place

Proficiency in lead/follow & turns

Proficiency in timing & partnership

No partner necessary

This class is designed for dancers who have a solid foundation in salsa fundamentals and are ready to take their skills to the social dance floor. Moving beyond basic steps and patterns, we’ll focus on the essential techniques, musicality, and partner-work dynamics that make for confident and enjoyable social dancing. Drop-in fee is $20 and no partner is required.

Date & Time: Fridays @ 7:30PM – 8:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Indie After Dark presents The Living Castles with  Wonderland Rejects
description:
The Living Castles are a Vallejo-based three-piece blending dreamy indie-rock atmospheres with sharp post-punk textures. Rooted in the local scene and featured in the Indie After Dark series, their sound balances mood, movement, and melodic tension.

Joining them are Wonderland Rejects, an Oakland queer riot grrrl punk trio with a mission. Fierce, loud, and unapologetic, they channel queercore energy into songs that confront bigotry head-on—one explosive set at a time.

Two bands. Two worlds. One night of raw, cathartic, independent music.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Friday Night Comedy - Phil Johnson - Downtown Santa Rosa
description:
Friday night stand-up comedy in Downtown Santa Rosa

VIP TABLES NOW AVAILABLE! Snag a table for 4 with preferred seating, your own private call button to summon service, and your first round of drinks (or a bottle of wine) for only $95!

Every Friday night hilarious comedians from The Bay Area and beyond perform at Barrel Proof Lounge. Stick around after for late-night karaoke &DJ Dancing!

Fresh lineup of funny each Friday.

This Week: Casey Williams (host) Jeremy Talamantes Juan Carlos

Headliner: Phil Johnson “A benchmark of intelligent zaniness.” – The Milpitas Post “A ‘raging optimist’ is how Johnson describes himself and his comedy reflects his love of upbeat topics and eschews the snarky, negative tone of many others.” – Solano Daily Republic “Comedian Phil Johnson tickles crowds with his jocular jams.” – The San Jose Metro “Phil continued his show with intense energy to the very last joke. His jokes spared no one and spun so quickly at times he would wait for the audience to catch up. ” – The Copper Gazette

Biography Phil Johnson is a man who gets mistaken for a woman, but only by those not paying attention. That revelation kicks off a battle for self-awareness where comedy and music are the weapons of choice. It’s a battle that has taken Phil to such esteemed festivals as the Edinburgh Fringe and Sundance Film Festivals and the Top 8 Finals of the World Series of Comedy .

“I’ve always been the guy who isn’t quite what people expect,” says Phil. Using that experience, Phil pokes holes in the medical marijuana argument, discusses being a white guy at a hip hop show (and the innocent gestures that can get him in trouble), and reveals why Hawaii isn’t the paradise we think it is. From Shakespearean bees to redneck vampires to anthropomorphic cell phones with weight issues, Phil Johnson fills the stage with quirky characters that combine social satire with absurdist flights of fancy. Then the guitar comes out and kicks the show into an even higher gear with songs about the bright future (and dark past) of babies and what he would do if he woke up one morning as an actual woman.

On stage, Phil’s playful humor and likeable, endearing manner allow him to shake things up without antagonizing the audience. In the end we can only be who we are, try to understand others, and hope they understand us.

21+ Doors - 7p / Show - 8p $15adv / $20door

Check out **www.BarrelProofLounge.com** for all sorts of good times ahead.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Phil Johnson and Roadside Attraction Comedy and Music
description:
Headlining!

Phil Johnson delivers a high-energy comedy experience that seamlessly blends stand-up and music. With a sharp eye for the absurd and a linguist’s love of wordplay, he tackles topics like tech, body image, race, and American weirdness - all delivered from the viewpoint of a guy who happily grew up in the deeply multi-everything community of the San Francisco Bay Area.

Phil’s material is smart, satirical, and unafraid to ask bigger questions while still chasing the laugh.

He’s been featured at the Sundance Film Festival, Edinburgh Fringe Festival, on Sirius/XM, Bob & Tom Radio, and Amazon Prime. Phil has released multiple comedy specials and albums that showcase his signature blend of tightly written jokes, catchy \(and occasionally naughty\) songs, and a performer’s instinct for balancing insight with irreverence.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sgt. Splendor & Eric McFadden & Kate Vargas
description:
Before joining forces, the duo behind Sgt. Splendor were already formidable solo artists, Kate Vargas chalking up acclaim at outlets like NPR, SPIN, and Vice \(including praise from the “Dean of American Rock Critics” Robert Christgau\); and Eric McFadden amassing an impressive resume including stints on guitar with George Clinton & the P-Funk All Stars, Fishbone’s Angelo Moore, and Eric Burdon & The Animals, plus a slew of solo albums, and session work with everyone from Jackson Browne to The Clash’s Joe Strummer.

Sgt. Splendor’s intoxicating chemistry on the new album has its roots not just in enduring friendships, but also in the love and connection of its creative partners, Vargas and McFadden. After circling each other’s orbits for a time, they finally met at a songwriting retreat hosted by Pat MacDonald \(of Timbuk 3 / “Future’s So Bright I Gotta Wear Shades” fame\) in Sturgeon Bay, WI, initially bonding over yet another parallel, a New Mexico upbringing. Their Southwestern roots upbringing come through with Sgt. Splendor—combining mysterioso desert and carnivalesque Waits-ian vibe.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: KIZOMBA
description:
In this beginner class, students will learn the foundational steps, posture, and body movement that make Kizomba both elegant and accessible. You’ll practice how to connect with the music, build comfort in partner connection, and develop the confidence to dance socially.

No partner is needed to join! Whether you are brand new to partner dancing or looking to add a new style to your repertoire, this class will give you the tools to start enjoying Kizomba on the dance floor right away.

Drop-in fee is $20 and no partner is required.

Date & Time: Fridays @ 8:30PM – 9:30PM

Instructor: Tyler Crandall

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Social dancing after class 9:30 pm – 11:30 pm

After comedy, Barrel Proof is NO JOKE .

When the laughs end, The After begins. DJ Dev takes control of the room with late-night energy, a packed dance floor, and a crowd that knows how to do Friday right.

title: Valentine's Safari Tour for the Grown Ups!
description:
Unleash your Wild Side! While you might not witness animals in courtship \(unless you're incredibly lucky\), you'll embark on an extraordinary adventure that combines entertainment and education. Get ready to discover your wild side at our Valentine's Safari Tour and Celebration \(adults-only\)! Join our expert guides aboard our open-air safari vehicle as they reveal the captivating ‘Ins and Outs' of animal courtship. From the rhythmic grunts of a warthog to the enchanting rituals of African mammals and birds, you'll be spellbound by the romantic tales of the wild.   Cost: $175 per person-price includes applicable tax and gratuity. Rates will be itemized once items are in your cart. Saturday, February 14th, or Sunday, February 15th! Cost: $175 Per Person-price includes applicable tax and gratuity. Adults Only. Valentine Package Includes: Decadent Repast and the ‘Amour' Celebration will take place in the Elephant Room. 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Beverage service, oyster bar and appetizers available 12:30 PM Decadent Repast: Wild Love Bite's featuring a guilty pleasure wild dessert 1:30PM ‘Amour' Celebration: A titillating, fundiscussion onthe ‘ins and outs' of animal courtship 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM Safari Sex Tour! \(Adults Only\) At Safari West, we wholeheartedly embrace our role as caretakers of a diverse array of wildlife, and this event offers a truly unique glimpse into the ‘ins and outs' of animal courtship. But here's the kicker - it's not just a barrel of laughs; it's a wild and enlightening expedition that unveils the mysteries of how animals discover their perfect match, build families, and safeguard their territory. Get ready to laugh out loud and swoon with amazement as we spill the beans on the animal kingdom's quest for love! Plus, who knows, you might also discover the wild side in you! The experience includes a delectable feast, a fun discussion on animal courtship, and an exclusive Safari Adult Tour where you'll encounter giraffes, rhinoceroses, wildebeests, cape buffalos, zebras, and more. Don't miss out on this adults-only adventure - let your wild side run free this Valentine's Day at Safari West! If you have any questions, please call \(707\) 566-3667 or email us at  Reservations@safariwest.com . Decadent Repast Why only Adults?... "Love Bites Meal" Young Lettuce with Herbed Avocado Ginger Carrot Soup Fresh Oyster Bar with Condiments Steak with Garlic Shrimp On a bed ofPolentaand Grilled Asparagus Vegetarian Option: Stuffed Portobello Mushroom Over Herb Risotto and Grilled Asparagus Guilty Pleasure Desserts \*Subject to change\* We're putting a different spin on our educational safari tours with the 25th annual Valentine's Safari Tour \(a.k.a. Safari West Adult Sex Tour\). Pile into an open-air safari vehicle and drive out among some of the world's most exotic and enthralling creatures for a wild safari tour led by Safari West's animal experts as they probe the revealing "Ins and Outs" of Wildlife courtship. You'll learn intimate details about the mating habits of African mammals and birds including Bongo, Giraffe, Eland, Wildebeest, Gazelle, Zebra, Warthog, Cheetah and more! …When a male warthog wants to attract a female, he does a courtship "chant" of rhythmic grunts that sounds like an engine in need of a tune-up. Yes, love is in the air! You'll even discover amazing facts about domestic animals and insects, like the common fruit fly, which has the longest sperm of any living creature. For the perfect ice breaker, we will offer some ‘pun' condoms during the ‘Amour' Celebration before the tour from the Center for Biological Diversity. Interested in learning more about how you can help save wildlife? Check out more at . title: Esalen Massage Retreat at Solage
description:
Reconnect and unwind at the Couples’ Esalen® Massage Retreat, a restorative weekend designed to deepen intimacy, trust, and presence. Held Saturday–Sunday, February 14–15, 2026, from 10:00 AM–5:00 PM, this immersive experience takes place in the serene Aurora Event Space at Solage and includes a one-hour lunch and short breaks each day.    Guided by certified instructor Joseph Richard Nase, couples explore mindful, heart-centered touch through hands-on learning. Over two days, partners practice full-body massage, fluid transitions, and Esalen® techniques that cultivate awareness, relaxation, and connection—leaving with practical tools to bring mindful touch into daily life.    Includes a 20% discount on same-day spa services. Participants must be 18\+.

title: Celebrate Valentine's weekend at Spoonbar
description:
This Valentine&'s, Spoonbar, h2hotel's signature restaurant will offer a selection of Valentine's-inspired specials and festive cocktails available from February 13 - 15, alongside its regular menu. The special menu highlights seasonal dishes including Dungeness Crab Salad with fresh avocado, winter citrus and foraged green, Ricotta Gnocchi served with braised short ribs, black trumpet mushrooms, and black truffles, and a 14 Day Dry Aged Flannery Beef Tomahawk Steak topped with potato puree, hedgehog mushroom and spinach and bacon. For those looking for cocktails to accompany the dinner, the restaurant also offers festive cocktails such as Raspberry Chocolate Martini with vanilla vodka, baileys chocolate and Chambord, Roses are Red with vodka, rose water, lemon juice and champagne, and the Ex's Baggage, a mix of pomegranate, tequila, cardamom syrup, cucumber and lime juice. title: Cheese & Butter Classes
description:
Join award-winning cheesemaker Sheana Davis and wine expert Ben Sessions for unforgettable cheese and butter making classes. Perfect for team building, celebrations, and educational events, our classes are interactive, fun, and easy for everyone. 

From classes on how to make Creme de Ricotta wheel to Mozzarella Pulling to butter-making classes, guests will always leave with a creamy treat to take home \(if it makes it that far!\) – so bring a small cooler with you.  

Food has a remarkable ability to bring people together. 

Cheesemaking classes are perfect for team-building activities, company meetings, team celebrations, staff events, corporate fun, bridal parties, couples classes, girlfriend getaway weekends, LGBT events, EBT education courses, and more. Classes held year-round on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, 12:00-2:00 and 3:30-5:30pm. 

See the full schedule of all our cheese and butter making classes here.  

With each class, we give back to the community by providing meals for food-insecure seniors in Sonoma Valley. After learning how to make cheese, our guests can prepare these meals and write personal notes for the seniors on the lids.  

Join us in making a positive impact while having fun and learning a new skill.   

Your Cheesemaking Experience: 



Begin with local wine and an artisanal cheese tasting.

Learn to make cheese and compound butter with everyday ingredients and tools.

Enjoy specialized classes for dishes like lasagna and gourmet grilled cheeses.

Exclusive guest cheesemakers often share their techniques.

Ideal for corporate events, bridal parties, getaways, and more.



Sheana and Ben pride themselves on using ingredients readily available in any local grocery store, with cooking supplies used reside in most home cooks’ kitchens. Guest cheesemakers are often available to showcase their own cheeses and techniques, making the class a truly unique experience. 

Check the schedule for Wine Country-based cheesemaking classes.  

Customize Your Class:To arrange private or corporate classes at venues like Sonoma Fairmont Mission Inn or Silverado Resort, contact us at sheanadavis@gmail.com. We can help create a unique and unforgettable experience for your entire group! Private and corporate classes may be arranged and are hosted at various Wine Country venues, including The Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn, Silverado Resort, The Lodge in Sonoma, and private homes and estates. 

To register: 

https://theepicureanconnection.com/events/

Source: Press Democrat

title: Circus / Trapeze Summer Camp Registration
description:
Summer 2026 Circus Camp \(ages 6-8, 9-14\), Trapeze Camp \(ages 7-17\), and Aftercare. Spots still available but filling fast!

Circus Camp Ages 6-8: A fun and supportive way to experience a variety of circus arts and related crafts such as juggling, unicycling, tumbling, clowning, springboard & mat work. Each Friday, we'll host a showcase performance at the end of the day for families to highlight skills learned during the week.

Circus Camp Ages 9-14: Offered as a two-week session to allow our older students to build a more in depth show over the course of two weeks. Students will have the opportunity to try all sorts of circus techniques and build acts together.

Flying Trapeze Ages 7-17: A favorite of all our campers! Experience what it's like to truly fly on a 32-foot flying trapeze rig, with a net of course! Students work at their own level and on individual tricks with showcases at the end of each week.

Circus Camp Aftercare: Care after 1:00 PM is offered for ages 6-14, until 3:30 PM. Only those registered for Circus Camp may register for Circus Camp Aftercare \(no farm camp attendees, please\).

title: Medic First Aid CPR and AED Training
description:
Course Description: This course goes a step beyond basic CPR. In this four-hour class, students will learn information and skills to provide effective emergency care to an injured or ill person before first responders arrive. The workplace is the focus, using industrial and office settings for the scenario-based learning environment. CPR, plus other lifesaving skills including bleeding control, choke saving, hazardous conditions awareness, and an introduction to the AED. Each students receives a manual, instruction, mannequin use and Medic First Aid card valid for two years. Course Audience: The class-of-choice for non-medical people, this class is the perfect course for any individual who would like to be prepared to respond to a cardiac emergency, anytime and anywhere. Great for on-site training for employees who have a duty to respond to a cardiac emergency due to job responsibilities or regulatory requirements.

description:

Feb 13, 4-6pm Opening Celebration Reception with coffee and coffee drinks for purchase, great food delights, drinks, desserts and good people.

Sat, Feb 14, 9am-3pm, free coffee tasting, breakfast for purchase, prepared coffee and drinks, live music, local and Flyway Festival vendors, presentations, a guided birding and nature walk.

Sun, Feb 15, food and drinks, live wild bird show, Birding 101, EarthTeam Interns, Flyway Festival vendors, artists, and exhibitors, rock painting followed by Myrna Hayes 70th Birthday Party from 2:30-3:30pm.

Oh, this is going to be WILD with “Fri the 13th”, Valentine’s Day on Saturday the 14th and my 70th birthday on Sunday the 15th. Epic 30th Flyway Festival!

title: Laguna Stewards Day/ Día de Laguna Stewards
description:
Love nature? Hosted by the Laguna de Santa Rosa Foundation, join us for Laguna Stewardship Day at Taylor Mountain! Meet at the North Entrance \(Kawana Terrace parking lots\) to plant native rushes, sedges, and oaks near a drainage in the Colgan Creek Watershed. Help protect the creek, restore habitat, and get your hands dirty in a beautiful setting! Bring: long pants, closed-toe shoes, sun protection, and water. We’ll provide tools, snacks, and fun facts about vernal pools. Only heavy rain cancels. In partnership with Sonoma County Regional Parks. Funding support by Sonoma County Ag \+ Open Space.

¿Amas la naturaleza? Organizado por la Laguna de Santa Rosa Foundation, ¡únete al Día de Stewardship en Taylor Mountain! Encuéntranos en la Entrada Norte \(estacionamiento de Kawana Terrace\) para plantar juncos, ciperáceas y robles cerca de un drenaje en la cuenca de Colgan Creek. Es una forma divertida de proteger el arroyo, restaurar hábitat y conectar con tu comunidad mientras disfrutas del aire libre. Trae pantalones largos, zapatos cerrados, protección solar y agua; nosotros llevamos las herramientas, refrigerios y datos curiosos sobre las charcas de lluvia. Solo se cancela por lluvia intensa. En asociación con Sonoma County Regional Parks. Apoyo financiero de Sonoma County Ag \+ Open Space.

title: Waterwheel Bookbinding
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 14, 2026 9:00 AM – 11:30 AM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$80 – Registration Cost $15 – Materials Fee $95 – Total Registration CostHands-on workshop introducing Masunaga’s Waterwheel Binding: build a simple model, explore variations, and spark ideas for artists.

What you’ll do

In partnership with Amu Arts, the Sonoma Community Center is pleased to offer three special workshops on February 14th, given by guest artists visiting from Japan. Register for more than one workshop and receive a 10% discount. Sign up for all three to make it a full day experience at 20% off! In this workshop, participants will learn the structure of Masunaga’s original bookbinding technique “Waterwheel Binding” by creating a simple model. The session offers a hands-on introduction to the technique and invites participants to explore its unique creative potential. The structure lends itself to many variations, and it can serve as a source of new ideas for participants’ own artistic projects. Waterwheel Binding is a bookbinding technique originally developed in 2011 for the work The Intersection. Instead of using glue, single-sheet pages are woven into an accordion-folded cover with narrow paper strips. The technique can be adapted in many ways by changing the materials or the scale, giving participants the freedom to develop their own creative ideas. The workshop is intended for participants who have an interest in making things – such as artists or those with some bookbinding experience – rather than complete beginners.

Japanese Guest Artist Bookmaking Series

This class is part of a 3 part series. Register for 2 classes using the code double to receive 10% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes. Register for 3 classes using the code triple to receive 20% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: BLS Certification Class (American Heart Association)
description:
BLS Certification Class \(AHA\) - In Person, Instructor-Led

American Heart Association BLS certification class \(in-person, instructor-led class in our Rohnert Park classroom\). BLS \(Basic Life Support\) is the required CPR class for healthcare providers. Includes cardiac and respiratory arrest management, CPR, AED use, and choking treatment for all ages. This class is appropriate for initial BLS or BLS renewal.

Vive CPR is an American Heart Association \(AHA\) Training Site. AHA "BLS Provider" certifications are issued on the same day.

We also offer Blended Learning BLS certification courses \(online course plus in-person Skills Session\).

Learn from a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/bls-certification/

Questions? Call/text \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Park Rx—Beginner Hiking for Fitness
description:
The Hiking for Fitness Series is back! Join us on this fitness program, where the leaders will guide you on a series of 8 weekly hikes with the challenge increasing each week. Before the first hike, the leader will discuss proper shoes, hydration, incorporating hiking poles, proper pacing, etc. The group's final hike aims for the long route up Brushy Peaks Trail, where hikers can enjoy the beautiful vistas.

The following is a list of possible routes selected for this hiking series: 1) Sat 1/3 - White Barn to Uranus, 2.1 miles, 180 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 2) Sat 1/10 - Meadow- Hillside loop, 3 miles, 490 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 3) Sat 1/17 - Lake Ralphine & Spring Lake loop, 4.3 miles, 420 ft elev \[meet @ Howarth Park's Boathouse\] 4) Sat 1/24- Jack London State Historic Park, May’s Clearing, 3.5 miles, 820 ft elev \[meet @ upper parking lot, 2400 London Ranch Road, Glen Ellen, CA 95442\] 5) Sat 1/31 - Vista Trail loop, 3.5 miles, 830 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 6) Sat 2/7 – Stern + Waterfall loop, 2.7 miles, 750 ft elev \[meet @ main lot\] 7) Sat 2/14 – Sonoma Valley Regional Park & Lake Suttonfield loop, 4.3, miles, 770 ft elev \[meet at Valley of the Moon Trailhead on Arnold Dr.\] 8) Sat 2/21 – Hillside to Neptune picnic table, 4.4 miles, 970 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\]

Please note these routes or dates are subject to change depending on logistics such as heavy rains or non-passable water crossings. Wear appropriate footwear for rocky/slippery trails and layers. Bring at least a quart (32oz) of water, and if desired, a snack. The group will be limited to 35 participants. 

The hiking series costs $80 (plus a $10 parking fee per visit. Note that the Sugarloaf Annual Pass is $59 and valid at Sugarloaf and Jack London SHP), or free-of-cost for participants with a November 2025 or newer Park Rx from a Sonoma County Medical Provider. Go to https://sugarloafpark.org/activities/parks-rx-program/ for information on our Park Rx program and to download the form. The number of **available Park Rx tickets is limited**; **please have your Rx ready at the time of sign up**.

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That’s why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps: You’ll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work: Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns: We’ll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We’ve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required: Whether you’ve never danced before or it’s been a while, you’re welcome here!

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

Date & Time:

Thursdays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM Fridays @ 5:30PM – 6:30PM Saturdays @ 9:00 AM – 10:00 AM

Instructor: Lucie Ebnerova

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Morning Hike at Shiloh
description:
Go Wild Hikers
What are you doing Valentines day morning? Join us for a hike.
Canyon trail aka the back country of Shiloh Ranch Park is one of our favorite hikes. Come join the group for an early morning hike. Best for individuals with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet**
Shiloh Ranch Regional Park
5750 Faught Rd, Windsor, CA 95492
Give yourself enough time to arrive, use the restroom & pay park fee. It often takes longer than you think.

**The Hike**
Ridge, Creekside, Pond, Mark West Creek, Canyon and Big Leaf trails - A loop hike.
Length - +/-4.5 miles/ 7.24 kilometers
Elevation change - +/-650 feet/198 meters
Difficulty - 6 out of 10 - Moderately easy
Exposures - +/-30% sun/70% shade - rocky, poison oak, ticks/ insects, may be muddy this time of the year.
Bring plenty of water. At least 34 oz./1 liter.
Dogs - Not permitted
Facilities at trail head - Picnic tables, shade and restrooms
Cost - $5 cash.
Parking - $8 Regional Parks fee or free on the street.
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water, a hat, a snack and layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**When We Meet**
Saturday February 14, 2026
900 am - 1130 am
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or Any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately.**

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers

description:
The Hiking for Fitness Series is back! Join us on this fitness program, where the leaders will guide you on a series of 8 weekly hikes with the challenge increasing each week. Before the first hike, the leader will discuss proper shoes, hydration, incorporating hiking poles, proper pacing, etc. The group's final hike aims for the long route up Brushy Peaks Trail, where hikers can enjoy the beautiful vistas.

The following is a list of possible routes selected for this hiking series: 1\) Sat 1/3 - White Barn to Uranus, 2.1 miles, 180 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 2\) Sat 1/10 - Meadow- Hillside loop, 3 miles, 490 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 3\) Sat 1/17 - Lake Ralphine & Spring Lake loop, 4.3 miles, 420 ft elev \[meet @ Howarth Park's Boathouse\] 4\) Sat 1/24- Jack London State Historic Park, May’s Clearing, 3.5 miles, 820 ft elev \[meet @ upper parking lot, 2400 London Ranch Road, Glen Ellen, CA 95442\] 5\) Sat 1/31 - Vista Trail loop, 3.5 miles, 830 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 6\) Sat 2/7 – Stern \+ Waterfall loop, 2.7 miles, 750 ft elev \[meet @ main lot\] 7\) Sat 2/14 – Sonoma Valley Regional Park & Lake Suttonfield loop, 4.3, miles, 770 ft elev \[meet at Valley of the Moon Trailhead on Arnold Dr.\] 8\) Sat 2/21 – Hillside to Neptune picnic table, 4.4 miles, 970 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\]

Please note these routes or dates are subject to change depending on logistics such as heavy rains or non-passable water crossings. Wear appropriate footwear for rocky/slippery trails and layers. Bring at least a quart \(32oz\) of water, and if desired, a snack. The group will be limited to 35 participants. 

The hiking series costs $80 \(plus a $10 parking fee per visit. Note that the Sugarloaf Annual Pass is $59 and valid at Sugarloaf and Jack London SHP\), or free-of-cost for participants with a November 2025 or newer Park Rx from a Sonoma County Medical Provider. Go to https://sugarloafpark.org/activities/parks-rx-program/ for information on our Park Rx program and to download the form. The number of available Park Rx tickets is limited; please have your Rx ready at the time of sign up.

title: Overeaters Anonymous (OA) Newcomer Meeting
description:
**Is Food a Problem for You? You Are Not Alone.**

Overeaters Anonymous (OA) is a fellowship of people who support each other in recovering from compulsive eating and food behaviors. If you feel you have a problem with food, OA welcomes you—no matter what your background, beliefs, or eating habits. 

We hold an in-person newcomer meeting on first, second and fourth **Saturdays of the month from 9:45 - 10:15 AM at** ​**Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Marin, 240 Channing Way, San Rafael CA 94903**. Contact: Sue M. 415-298-6792​. You may view all North Bay OA in-person and online meetings at https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

In OA, members experience **spiritual, emotional, and physical recovery** by practicing the **Twelve Steps** and living by their spiritual principles—one day at a time.

OA is **not** a diet club or calorie-counting program.

Members have different plans of eating.

OA does **not** endorse any specific food plan. 

If food is causing problems in your life, you don’t have to struggle alone. Recovery is possible, and help is available.

**Visit:** https://www.northbayoa.org/

**Find a meeting:** https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bird of Prey Hike at Lynch Canyon
description:
This February 14th hike will be at Lynch Canyon in correlation with the San Francisco Bay Flyaway Festival.

Please note: the hikes are free, however, donations will be accepted for Solano Land Trust and West County Hawkwatch . Parking at Lynch Canyon is $5 via cash or check.

Each year from fall through late winter West County Hawkwatch leads weekend hikes so people can learn about the birds of prey that call the Solano Land Trust properties their home.

During this viewing season, bring your binoculars and join a group to see the magnificent bids that rely on our protected agricultural open spaces for habitat. Birders of all levels of experience are welcome.

For a complete schedule of West County Hawkwatch events, visit the group’s website at: westcountyhawkwatch.com or its Facebook page.

\*Photo credit: Pamela Hawken \(Pamelarosehawkenphotography.com\)

\*\*There is a $5 parking fee at Lynch Canyon. This is payable by cash or check and will need to be submitted when you arrive to the park. Permits will need to be placed on vehicle dashboards. Citations will be given to vehicles that do not have visible permits.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Valentines Day Vistas & Vino at Jack London State Historic Park
description:
A special Valentine’s Day hike at Jack London State Historic Park, open to couples, singles, friends, and anyone 21 and older who simply loves the outdoors.  This guided 3.25-mile roundtrip hike travels from Jack’s Beauty Ranch and through the redwoods, following paths that inspired Jack London’s deep connection to the land. Along the way, take time to enjoy the scenery, fresh air, and good company.  At a scenic viewpoint, the group will pause to enjoy a complimentary glass of wine, generously provided by Lasseter Family Winery, before heading back down the trail. Come take in the sights, raise a glass, and enjoy a Valentine’s Day surrounded by nature.

title: Paws and Pours
description:

This dog-friendly experience invites wine lovers and pet parents to enjoy a relaxed day of exceptional wines, beautiful surroundings, and tail-wagging companionship.

Guests are welcome to bring their well-behaved, leashed dogs to enjoy treats, water stations, and plenty of space to socialize, while humans sip and savor Dutton-Goldfield’s renowned wines. Whether you’re celebrating with a partner, friends, or your pup, it’s the perfect way to spend a Valentine’s Day afternoon in Sonoma County.

Expect a laid-back, welcoming atmosphere ideal for mingling, sipping, and making memories — with or without a Valentine.

**Well-behaved, leashed dogs only. Guests must be 21+ to consume alcohol.**

title: The Poetry of Love: A Valentine's Day Poetry Workshop with Colette Lafia
description:
The Poetry of Love: A Valentine’s Day Poetry Workshop with Colette Lafia

February 14, 10 am - 11:30 am PT / 1-2:30 pm ET

Love is something we live, often quietly, in the ordinary moments of our days. In this Valentine’s Day poetry writing workshop, spiritual director and author Colette Lafia invites participants to explore the poetry of love as a form of prayer. Drawing from her new book, Leaving the Shore: Experiencing Poetry as Prayer, Colette will guide us into a gentle, contemplative space where writing becomes a way of listening—to our lives, to love in its many forms, and to the presence of the Divine moving within and around us.

Together, we will slow down and create a holy spaciousness around our experiences of love: romantic love, self-love, divine love, love shaped by longing, grief, devotion, and grace. Through guided writing prompts, brief readings from her new book, quiet reflection, and contemplative pauses, participants will allow words to emerge as poetry and prayer: tender, imperfect, and true.

During our time together, you’ll be invited to:

Experience poetry writing as a contemplative, prayerful practice

Listen for the poetry of love unfolding in your life

Write in response to guided prompts rooted in sacred listening

Reflect in quiet community, with space for sharing if desired

All are welcome, whether you’ve written poetry before or are new to it. Come and write your way into love.​

Participants are encouraged to get a copy of Leaving the Shore: Experiencing Poetry as Prayer, as it will be used throughout the workshop.

Register at https://www.stcolumbasinverness.org/poetry-of-love

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Seasonal Sourdough Focaccia
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 14, 2025 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Category: Culinary Arts

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$100 – Registration Cost

Learn to make artisan sourdough focaccia with natural fermentation, whole grains, and seasonal toppings. Take home dough and starter to bake!

What you’ll do

Focaccia is the best suited for homebakers who want to make bread at home. This hands-on experience will guide you through basic knowledge of the natural slow fermentation process using sourdough starter to create nourishing bread for your daily meal with seasonal ingredients. As you learn to mix, knead, fold, and shape, you will start to gain a connection with your dough and how gluten works to create fluffy focaccia bread. With my passion for whole grains, I will guide you on how to incorporate whole grains into your flour mix to make your focaccia more hearty and wholesome. We will cover what seasonal ingredients would be best to top the focaccia and what to avoid.  You will get to taste focaccia and a side salad for lunch, and bring home some dough to bake the next day, now that you know what to do and a starter for your next sourdough baking adventure.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Online: Heart Practices for Couples--Cultivating Mindful Awareness
description:
with Debra Chamberlin-Taylor, MA and George Taylor, MFT

This Valentine’s Day workshop offers couples an opportunity to cultivate emotional presence, empathy, and shared joy and love. To be intimate, we must learn to be fully present. Through partner meditations, verbal and nonverbal communication exercises, and group discussion, participants will practice the art of intimacy and evidence-informed skills that strengthen connection and emotional understanding to deepen the shared journey. Debra and George, both psychotherapists and married for 44 years, bring warmth, humor, and extensive clinical experience to this exploration of relational mindfulness. This program is designed and appropriate for couples, as much of the day involves partner practices.

**Important note:** This event is not appropriate for attending alone, as the majority of the day will be spent in partner practice. *BOTH partners must register for the program separately, even if you will be sharing a Zoom account. Program rate is per person.*

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Free Rowing Lessons in Classic Rowboats
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn the timeless—and beautiful—art of rowing? The Floathouse crew is here for you! This season, every Saturday from January 17 to March 28, we’ll host free rowing lessons for adults. Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mushroom Hike
description:
Explore the hidden world beneath our feet on this mushroom hike led by local mycologist George Riner. We'll observe their growth, learn to identify different species by key traits, be mesmerized by the display of colors, shapes, textures, and discuss these remarkable organisms' ecological roles, culinary delights, and even a touch of folklore. 

Be prepared for two miles of leisurely walking and chatting over moderate and possibly muddy terrain. Please be aware this is **not a foray**; collection is permitted for this activity through a yearly CA State Parks Scientific Research and Collecting permit. Fungi information is for educational purposes only. Foraging is illegal in CA State Parks.

You must purchase a ticket through this page to attend. Tickets are $10 for general audiences, $5 for students, youth (12-17 years old; children under 18 years old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian), Sugarloaf members, Sugarloaf and RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Meet outside the Visitor Center ten minutes prior to the event start time. 

Wear layers and appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water, and if you have them, mushroom identifying guides. We invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rain cancels; parking fees apply. Parking fees apply.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: 54 Years of the Annex Galleries
description:
An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States. Ranging from the 16th century to today, our inventory also includes oils, watercolors, sculptures, and more. Included will be Gustave Baumann, Stanley William Hayter, Rembrandt, the Yoshida family, June Wayne, Bertha Lum, Hiroshige, Mauricio Lasansky, Claire Falkenstein, Picasso, Whistler, and hundreds more. In addition to our regular hours, we will be offering a guided tour every Saturday beginning at 3p.m.

title: Cuentos con Ritmo (Stories with Rhythm)
description:
Cuentos con Ritmo \(Stories with Rhythm\)

Cuentos con Ritmo | Cuentos \* Música \* Movimiento 

Presentado por Colors of Spanish 

Cuentos con Ritmo es una oportunidad única semanal para niños de 1 a 5 años y sus familias, el cual aporta alegría, comprensión y aprecio por la lengua española a toda la comunidad. Durante Cuentos con Ritmo, los pequeños visitantes y sus familias participan de forma lúdica en historias interactivas con música y movimiento fortaleciendo nuestra diversa comunidad y entusiasmo por la lengua meta. 

Cuentos con Ritmo es presentado por Guadalupe Tausch en colaboración con la organización que fundó, Colors of Spanish. Originaria del estado de Guanajuato en México, tiene una maestría en español con énfasis en la adquisición de una segunda lengua para la primera infancia y continúa sus estudios enfocada en la primera infancia especializándose en la adquisición de idiomas a través de la música/movimiento. Colors of Spanish ofrece talleres para profesores, bibliotecarios y cuidadores y organiza programas de cuentos en español con música y movimiento en escuelas, bibliotecas y museos locales. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Cuentos con Ritmo | Cuentos \* Música \* Movimiento 

Presented by Colors of Spanish 

Cuentos con Ritmo \(Stories with Rhythm\) is a weekly one-of-a-kind opportunity for children ages 1-5 and their families that brings joy, understanding and appreciation for the Spanish language to Spanish- and English-speaking speakers alike. During Cuentos con Ritmo, young visitors and their families playfully engage in interactive stories with music and movement that build community and an excitement for language! 

Cuentos con Ritmo is presented by Guadalupe Tausch in collaboration with the organization she founded, Colors of Spanish. Originally from the state of Guanajuato in México, she has a master’s degree in Spanish with emphasis in second language acquisition for early childhood and continues her study of childhood and music/movement trainings. Colors of Spanish provides workshops for teachers, librarians and caregivers and hosts Spanish story time with music & movement programs at local schools, libraries, and museums. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Designed for kids 1-5, families, and siblings.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Salsa Beginner Marin – Saturday
description:
**Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?** Join on on Saturday – Salsa Beginner Marin

Are you a beginner who’s always wanted to learn salsa? Salsa classes are designed to help you build a strong foundation. In this class, you’ll learn the fundamental footwork, practice the basic turns, and understand the essential body movement that will make you feel confident on the dance floor. This class is perfect for anyone ready to learn the techniques and foundational steps needed to start their salsa journey.

Salsa is fun, and we make learning it stress-free! Our relaxed, beginner-friendly class is the ideal starting point. You don’t need a partner, nor any dance experience!

In this class you will learn:

Basic directional steps that form the foundation of salsa.

Proper frame for comfortable and effective partner-work.

Simple, easy-to-remember turn patterns.

Get ready to learn the fundamentals and have a great time!

**Details:**

**No partner necessary**—rotations ensure everyone dances

Please wear **non-marking shoes** to protect the floor

Arrive 10 minutes early; warm up and settle in

**When:** Saturday, 10:00 am – 11:00 am

**Where:** 4140 Redwood Highway #8, San Rafael, CA

There will be a silver dollar drawing every hour of the show, and a special all-gold drawing to be held Saturday February 14 at 4pm.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Paws and Pours
description:
Celebrate Valentine’s Day with your favorite plus-one — including the four-legged kind — at Paws & Pours at Dutton-Goldfield Winery. This dog-friendly experience invites wine lovers and pet parents to enjoy a relaxed day of exceptional wines, beautiful surroundings, and tail-wagging companionship.

Guests are welcome to bring their well-behaved, leashed dogs to enjoy treats, water stations, and plenty of space to socialize, while humans sip and savor Dutton-Goldfield’s renowned wines. Whether you’re celebrating with a partner, friends, or your pup, it’s the perfect way to spend a Valentine’s Day afternoon in Sonoma County.

Expect a laid-back, welcoming atmosphere ideal for mingling, sipping, and making memories — with or without a Valentine.

Well-behaved, leashed dogs only. Guests must be 21\+ to consume alcohol.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Mushroom Hike
description:
Explore the hidden world beneath our feet on this mushroom hike led by local mycologist George Riner. We'll observe their growth, learn to identify different species by key traits, be mesmerized by the display of colors, shapes, textures, and discuss these remarkable organisms' ecological roles, culinary delights, and even a touch of folklore. 

Be prepared for two miles of leisurely walking and chatting over moderate and possibly muddy terrain. Please be aware this is not a foray; collection is permitted for this activity through a yearly CA State Parks Scientific Research and Collecting permit. Fungi information is for educational purposes only. Foraging is illegal in CA State Parks.

You must purchase a ticket through this page to attend. Tickets are $10 for general audiences, $5 for students, youth \(12-17 years old; children under 18 years old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian\), Sugarloaf members, Sugarloaf and RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Meet outside the Visitor Center ten minutes prior to the event start time. 

Wear layers and appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water, and if you have them, mushroom identifying guides. We invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rain cancels; parking fees apply. Parking fees apply.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Online: Heart Practices for Couples--Cultivating Mindful Awareness
description:
with Debra Chamberlin-Taylor, MA and George Taylor, MFT

This Valentine’s Day workshop offers couples an opportunity to cultivate emotional presence, empathy, and shared joy and love. To be intimate, we must learn to be fully present. Through partner meditations, verbal and nonverbal communication exercises, and group discussion, participants will practice the art of intimacy and evidence-informed skills that strengthen connection and emotional understanding to deepen the shared journey. Debra and George, both psychotherapists and married for 44 years, bring warmth, humor, and extensive clinical experience to this exploration of relational mindfulness. This program is designed and appropriate for couples, as much of the day involves partner practices.

Important note: This event is not appropriate for attending alone, as the majority of the day will be spent in partner practice. BOTH partners must register for the program separately, even if you will be sharing a Zoom account. Program rate is per person.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Free Rowing Lessons in Classic Rowboats
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn the timeless—and beautiful—art of rowing? The Floathouse crew is here for you! This season, every Saturday from January 17 to March 28, we’ll host free rowing lessons for adults. Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: Press Democrat

title: 54 Years of the Annex Galleries
description:
An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States. Ranging from the 16th century to today, our inventory also includes oils, watercolors, sculptures, and more. Included will be Gustave Baumann, Stanley William Hayter, Rembrandt, the Yoshida family, June Wayne, Bertha Lum, Hiroshige, Mauricio Lasansky, Claire Falkenstein, Picasso, Whistler, and hundreds more. In addition to our regular hours, we will be offering a guided tour every Saturday beginning at 3p.m.

description:

title: Campovida Conversation - Enneagram Workshop - LOVE LANGUAGE
description:
Join Anna, Campovida's Life Gardener, as she shares her insights about a well respected personality assessment tool called the Enneagram. The Enneagram \(from the Greek words ἐννέα \[ennéa, meaning "nine"\] and γράμμα \[grámma, meaning something "written" or "drawn"\]\), is a model of nine interconnected personality types. Learn about how to speak in a love languages of each type. After, there is optional wine tasting \(of course\), exploring the garden and a delicious menu to choose from at our Stock Farm restaurant in town. Stewards receive their discount on the $25.00. There is a recommended assessment to take prior to attending the session and not included in the fee.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Hanami Stroll at Sonoma Botanical Garden
location: 12841 HWY 12, Glen Ellen, CA, 95442, United States
description:
Immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of Asian magnolia blossoms, many of which are endangered in their native habitats. During peak bloom, more than a dozen magnolia trees and shrubs come alive with vibrant pink and white flowers set against bare winter branches, creating a striking seasonal display.    Guests are invited to enjoy a guided hanami stroll, the Japanese tradition of flower viewing, offering a peaceful opportunity to admire these rare and beautiful blooms. After the walk, continue the experience with a visit to The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms, where expertly crafted miniature landscapes highlight the artistry and harmony of nature. This immersive experience celebrates the beauty of the season through flowers, culture, and living art.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sonoma Lovers Celebration at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:

Take in the sights and sounds of our farm as you tour the orchards and olive groves aboard our apple-themed trolley. Afterward, you'll be seated at individual tables for a self-guided tasting flight and pairing board, accompanied by live music.

Your tasting experience includes four premium olive oils served in authentic Italian glassware with detailed tasting notes, plus our citrus olive oil, house-made apple cider syrup, and citrus shrub. Each flight is accompanied by locally sourced chocolate, artisan cheese, macarons, crackers, and fresh bread—everything you need for a memorable Valentine's Day celebration.

Event Details:

Limited to 20 guests per session

Live music by the Lisa Liu Duo

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

title: Jazz & Ballet Combo: Ages 8-12
description:
Saturdays, January 17 – March 14, 2026 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Categories: Dance & Movement, Kids

Ages

8 – 12 years old

$200 Total Registration Fee

Registration Fee includes full enrollment for 9 weeks of instruction and the recital costume fee

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps.

About the Class

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps. Instruction will include warm up exercises, increased vocabulary and beginning mini ballet barre ballet positions, across the floor exercises, beginning turns and leaps and beginning choreography is taught at the end of class to different styles of music. Exercises will be modified or enhanced to the individual’s level. Class will be conducted in a positive and attentive environment and is designed to develop memorization, flexibility, and musicality. This class will help the student gain coordination and confidence to take into their daily lives. Small performing opportunities based upon a child’s interest but is not mandatory. There will be a recital on Saturday, March 21. More details to follow. Benefits include listening skills and concentration, increased coordination, and an understanding of movement, i.e. time, space, directions and balance, social skills and development of creativity.

Required Supply List

Dance shoes, ballet slippers or barefoot \(Need shoes, see below\) Please no socks \(grippy kind ok\) or just tights as the floor can be slippery. Comfortable clothing to move in or dancewear such as leotards, skirts, skirted leotards and tights \(with shoes\) of any color or style. Please no tutus or pajamas in class. Hair pulled off of face. Dress in layers as it can go from chilly to warm fast! Being dressed and ready for class is part of the experience and encourages focus and participation.

Location

Room 213, Dance Studio

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Arts Guild of Sonoma Presents: For the Love of Art
description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Learn more at  artsguildofsonoma.org .

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Wine Love Wine Trail
description:
Wine Trail is a one-day tasting adventure inviting guests to explore dozens of wineries along the Wine Road in Sonoma County. With one ticket, enjoy curated tastings at 30\+ participating wineries across Alexander Valley, Dry Creek Valley, and Russian River Valley, no reservations or individual tasting fees required. Along the way, meet winemakers and owners, discover new favorites, and experience a variety of vineyard styles and scenic tasting rooms. Many stops also feature food pairings, picnic spots, and local vendors, making it easy to savor great wine alongside delicious bites. Wine Trail offers a relaxed, festive way to explore Sonoma's renowned wine country in a single, memorable day.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sparkling Valentine’s Tasting at Cuvaison
description:

title: Free Family Day: Second Saturdays at MSC
description:
Every second Saturday of the month enjoy free admission all day long at the Museum of Sonoma County! This month celebrate Valentine’s Day at the Museum of Sonoma County with a creative, love-filled afternoon! On **Saturday, February 14**, join us for a special Valentine’s-themed drop-in program featuring hands-on artmaking and gallery exploration.

Decorate and paint your own **wooden heart picture frame**, then head into our ***Artistry in Wood*** exhibition for a fun scavenger hunt that invites close looking and playful discovery.

**11:00 AM–1:00 PM** All ages welcome | Supplies provided

title: Sonoma Lovers Celebration at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:
Spoil the special someone in your life this Valentine's Day with an intimate tasting and tour experience at Gold Ridge Organic Farms. Take in the sights and sounds of our farm as you tour the orchards and olive groves aboard our apple-themed trolley. Afterward, you'll be seated at individual tables for a self-guided tasting flight and pairing board, accompanied by live music.

Your tasting experience includes four premium olive oils served in authentic Italian glassware with detailed tasting notes, plus our citrus olive oil, house-made apple cider syrup, and citrus shrub. Each flight is accompanied by locally sourced chocolate, artisan cheese, macarons, crackers, and fresh bread—everything you need for a memorable Valentine's Day celebration.

Event Details:

Two sessions: 11:00am and 1:30pm

Limited to 20 guests per session

Live music by the Lisa Liu Duo

Source: Press Democrat

description:

Artist Reception Saturday, February 21, 1pm - 4pm. Information and Prospectus available @www.gratongallery,net

Source: Press Democrat

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.

Sonoma County artists, Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich present the Color of Love, paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features Laura Roney’s Dance!, a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. \(707\) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    www.upstairsart gallery.net

Source: Press Democrat

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
WHAT: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

DATE:            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

TIME: 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

WHERE:       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

LINK:             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

DETAILS:

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         Offered Daily: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         Experience length: 2 hours

·         Wines: Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         Cost: $150 per Person

·         Exclusive Member Price: $95 per Member

ADMISSION: Members $95 | Non-members $150

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
