title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

title: Spiral Bookmaking
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 14, 2026 11:30 AM – 1:30 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$70 – Registration Cost $10 – Materials Fee $80 – Total Registration CostWorkshop exploring a spiral book structure folded from two long sheets. Participants insert colors and discover how they emerge through the form.

What you’ll do

In partnership with Amu Arts, the Sonoma Community Center is pleased to offer three special workshops on February 14th, given by guest artists visiting from Japan. Register for more than one workshop and receive a 10% discount. Sign up for all three to make it a full day experience at 20% off! This book was designed by Adachi for a work inspired by DNA and the growth of the giant beanstalk. Its defining feature is a dynamic spiral structure created solely by folding two long sheets of paper, without the use of glue or thread. In this workshop, participants work with two long sheets of paper and thin colored papers. One of the long sheets is translucent and folded in half lengthwise. Participants freely insert colored paper between the folded layers. As the structure is folded and completed, participants discover how the inserted colors shift and emerge through the spiral form. Anyone interested in making things can participate. No prior bookmaking experience is required.

Japanese Guest Artist Bookmaking Series

This class is part of a 3 part series. Register for 2 classes using the code double to receive 10% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes. Register for 3 classes using the code triple to receive 20% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes.

title: Valentine's Day Truffle Hunt at Manzanita Grove Winery
description:
Experience "Scouting Sonoma" at Manzanita Grove Winery, a unique Valentine's celebration where wine meets woodland magic. Guests can watch professional truffle dogs in action as they sniff out hidden culinary treasures, learning about truffle cultivation, scent science, and dog training for the hunt. Sip a curated flight of Manzanita Grove's small-lot wines, including their Double Gold-winning Sangiovese and elegant Cabernet Sauvignon, while enjoying seasonal bites featuring freshly sourced truffles. Stroll through the truffle orchard, take in the beautiful vineyard setting, and even purchase a fresh truffle to create a romantic Valentine's Day dinner at home.

One class a week for eight weeks with the expectation that teens will work on their comic in between. Class dates: 2/7, 2/14, 2/28, 3/7, 3/14, 3/21, 3/28, and 4/4 Registration required!

title: Bubbly and Macaron Pairing!
description:

We're Sonoma and Napa Valleys' only winery focused exclusively on producing and showcasing sparkling wines made in three timeless styles: pétillant naturel, méthode Champenoise, and Charmat method. And whether you're celebrating Valentine's Day, Galentine's Day, or just the fact that it's a Saturday, we'd love for you to spend part of your afternoon with us, enjoying a flight of sparkling wines perfectly paired with macarons from Les Pascals Patisserie, and a mini-Valentine’s Day flower bouquet to take home with you! \(21\+ only; service animals only\)

title: Therapeutic Group Hypnosis with Sound Bath
description:
Therapeutic Group Hypnosis and Sound Bath with Eostar Kamala, Clinical Hypnotherapist

You can attract love by creating an atmosphere of love in your life.

This group hypnosis session will give you an effective tool for opening your heart by changing the way you look at yourself and teaching compassionate communication with your inner mind.  Seeing the beauty in yourself is as necessary as seeing the beauty in others.

The sages of all time have known that love is life’s greatest blessing.  Everyone wants and needs love.  We all need others; we need the emotional and spiritual nourishment of human relationships. This hypnosis session will give you an effective tool for opening your heart by changing the way you look at yourself and teaching compassionate communication with your inner mind.  Learning to love yourself in healthy ways is the first step toward loving others. Seeing the beauty in yourself is as necessary as seeing the beauty in others.

Eostar will close the group hypnotherapy session with a sound bath, enveloping everyone is a sonic embrace of heart-bliss.

Return at 3PM and join Eostar to further deepen into your heart-bliss during her Sound Odyssey.

About EESystem™

The EESystem™ is a ecologically & environmentally safe system used by individuals, doctors, and therapists as well as Meditation and Wellness Centers to improve human development and psychological well-being.  Decades of documented research on the EESystem™ shows people experience improved immune function, relief from pain, detoxification, elevated moods, increased energy, and much more.

About Eostar

Eostar Kamala is a multifaceted healer and musician, specializing in therapeutic hypnosis, transformational shadow work, and sound healing. With certifications from the Hypnosis Motivation Institute as a Master Hypnotist and Hypnotherapist, she blends her extensive education—including breathwork facilitation and shamanic training—with her passion for guiding others through their inner journeys.

Her spiritual awakening began at 19 in Hungary, ignited by the wisdom of a local healer. This transformative experience led her to explore various healing modalities, ultimately culminating in the founding of “Shadow Into Light” Hypnotherapy. Eostar’s artistry reflects her journey; from sacred music performances to visual art representing her inner landscapes, she channels universal love through every medium.

Now based in Mount Shasta’s energy vortex, Eostar continues to evolve as a teacher and facilitator of plant medicine ceremonies while sharing her devotional music with the world. Her mission is to empower others to embrace their own paths toward healing and self-discovery.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Glassblowing Hearts & Flowers
description:
No experience necessary! Experience the wonder of hot glass, right in our own backyard. This is an in-depth, hands-on class, suitable for beginners and intermediate-level glass artists. The instructor will guide you through the basics of glassblowing, and you will use your skills to create one-of-a-kind glass pieces such as cups or flowers.

title: Goatlandia Group Tour
description:
Join us for a Weekend Sanctuary Tour & Picnic Lunch 

Tours are held most Saturdays and the first Sunday of the month from April until November. Our educational tours are in groups up to 25 people and start at 12pm and last about 90 minutes. Our tour guides are dedicated staff and volunteers who know all about our animals and their personalities. You’ll meet our residents animals including goats, sheep, pigs, horses and our alpaca, learn about Goatlandia’s mission, and meet like minded animal lovers! 

Add on a Picnic Lunchbox \(includes an organic, plant-based sandwich, salad, fruit and a non- alcoholic beverage\) or Kids Lunch \(includes pb&j or almond butter& jam, carrots with ranch, fruit & kid-friendly drink\) & and enjoy it on our sanctuary grounds after your tour.  

Note: Thursdays at 5pm is the online reservation deadline for the upcoming weekend. For last minute reservations, email us: info@goatlandia.org.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Early Childhood - Let's Make Music! (Ages 0 - 5 Years)
description:
Saturdays, January 10 – February 21, 2026 12:30 PM – 1:15 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Family, Kids, Music

Age\(s\)

0-5

$10 – Single Session Registration Cost $70 – 7 Session Package Drop-in’s are welcome! Please arrive ten minutes before and register in the main office.

What you’ll do

This class is active and jam-packed with children and folk songs. Together we sing, dance, twirl, skip and fly while we experience the joy of making music. During each class children learn the words of simple songs, anticipate the timing of echo songs and glow with excitement during our movement songs. Taking turns and simple role play are all part of this class. Children will feel encouraged when parents model these interactions and they happily follow their leads. Language development with an increased vocabulary is naturally absorbed by young children, and the rhythmic beat of clapping and stomping guides our breathing. Come join us!

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Flower Porch: Valentine's Day Bouquets + Love Notes
description:
Join us at Flower Porch this Valentine’s Day for a creative afternoon inspired by the early stirrings of spring and appreciation for ourselves and those we love. 

Learn to create lush, hand-tied bouquets using early bloomers like anemones, hellebores, ranunculus, and even gorgeous radicchio all organically grown at Front Porch Farm. 

We’ll also craft handmade cards together while enjoying delectable treats in a cozy atmosphere designed to inspire creativity and connection. Treat yourself or share this special experience with someone you love. 

This workshop includes: 

Light snacks and beverages upon arrival

Instruction and materials to create 1 hand-tied bouquet including beautiful wrap, tissue paper, and ribbon

Supplies and support to create one hand-made card with watercolors, pressed flowers, collage materials and more! 

Please arrive promptly at the the start time as we will use the full duration of the class. We recommend always wearing comfortable clothing and footwear for walking around the farm in all terrain including dirt and mud. This ticket covers to cost for 1 person. 

Refund & Cancellations: Due to limited seating, cancellations must be made at least 48 hours before your class. Cancellations made before this window receive a credit toward a future class of equal value. No refunds are available.

title: Boxmaking using Vintage Japanese Paper
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 14, 2026 2:00 PM -5:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

13\+

$100 – Registration Cost $15 – Materials Fee $115 – Total Registration CostJoin guest artist Tatsuhiko Niijima to craft boxes from vintage Japanese paper, exploring the meeting of old materials and modern design.

What you’ll do

In partnership with Amu Arts, the Sonoma Community Center is pleased to offer three special workshops on February 14th, given by guest artists visiting from Japan. Register for more than one workshop and receive a 10% discount. Sign up for all three to make it a full day experience at 20% off! This workshop focuses on making boxes using vintage Japanese colored paper. Both the size and construction method of the boxes are carefully designed to minimize paper waste. The core structure of each box is created using a contemporary bookbinding technique known as the V-cut, which allows the corners to be exceptionally sharp and beautifully finished. We hope you will discover a unique charm in these boxes, which combine old materials with new techniques–offering a character different from that of brand-new boxes. Each set consists of a box base and a matching lid. You may choose from three available sizes, as well as your preferred colored paper from approximately ten different varieties of vintage Japanese paper. During the workshop, you will assemble pre-cut core components and use a traditional Japanese brush to apply paste and carefully mount the colored paper onto the surface of the box. This workshop is recommended for individuals with an interest in vintage objects, traditional materials, and Japanese tools. It is suitable for participants aged 13 and over, as the process involves delicate work with thin paper and requires careful handling.

Japanese Guest Artist Bookmaking Series

This class is part of a 3 part series. Register for 2 classes using the code double to receive 10% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes. Register for 3 classes using the code triple to receive 20% off your total registration cost for all 3 classes.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Sound Healing Odyssey  with Eostar Kamala
description:
Journey Beyond the Mind. Restore Harmony Through Sound.

Experience transpersonal states of consciousness, pure bliss, cessation of mind chatter, accessing a full spectrum of emotions and receiving highly intuitive “downloads” as you immerse yourself in Eostar’s Sound Healing Odyssey.

Release, cleanse, re-align body, mind, soul and spirit, using these ancient tools. Eostar’s sound journeys are meditations guided by the sound of various instruments, with varying frequencies and vibrations…most of which are rich in overtones that resonate deeply in one’s body and auric field. These overtones can lead one into a state of total relaxation in which healing and connection to a higher consciousness usually happens spontaneously.

Eostar has played sacred acoustic music and sound healing music to audiences along the West Coast and South America for more than two decades as a devotional musician and as sound healer.  She creates sound-scapes using didgeridoo, tank-drums, kalimbas, drums, monochord, crystal bowls, chimes, Tibetan bowls, guitar, Gong and throat-singing.

Eostar is a Clinical Hypnotherapist and breathwork teacher as well and she loves weaving these tools together with the sound bath experience she orchestrates.

Begin your afternoon with a journey to the heart during Eostar’s group hypnosis event in the EESystem™  at Noon. 

About Eostar

Eostar Kamala is a multifaceted healer and musician, specializing in therapeutic hypnosis, transformational shadow work, and sound healing. With certifications from the Hypnosis Motivation Institute as a Master Hypnotist and Hypnotherapist, she blends her extensive education—including breathwork facilitation and shamanic training—with her passion for guiding others through their inner journeys.

Now based in Mount Shasta’s energy vortex, Eostar continues to evolve as a teacher and facilitator of plant medicine ceremonies while sharing her devotional music with the world. Her mission is to empower others to embrace their own paths toward healing and self-discovery.

About EESystem™​

The EESystem™ is a ecologically & environmentally safe system used by individuals, doctors, and therapists as well as Meditation and Wellness Centers to improve human development and psychological well-being.  Decades of documented research on the EESystem™ shows people experience improved immune function, relief from pain, detoxification, elevated moods, increased energy, and much more.

Eostar has played sacred acoustic music and sound healing music to audiences along the West Coast and South America for more than two decades as a devotional musician and as sound healer.  She creates sound-scapes using didgeridoo, tank-drums, kalimbas, drums, monochord, crystal bowls, chimes, Tibetan bowls, guitar, Gong and throat-singing.

Eostar is a Clinical Hypnotherapist and breathwork teacher as well and she loves weaving these tools together with the sound bath experience she orchestrates.

Begin your afternoon with a journey to the heart during Eostar’s group hypnosis event in the EESystem™  at Noon. 

About Eostar

Eostar Kamala is a multifaceted healer and musician, specializing in therapeutic hypnosis, transformational shadow work, and sound healing. With certifications from the Hypnosis Motivation Institute as a Master Hypnotist and Hypnotherapist, she blends her extensive education—including breathwork facilitation and shamanic training—with her passion for guiding others through their inner journeys.

Now based in Mount Shasta’s energy vortex, Eostar continues to evolve as a teacher and facilitator of plant medicine ceremonies while sharing her devotional music with the world. Her mission is to empower others to embrace their own paths toward healing and self-discovery.

About EESystem™​

The EESystem™ is a ecologically & environmentally safe system used by individuals, doctors, and therapists as well as Meditation and Wellness Centers to improve human development and psychological well-being.  Decades of documented research on the EESystem™ shows people experience improved immune function, relief from pain, detoxification, elevated moods, increased energy, and much more.

Source: Press Democrat

title: (M)EAT CARNIVAL-Mare Island
description:
\(M\)EAT CARNIVAL serves up a unique dining experience like no other. Each event brings vibrant demonstrations of unusual dishes, to set up a sensational atmosphere for a next-level experience you would be hard-pressed to find anywhere else. In fact, the pop-up locations are not released until a week before each event. Beware, \(M\)EAT CARNIVAL isn't for everyone, so if getting your fingers dirty with exotic flavors and eating al fresco is your idea of fine dining, then this should be on your culinary bucket list. This one-of-a-kind experience is inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean. Each pop-up event brings our team of chefs, each showcasing our interpretation of Medi-American cuisine cooked over a live fire. Explore the space, discovering something new around every corner - no two dishes are alike and no two \(M\)EAT CARNIVALS are exactly the same.

description:
With over fifty years of experience, Juan has toured extensively across Asia, Europe, the Caribbean, and the United States. His collaborative spirit has led him to perform and record with an impressive roster of artists, including Prince, Tony Toni Tone, Miguel, El Chicano, Con Funk Shun, Patti LaBelle, Amerie, Chingy, Jody Watley, Lou Bega, MC Hammer, Lionel Richie, En Vogue, El DeBarge, Freddie Hubbard, Barry White, Herbie Hancock, Cyndi Lauper, Teri Lynn Carrington, Bobby McFerrin, Tito Puente, Cheryl Lynn, Raphael Saadiq, and Carlos Santana, among many others.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Words & Music of "John Lennon’s Glasses"
description:
**A one-of-a-kind author event,** the “Words & Music of *John Lennon’s Glasses”* is a magical mystery tour through story, song, and the resilience of the human spirit. 

**Singer-songwriters and authors, Jim and Kathy Ocean, bring their novel to life through a live-music infused readers’ theater experience** that weaves dramatic readings from their book with original music central to the plot, peppered with a few Beatles classics.

**A celebration of imagination and music,** *John Lennon’s Glasses* is a surreal road trip story that blends speculative fiction with rock ‘n’ roll mythology as John Lennon returns from the afterlife to save a disillusioned singer-songwriter who feels he wasted his life by writing songs about universal love.

Whether you’re a lifelong Beatles fan, a lover of new fiction, or simply someone who believes in the power of music to change the world, **this performance offers an unforgettable evening of story and song** that will resonate long after the final note.

**Russian River Books & Letters is a warm and welcoming independent bookstore and community hub in the heart of Guerneville.** With carefully curated books and gifts, and adjoining the Coffee Bazaar, owner Michael Rex has created a comfortable, inclusive space for everything from casual browsing to letter writing workshops to free ESL classes to local events. This gem of a local bookstore is all in for helping the community thrive with books, writing, education, and gatherings.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Clockwork Heart Soirée
description:
WonderStump presents the Clockwork Heart Soirée!

Join us for a night of St. Valentine’s frivolity- no romance required. Whether you arrive as a saucy solo act or a passionate pack of partygoers, we’ve crafted a richly themed evening of live music by Redwood Chrome and DJ ARWN, luminous mechanical intrigue, and unexpected performance delights.

The space will pulse with color, light, and interactive artworks. Clockwork Cocktails & Mocktails crafted by our fine friends at Griffo Distillery will be available at the cash bar, alongside savory and sweet snackable treats from our Micro Mercantile. As the night ticks on, secrets will unfurl- designed to dazzle your senses and ensnare your soul!

Creative couture is highly encouraged. Break out your favorite costume combo, and channel your inner artist! Please note, we will have delightful small bites available for purchase, but not a full dinner. Please enjoy a meal prior to swooping in to soirée!

Lose track of time. Feel the beat of brass and bone. Immerse yourself in the revelry.

21\+

title: The Bleeding Roses--a lights out Valentines Haunted House
description:
sKreamZ Haunted Attractions will set hearts racing this February at The Bleeding Roses, a Limited Valentine’s Lights-Out Haunted House Experience

Walk the haunt with only a single flashlight beam… and a whole lot of nerve.

FAIRFIELD, CA This Valentine’s season, romance comes with a warning: fear blooms after dark. sKreamZ Haunted Attractions is launching an all-new, limited-engagement event — “The Bleeding Roses: A Lights-Out Haunted House” — running February 6, 7, 13, and 14 in Fairfield.

Guests will navigate the haunted house in near total darkness, guided only by the light of a single flashlight beam — and whatever courage they can hold onto. Bring your friends, your date, or anyone brave enough to lock hands and keep moving when the light hits something you wish it hadn’t.

Valentine’s Date Night, Upgraded

If dinner-and-a-movie feels predictable, “The Bleeding Roses” offers a more unforgettable kind of Valentine’s tradition:

·       A true lights-out walkthrough \(one flashlight beam per group\)

·       Limited showing — only four nights running from 7pm to 10pm each night.

·       A free photo opportunity for guests \(limited engagement availability\)

·       No advance tickets — tickets sold at the door only.

Love is in the air… and so are the sKreamZ.

Proceeds Benefit Fairfield PAL’s Career Café

Beyond the thrills, “The Bleeding Roses” supports something bigger: proceeds will benefit the Fairfield PAL Career Café, a program helping local teens build real-world career readiness through coaching, workplace skills, and exposure to career pathways.

In a community where many teens face barriers to employment, mentorship, and professional networks, the Career Café helps students gain confidence, practice communication, explore careers, and connect with adults who can open doors. Funds raised from this event help PAL expand those opportunities — so more teens can move from “not sure what’s next” to “I’ve got a plan.”

Event Details

What: The Bleeding Roses: A Lights-Out Haunted House \(sKreamZ Haunted Attractions\)

When: February 6, 7, 13 & 14

Doors Open: 7:00 PM.  Come early to beat the lines.

Tickets: $14 per person \(sold at the door only; no tickets in advance\)

Where: 1795 Pennsylvania Ave., Fairfield, CA

Website: sKreamZ.com

Notes: Waiver required. Not recommended for ages 10 and under. Parent guidance required for ages 14 and under.

About sKreamZ Haunted Attractions

For 20 years, sKreamZ Haunted Attractions has been creating immersive, high-intensity seasonal haunted experiences designed to push the limits of fear, atmosphere, and storytelling — with special events that give the community a reason to scream together.

About Fairfield PAL

Fairfield PAL is open to all Fairfield, Suisun, and Travis teens ages 13–18 who are currently enrolled in school. Membership is free with a student ID and parent/guardian signature. Interested teens can apply at the Fairfield Community Center or contact PAL at 707-330-8757 for more information.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: SALOME by Oscar Wilde
description:
Banned in England!

A Valentine’s Night of Desire, Decadence, and Mischief

If you’re tired of pink hearts, cupids, and predictable Valentine’s plans—and you’re craving something darker, stranger, and a little more dangerous — SALOME by Oscar Wilde invites you to celebrate love in a far more decadent way. SALOME is an immersive masquerade experience set in the decadent court of king Herod.

This is an intimate, reservation-only experience.

Seating is strictly limited to 20 guests, and tickets will not be sold at the door. Advance purchase is required—reserve your seat now before the experience sells out. Guests are encouraged to dress in costume and become part of the court itself for this outrageous night of dark glamour, forbidden desire, and delicious mischief.

A night out. A story. An experience you'll remember forever.

Perfect for Valentine’s dates, adventurous friends, or anyone who prefers their romance served with a little danger.

Costumes encouraged. Memories guaranteed.

title: Sensual Valentine's Partner Massage & Neo-Tantra Ritual
description:
This Valentine's Day explore your playful side with a sensual partner Thai massage and a neo-tantric ceremony for couples.

This is a heart-centered event for partners, lovers or friends to share touch and intimacy with intention. The evening will begin with partner massage trade that deepens bonds of trust, sensitivity and attunement, with others and ourselves. Experience a consensual, sensual bodywork that empowers authentic presence and connection. Thai massage includes massage, acupressure and yoga-like stretching, fully clothed without the use of oils on a mat on the floor.

The neo-tantric couples ceremony is a guided experience of enlivening your senses, cultivating energy and pleasure in the body, and attuning with presence. This ritual will invite you into connection with your partner though intimacy, touch, play, and exploration. You'll be guided to share a range of flavors with each other from sweet, to provocative, to primal - all held within a loving container. Come open your heart and activate your body in this sensual ceremony!

We are offering a limited number of low-income tickets for this event. To apply, visit: https://forms.gle/tCjGbaCR8hZn3E4S6

The space will pulse with color, light, and interactive artworks.Clockwork Cocktails & Mocktailscrafted by our fine friends atGriffo Distillerywill be available at the cash bar, alongside savory and sweet snackable treats from ourMicro Mercantile. As the night ticks on, secrets will unfurl- designed to dazzle your senses and ensnare your soul! Creative couture is highly encouraged. Break out your favorite costume combo, and channel your inner artist! Lose track of time. Feel the beat of brass and bone. Immerse yourself in the revelry. 21\+ \*Desire to level up your creative couture? Investigate our Feb 7th Leather Adornments workshop!

title: Juan Escovedo: Special Valentines Day Performance
description:
With over fifty years of experience, Juan has toured extensively across Asia, Europe, the Caribbean, and the United States. His collaborative spirit has led him to perform and record with an impressive roster of artists, including Prince, Tony Toni Tone, Miguel, El Chicano, Con Funk Shun, Patti LaBelle, Amerie, Chingy, Jody Watley, Lou Bega, MC Hammer, Lionel Richie, En Vogue, El DeBarge, Freddie Hubbard, Barry White, Herbie Hancock, Cyndi Lauper, Teri Lynn Carrington, Bobby McFerrin, Tito Puente, Cheryl Lynn, Raphael Saadiq, and Carlos Santana, among many others. In November 2021, Juan launched his solo career by releasing his debut album, The J, which was celebrated during two sold-out shows in Oakland. The city declared November 8 "Juan Escovedo Day," as former Mayor Libby Schaaf presented him with a proclamation. Tickets: $23 in advance, $28 day of show Get tickets

title: The Words & Music of "John Lennon's Glasses"
description:
A one-of-a-kind author event, the “Words & Music of John Lennon’s Glasses” is a magical mystery tour through story, song, and the resilience of the human spirit. 

Singer-songwriters and authors, Jim and Kathy Ocean, bring their novel to life through a live-music infused readers’ theater experience that weaves dramatic readings from their book with original music central to the plot, peppered with a few Beatles classics.

A celebration of imagination and music, John Lennon’s Glasses is a surreal road trip story that blends speculative fiction with rock ‘n’ roll mythology as John Lennon returns from the afterlife to save a disillusioned singer-songwriter who feels he wasted his life by writing songs about universal love.

Whether you’re a lifelong Beatles fan, a lover of new fiction, or simply someone who believes in the power of music to change the world, this performance offers an unforgettable evening of story and song that will resonate long after the final note.

Russian River Books & Letters is a warm and welcoming independent bookstore and community hub in the heart of Guerneville. With carefully curated books and gifts, and adjoining the Coffee Bazaar, owner Michael Rex has created a comfortable, inclusive space for everything from casual browsing to letter writing workshops to free ESL classes to local events. This gem of a local bookstore is all in for helping the community thrive with books, writing, education, and gatherings.

title: Date Night Ceramics
description:
Bring your partner, your bestie or your mom because clay is more fun together!

Cost: $150 for two people – a larger group is also welcome!

Skill Level: All levels, great for beginners.

Want to learn the basics of handbuilding pottery in a relaxed and fun atmosphere? Join me in my Fairfax studio for this one night class. Everything will be provided including as little or as much instruction as you want and need. Fees include clay, tools for your use, glaze, firing and a glass of wine or cup of tea. Be ready to get a little dirty!

What to Expect After class your work will be glazed \(using the glaze of your choice\), fired, and ready for pick up within a few weeks

If you love this experience, consider signing up for a whole class session! Individuals will be eligible for $25 off the price of the session.

Please contact me if you have any questions: shoshanaparry@yahoo.com or \(415\) 302-2559

A minimum of four people are required to run the class. If this is not met then you will receive a full refund.

Source: Press Democrat

title: SALOME by Oscar Wilde
description:
Banned in England!

A Valentine’s Night of Desire, Decadence, and Mischief

If you’re tired of pink hearts, cupids, and predictable Valentine’s plans—and you’re craving something darker, stranger, and a little more dangerous — SALOME by Oscar Wilde invites you to celebrate love in a far more decadent way. SALOME is an immersive masquerade experience set in the decadent court of king Herod.

This is an intimate, reservation-only experience.

Seating is strictly limited to 20 guests, and tickets will not be sold at the door. Advance purchase is required—reserve your seat now before the experience sells out. Guests are encouraged to dress in costume and become part of the court itself for this outrageous night of dark glamour, forbidden desire, and delicious mischief.

A night out. A story. An experience you'll remember forever.

Perfect for Valentine’s dates, adventurous friends, or anyone who prefers their romance served with a little danger.

Costumes encouraged. Memories guaranteed.

Go to salome2026.wordpress.com for more information and to reserve your seats today.

title: Composer/trumpeter Sarah Wilson Valentine's Day Album Release Concert
description:
Community spirit has been a constant in the work of composer/trumpeter Sarah Wilson, whose experiences and inspirations have ranged from socially conscious puppet theater to brass band and New Orleans traditions to her own illuminating style of jazz. Wilson grew up in Healdsburg, CA playing trumpet in school bands, eventually receiving the McCord Alumni Scholarship from HHS to study music in New York City. She now resides again locally in Petaluma.   Wilson celebrates her recent release Incandescence with an album release concert on Saturday, February 14 at Della Fattoria Downtown Café, 143 Petaluma Boulevard North, Petaluma, CA. Wilson’s Bay Area ensemble Brass Tonic performs with Wilson on trumpet and Kasey Knudsen \(alto sax\), Mara Fox \(trombone\), John Schott \(guitar\), Lisa Mezzacappa \(bass\), and Jason Levis \(drums\). Doors open at 7 p.m., performance at 7:30 p.m. Tickets $49.87. Tickets and information at sarahwilsonmusic.com/gigs.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: Thornton Wilder's The Skin of Our Teeth
description:
The Skin of Our Teeth is Thornton Wilder’s bold, three-part allegory of human survival. It follows the Antrobus family through ages of natural disaster, war, and renewal. Blending surrealist comedy with epic drama, the play captures humanity’s continual struggle to endure “by the skin of our teeth”—an urgent message in today’s world of conflict and climate crisis.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description:
In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: An Evening of Love and Music at The California Theatre on Valentine’s Day
location: The California Theatre of Santa Rosa
description:
**SANTA ROSA, CA – February 14, 2026** – Enjoy a special musical evening celebrating love and musical community with Sonoma Valley musical favorite Jami Jameson Band and the Grateful Heart Band. This exclusive live music event takes place at the California Theatre in Santa Rosa, California on Valentine’s Day 2026. 

The Grateful Heart Band is dedicated to inspiring community through joyful original songs and dynamic live performances that offer a sophisticated blend of Jazz Rock, Adult Contemporary, Yacht Rock, and Americana styles. Curated by project visionary Michael John Ahern, the band’s larger mission is to inspire a more loving and compassionate world through the global touchstone of music. The Grateful Heart Band is composed of Sonoma Valley music professionals with stellar reputations for live performance and studio session work. The performance will showcase tracks from the band’s debut album, *Heart Shaped World*.  The Jami Jameson Band will open the evening, setting the stage for a night of heartfelt, masterful musicianship.

Influences include musical giants such as Steely Dan, Ambrosia, Boz Skaggs, Sade, Michael Franks, Christopher Cross, Toto, and Genesis.

The all-star lineup includes:

Two-time Grammy Award-winning singer and percussionist **Christian Pepin**.

Gregg Allman bassist and Alameda All-Star **Tommy Miller**.

Veteran NYC/SF session drummer and touring musician **Michael Israel**.

Bay Area Soul and Blues Veteran **Roger Voltz** on Sax and Vocals.

Keyboardist **Bob McBain** of Pete Floyd the Pink Floyd Experience.

Legendary Sonoma Valley guitarist **Dennis “Dino” Cordellos**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Scrooge! The Musical
description:
The heroine in this actor’s tour-de-force is an ordinary middle class English housewife. As she prepares chips and eggs for dinner, she ruminates on her life and tells the wall about her husband, her children, her past, and an invitation from a girlfriend to join her on holiday in Greece to search for romance and adventure. Starring Jennifer King \(Bad Dates, Belle of Amherst.\)

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Do You Even Relationship? — The Not-So-Newlywed Game
description:
Do You Even Relationship? — The Not-So-Newlywed Game A Valentine’s Night Comedy Event in Downtown Santa Rosa

Valentine’s Day doesn’t have to be serious to be meaningful.

Join us at Barrel Proof Lounge for a one-night comedy event inspired by the classic TV show The Newlywed Game — with a modern, comedic twist and much lower emotional stakes.

This show brings together real-life comedian couples for stand-up comedy, followed by a live relationship game that asks the questions you think you know the answers to… until you’re asked out loud.

 Featuring comedian couples: • Chelsea Bearce & Matt Walker • Chantavy Tornado & Abe Rabinowitz • Haley Katz & Nate Schwartz

Each comic performs a stand-up set before teaming up for The Not-So-Newlywed Game, where love, memory, honesty, and selective hearing are all put to the test.

Audience Participation

After the comics play, six audience couples will be selected to join the game onstage.

And no — you don’t have to be married. you don’t have to be newly together. you don’t even have to really like each other (though it helps).

Selected couples will compete for prizes including:

Free drinks

Show tickets

Hotel stays from our friends at Hotel E and Art House Hotel

Tickets & Seating

 General Admission: $25 per person  Couples Ticket: $45 (includes one entry into the contestant drawing)

 Sweetheart Tables (Limited — only 8 available): $95 per couple Includes:

Reserved table for two

A rose & chocolates

Welcome pour of bubbles

Private call button for beverage service

Two entries into the contestant drawing

Event Details

 Show: 8:00–11:00pm (with intermissions)  Beer, wine, Soju cocktails available  Free popcorn  21+

 Barrel Proof Lounge 501 Mendocino Avenue, Downtown Santa Rosa

Come laugh, learn something unexpected, and maybe win a hotel stay — or at least a great story.

Check out **www.barrelprooflounge.com** for all sorts of good times ahead!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Valentine's Safari Tour for the Grown Ups!
description:
Unleash your Wild Side! While you might not witness animals in courtship \(unless you're incredibly lucky\), you'll embark on an extraordinary adventure that combines entertainment and education. Get ready to discover your wild side at our Valentine's Safari Tour and Celebration \(adults-only\)! Join our expert guides aboard our open-air safari vehicle as they reveal the captivating ‘Ins and Outs' of animal courtship. From the rhythmic grunts of a warthog to the enchanting rituals of African mammals and birds, you'll be spellbound by the romantic tales of the wild.   Cost: $175 per person-price includes applicable tax and gratuity. Rates will be itemized once items are in your cart. Saturday, February 14th, or Sunday, February 15th! Cost: $175 Per Person-price includes applicable tax and gratuity. Adults Only. Valentine Package Includes: Decadent Repast and the ‘Amour' Celebration will take place in the Elephant Room. 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Beverage service, oyster bar and appetizers available 12:30 PM Decadent Repast: Wild Love Bite's featuring a guilty pleasure wild dessert 1:30PM ‘Amour' Celebration: A titillating, fundiscussion onthe ‘ins and outs' of animal courtship 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM Safari Sex Tour! \(Adults Only\) At Safari West, we wholeheartedly embrace our role as caretakers of a diverse array of wildlife, and this event offers a truly unique glimpse into the ‘ins and outs' of animal courtship. But here's the kicker - it's not just a barrel of laughs; it's a wild and enlightening expedition that unveils the mysteries of how animals discover their perfect match, build families, and safeguard their territory. Get ready to laugh out loud and swoon with amazement as we spill the beans on the animal kingdom's quest for love! Plus, who knows, you might also discover the wild side in you! The experience includes a delectable feast, a fun discussion on animal courtship, and an exclusive Safari Adult Tour where you'll encounter giraffes, rhinoceroses, wildebeests, cape buffalos, zebras, and more. Don't miss out on this adults-only adventure - let your wild side run free this Valentine's Day at Safari West! If you have any questions, please call \(707\) 566-3667 or email us at  Reservations@safariwest.com . Decadent Repast Why only Adults?... Safari West Adult Sex Tour\). Pile into an open-air safari vehicle and drive out among some of the world's most exotic and enthralling creatures for a wild safari tour led by Safari West's animal experts as they probe the revealing "Ins and Outs" of Wildlife courtship. You'll learn intimate details about the mating habits of African mammals and birds including Bongo, Giraffe, Eland, Wildebeest, Gazelle, Zebra, Warthog, Cheetah and more! …When a male warthog wants to attract a female, he does a courtship "chant" of rhythmic grunts that sounds like an engine in need of a tune-up. Yes, love is in the air! You'll even discover amazing facts about domestic animals and insects, like the common fruit fly, which has the longest sperm of any living creature. For the perfect ice breaker, we will offer some ‘pun' condoms during the ‘Amour' Celebration before the tour from the Center for Biological Diversity. Interested in learning more about how you can help save wildlife? Check out more at . title: Caviar Tasting at Vista Point at Jordan Vineyard
description:

Couples are chauffeured from the Jordan Chateau to the stunning Vista Point pavilion, where private tables offer sweeping vineyard views. Enjoy Jordan Chef's Reserve Caviar by Tsar Nicoulai, blini made with Jordan Chardonnay yeast, classic accompaniments, and perfectly paired wines, including Jordan Chardonnay and Jordan Cuvée by Champagne AR Lenoble. Available February 13-15 from 2:30 pm - 4:30 pm, this elegant tasting is the perfect romantic Valentine's Day escape.

title: Celebrate Valentine's weekend at Spoonbar
description:
This Valentine&'s, Spoonbar, h2hotel's signature restaurant will offer a selection of Valentine's-inspired specials and festive cocktails available from February 13 - 15, alongside its regular menu. The special menu highlights seasonal dishes including Dungeness Crab Salad with fresh avocado, winter citrus and foraged green, Ricotta Gnocchi served with braised short ribs, black trumpet mushrooms, and black truffles, and a 14 Day Dry Aged Flannery Beef Tomahawk Steak topped with potato puree, hedgehog mushroom and spinach and bacon. For those looking for cocktails to accompany the dinner, the restaurant also offers festive cocktails such as Raspberry Chocolate Martini with vanilla vodka, baileys chocolate and Chambord, Roses are Red with vodka, rose water, lemon juice and champagne, and the Ex's Baggage, a mix of pomegranate, tequila, cardamom syrup, cucumber and lime juice. title: 2026 Formula KFX Endurance Championship Series Round 1
description:
Formula KFX is hosting a four-round Endurance Championship Series in 2026, bringing arrive-and-drive team racing to venues across California and Nevada. Teams will compete in one of two divisions: Formula KFX Junior \(ages 13-18\) or Formula KFX Senior \(ages 16 and up\). Each team consists of three drivers, reinforcing the endurance format’s emphasis on shared responsibility and race management. Staying true to its arrive-and-drive model, Formula KFX will supply all karts, tires and fuel as part of the $695 entry fee \(per round\), eliminating the need for teams to own or maintain equipment. Drivers are required to bring their own helmet, racing suit, gloves and shoes. A neck brace is mandatory for all drivers under 18, and rib protectors are strongly recommended. The series opens Feb. 15 at Sonoma Raceway Karting Center before moving to Buttonwillow Raceway Park on April 26. Round 3 takes the championship to Northern Nevada Kart Club in Reno on June 28, with the finale scheduled for Aug. 16 at SMKA in Santa Maria. Spectator wristbands are required: $20 for adults, $15 for youth \(5–17\), and free for kids 4 and under, which are available to purchase at the event. Drivers can register here: https://formulakfx.com/register/

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: 30th anniversary San Francisco Bay Flyway Festival Go Wildly Live Outdoors
description:
We are in the midst of the winter migration along the Pacific Flyway. Use your Merlin app to ID the abundance of birds in our communities. And, plan to join me, Myrna Hayes, for our 30th anniversary San Francisco Bay Flyway Festival Go Wildly Live Outdoors with traditional guided outings,

Fri - Sun Feb 13-15 and a Flyway Festival at Moschetti Coffee Roaster.

Feb 13, 4-6pm Opening Celebration Reception with coffee and coffee drinks for purchase, great food delights, drinks, desserts and good people.

Sat, Feb 14, 9am-3pm, free coffee tasting, breakfast for purchase, prepared coffee and drinks, live music, local and Flyway Festival vendors, presentations, a guided birding and nature walk.

Sun, Feb 15, food and drinks, live wild bird show, Birding 101, EarthTeam Interns, Flyway Festival vendors, artists, and exhibitors, rock painting followed by Myrna Hayes 70th Birthday Party from 2:30-3:30pm.

Oh, this is going to be WILD with “Fri the 13th”, Valentine’s Day on Saturday the 14th and my 70th birthday on Sunday the 15th. Epic 30th Flyway Festival!

title: Sugarloaf Great Backyard Bird Count!
description:
Join Sugarloaf birders and other participants from more than 200 countries in the Great Backyard Bird Count (GBBC)! Last year, more than 800,000 people helped identify more than 8,000 bird species. We will start with an introduction to the eBird app, which we will use to submit our group checklist. Then we will start birding as we hike ~1.5 mile hike (with ~300’ ascent) looking and listening for birds. We will also talk about using the Merlin app to help identify birds by sound or by photo. At the end, we will submit our bird checklist via eBird. If you are on eBird, we will share it with you so that it shows up on your account as well. If you are interested in using the Merlin app, we highly recommend you install it on your phone along with the bird pack for US: West Coast before you arrive for the hike, as cell service is very spotty or non-existent within the park. During the four days of the GBBC (February 13-16), you can see the map light up with checklists being submitted in real time across the world.

Meet at the **White Barn parking lot**. There is a reservation fee of $10 per adult, which will be refunded that day on site, unless you choose to donate it. Children under 18 attend for free but must be registered and accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Wear layers (it is likely to be very cold up here), appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, sun protection, bring at least a quart of water, binoculars, and if desired, a snack, a camera, and/or a bird identification guide. We also invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rains cancel. Parking fees apply.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Little houses, cardboard cars, wild costumes…the possibilities are endless. Come with your imagination wide open and leave with awesome new building skills (and something amazing you made yourself)! 

Ages: 8+

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Spirit Sisters
location: Arlene Francis Center for Spirit, Art, and Politics
description:
SPIRIT SISTERS REIKI SHARE10AM - 12PM

Join us for a Reiki share to embrace

Embrace and share the power of energy healing, conveniently timed right before our monthly sister circle!

Join us as we exchange Reiki Energy Healing with one another, to support, heal and empower each other! This is a great opportunity to practice your Reiki or energy healing gifts in a safe communal space.

Release stress, restore balance and recharge your body, mind and spirit with our magical Reiki Circle. It consists of many healing hands on one person at a time.

Each share will start with a general introduction, then the circle will be grounded by one of our masters with a guided meditation, followed by treatments until each person has had a chance to receive healing.

This is a time and space for teachers, practitioners, those who are interested in sharing in connection and healing, as well as anyone who would like to learn more about Reiki.

Bring:

- A water bottle for yourself to replenish and hydrate

- Any healing tools such as tuning forks, crystals, etc. that you may want to use

- A $1 minimum cash, Venmo or PayPal donation

Join us afterwards for our monthly sister circle!

Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County is a spiritually based women's group for aligned women to be their true, authentic selves. Our events are to empower and connect with like-minded women in a safe and sacred space. Learn more about Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County at

spiritsistersinc.org .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

SPIRIT SISTERS CIRCLE - 12:15PM - 3PM

For our March Sister Circle, we are honored to have community member Tara leading an Intuitive Art workshop!

In this workshop, you will learn how to use your intuition and expression in an artistic way. Through art, you'll learn how you can heal, play, transform and find answers within yourself!

No art experience necessary!

Bring:

- A Vegan Potluck Item

- A $1 minimum donation

Please:

• We want anyone who is called to join us, and we'd rather you come late than not at all! We request that if you are running late, please enter through the front door of the building and enter the schoolhouse room quietly to prevent significant disruption to the group.

• Due to our circles being a safe space for women to get vulnerable, this is an adult woman only event.

About the Sponsored Circle Host: Tara Dickinson

Tara grew up in an ashram \(intentional community\) with a spiritual teacher whose main message was kindness, feed everyone \(body, mind & soul\), and serve. Through these decades of inner work, silent meditation, and awareness, she can hold a space of stillness & understanding for others while we dive into what wants to be expressed.

With a background in fine arts and years of teaching a variety of art labs to kids & grownups, Tara enjoys sharing tools to help everyone feel comfortable in the creative process while learning new techniques.

Tara holds a Bachelor's in Fine Arts and works to combine her education and life experiences to create programs that encourage people to live their best lives by minimizing stress, opening to awareness, and making choices that are tailored to their needs and lifestyle.

More info can be learned at

Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County is a spiritually based women's group for aligned women to be their true, authentic selves. Our events are to empower and connect with like-minded women in a safe and sacred space. Learn more about Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County at

spiritsistersinc.org .

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: Press Democrat

Little houses, cardboard cars, wild costumes…the possibilities are endless. Come with your imagination wide open and leave with awesome new building skills \(and something amazing you made yourself\)!

title: Petaluma River High Tide Upstream Paddle
description:
When the tide is high, the Petaluma River opens into a quieter, greener world.

Join The Floathouse crew for a gentle, guided paddle upstream, timed to higher tides that allow access beyond the downtown channel and into a tranquil tidal slough. With extra water beneath us, we’re able to glide into calm, lush stretches of the river that are normally out of reach.

This unhurried paddle highlights the natural beauty of the Petaluma River’s brackish, tidal waterway. Watch for great egrets, blue herons, snowy egrets, turtles basking along the banks, and abundant plant life. The calm water and peaceful surroundings create a deeply grounding experience—many guests say they feel their stress melt away within minutes.

Along the way, knowledgeable guides share stories of the river’s ecology and human history, offering insight into how this upper channel has shaped—and continues to shape—Petaluma. It’s a rare opportunity to experience how close wild nature lives to the heart of downtown.

Beginner-friendly. Sit-on-top kayaks and all gear provided.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

description:
Art for Everyone is a community exhibition celebrating the shared joy of creativity. Open to artists of all backgrounds and experience levels, the exhibition at Rena Charles Gallery brings together a wide range of voices and materials: glass and oil, etchings and block prints, ceramics and pastels, metalwork, photography, digital painting, collage, fiber, mixed media, and beyond. Spanning local artists and artists from across the country and around the world, Art for Everyone has become a gathering place for diverse creative perspectives; many paths meeting in a shared language of making. Centered on connection, inclusivity, and diversity, Art for Everyone is grounded in the belief that art has the power to bring people together, and that every voice and vision belongs. By opening the doors wide and removing traditional barriers to entry, the exhibition honors the richness of creative expression within our community; welcoming artists who are both well established and those just beginning their creative journey, and affirming that art truly belongs to everyone. title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Online: Holding What Hurts--Strong Emotions in a Time of Social Harm
description:
with Kaira Jewel Lingo

How do we meet moments of overwhelm when it feels like there’s no space inside? In this half-day of mindfulness, we’ll explore body-based practices that help us stay grounded with strong emotions rather than running from them or being swept away. Through mindful breathing, walking, and listening to the body’s wisdom, we return to the steadiness of the present moment.

As we learn to tend our emotions with care, we also strengthen the inner resilience needed for the larger transformation our world is calling for. These practices help loosen patterns of fear and reactivity so we can participate in the great turning toward more life-giving ways of being together.

Drawing on Buddhist psychology, together we’ll learn to recognize, accept, and gently hold difficult emotions. From this compassionate presence, emotions settle, insight emerges, and new possibilities become available for both personal and collective healing.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Open to artists of all backgrounds and experience levels, the exhibition at Rena Charles Gallery brings together a wide range of voices and materials: glass and oil, etchings and block prints, ceramics and pastels, metalwork, photography, digital painting, collage, fiber, mixed media, and beyond. Spanning local artists and artists from across the country and around the world, Art for Everyone has become a gathering place for diverse creative perspectives; many paths meeting in a shared language of making.

Centered on connection, inclusivity, and diversity, Art for Everyone is grounded in the belief that art has the power to bring people together, and that every voice and vision belongs. title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.

Sonoma County artists, Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich present the Color of Love, paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features Laura Roney’s Dance!, a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. \(707\) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    www.upstairsart gallery.net

Source: Press Democrat

title: Online: Holding What Hurts--Strong Emotions in a Time of Social Harm
description:
with Kaira Jewel Lingo

How do we meet moments of overwhelm when it feels like there’s no space inside? In this half-day of mindfulness, we’ll explore body-based practices that help us stay grounded with strong emotions rather than running from them or being swept away. Through mindful breathing, walking, and listening to the body’s wisdom, we return to the steadiness of the present moment.

As we learn to tend our emotions with care, we also strengthen the inner resilience needed for the larger transformation our world is calling for. These practices help loosen patterns of fear and reactivity so we can participate in the great turning toward more life-giving ways of being together.

Drawing on Buddhist psychology, together we’ll learn to recognize, accept, and gently hold difficult emotions. From this compassionate presence, emotions settle, insight emerges, and new possibilities become available for both personal and collective healing.

Source: Press Democrat

title: ART FOR EVERYONE Community Art Show 160+ Artists, Healdsburg
description:
*Art for Everyone* is a community exhibition celebrating the shared joy of creativity. Open to artists of all backgrounds and experience levels, the exhibition at Rena Charles Gallery brings together a wide range of voices and materials: glass and oil, etchings and block prints, ceramics and pastels, metalwork, photography, digital painting, collage, fiber, mixed media, and beyond. Spanning local artists and artists from across the country and around the world, *Art for Everyone* has become a gathering place for diverse creative perspectives; many paths meeting in a shared language of making.

Centered on connection, inclusivity, and diversity, *Art for Everyone* is grounded in the belief that art has the power to bring people together, and that every voice and vision belongs. By opening the doors wide and removing traditional barriers to entry, the exhibition honors the richness of creative expression within our community; welcoming over 160 artists who are both well established and those just beginning their creative journey, and affirming that art truly belongs to everyone.

Art for Everyone is on view and available to collect from February 1st - February 28th, 2026.

ARTIST RECEPTION Saturday, February 7, Noon to 4 PM - Meet the artists, collect a new work of art, and celebrate the rich diversity of creativity on view.

OPEN HOUSE Sunday, February 15, 11 AM to 4 PM - Additional opportunity to meet artists and view works.

Wine generously provided at both receptions by gallery neighbor Spicy Vines

description:
WHAT: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

DATE:            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

TIME: 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

WHERE:       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

DETAILS:

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         Offered Daily: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         Experience length: 2 hours

·         Wines: Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         Cost: $150 per Person

·         Exclusive Member Price: $95 per Member

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

title: Annual Kids N' Cancer Luncheon
location: Saints Constantine and Helen Greek Orthodox Church
description:
Every year on the second Sunday in February, the Saints Constantine & Helen’s Ladies Philoptochos Society hosts their annual Kids N’ Cancer Luncheon in the Community Hall after the Divine Liturgy.

This annual fundraiser event is dedicated to providing support for children afflicted with cancer and their families. All donations received go to offering a life-changing experience for children and their families to get away for a while and enjoy an all-expense-paid summer camp trip.

Families will enjoy four fun-filled, carefree summer days away from the sights and sounds of doctors and hospitals rooms where they spend so much of their time.

Donations for the event are taken at the door, with a suggested donation of $10 for adults and $5 for children for the luncheon. For those who are unable to attend this worthy event may still contribute a donation, accepting all donations from January 1st through the end of February.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Yoga Retreat: Spirituality and Torah
description:
Join us for an afternoon of movement and meaning. Regardless of your yoga experience or religious background, this event is open to all!

Diane Bloomfield is coming to Napa to share her unique blend of movement & Torah insight, rooted in the deep well of Jewish mystical tradition. Join us for an uplifting afternoon of movement & meaning.

You do not need to be Jewish or a Yogi to come experience this unique exploration of movement and spirituality. All are welcome!

This day retreat includes:

Torah Yoga class

Torah study & discussion

Restorative sound bath led by Beth Shalom member Amy Hall

Refreshments & kosher snacks

Diane Bloomfield is an internationally acclaimed teacher & author who founded Torah Yoga®, blending the wisdom of Jewish tradition with the mindful practice of yoga. She is the author of the classic Torah Yoga: Experiencing Jewish Wisdom through Classic Postures as well as her new book Playing With Fire: Hebrew Doorways to the Jewish Soul. Diane teaches Torah Yoga around the world.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Botanical Ink Making with Lena Wolff
description:
As part of Petaluma Arts Center's exhibition "Crafting Curiosity: Advancing a Legacy of Agriculture and Making at the Eames Ranch," Bay Area artist and craftswoman Lena Wolf leads a workshop exploring natural ink and paint making.

Uniquely different from working with stable store-bought art materials, making handmade color is dynamic and surprising, offering an environmentally sound approach to artmaking while also forming a deeper connection to place. During the class, Lena will share about her experience generating colors with plants and fungi during her residency at the Eames Ranch and relay the fundamentals of the process: from foraging and gathering, to extracting color into paint. Participants will create several color charts as well as learn how to adjust hues with a variety of additives, documenting the process along the way and taking recipes home for future experimentation.

As a longtime teacher of color theory, Lena will weave broader context into the workshop, sharing a brief history of paint-making and the phenomenon behind our perception of colors in interaction, looking at the subject through multiple lenses of art, craft, science, design and environmentalism.

All materials will be supplied and are included in the workshop fee.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Goatlandia Group Tour
description:
Join us for a Weekend Sanctuary Tour & Picnic Lunch 

Tours are held most Saturdays and the first Sunday of the month from April until November. Our educational tours are in groups up to 25 people and start at 12pm and last about 90 minutes. Our tour guides are dedicated staff and volunteers who know all about our animals and their personalities. You’ll meet our residents animals including goats, sheep, pigs, horses and our alpaca, learn about Goatlandia’s mission, and meet like minded animal lovers! 

Add on a Picnic Lunchbox \(includes an organic, plant-based sandwich, salad, fruit and a non- alcoholic beverage\) or Kids Lunch \(includes pb&j or almond butter& jam, carrots with ranch, fruit & kid-friendly drink\) & and enjoy it on our sanctuary grounds after your tour.  

Note: Thursdays at 5pm is the online reservation deadline for the upcoming weekend. For last minute reservations, email us: info@goatlandia.org.

Source: Press Democrat
