title: 11th Annual Farmers' Convergence
location: University of California Hopland Research and Extension Center
description:
The School of Adaptive Agriculture invites you to the 11th Annual Farmers’ Convergence on February 21, 2026, at the UC Hopland Research & Extension Center in Hopland, CA. 

This beloved farmer-to-farmer gathering is entering an exciting new chapter. After a decade of grassroots success, the Farmers’ Convergence is expanding to UC Hopland REC, marking a significant evolution that bridges lived farming experience with deep ecological practices. This partnership represents a deeper commitment to regenerative land stewardship and our local food economy. 

The event will bring together farmers, gardeners, schools and food activists, from beginners to seasoned veterans, conventional to experimental, for innovative solutions, knowledge exchange, and forward-thinking strategies. Together, we’ll explore soil regeneration, biodiversity, systems thinking, and economic sustainability while renewing our collective inspiration and momentum. It will include events the day before, and after. 

Everyone belongs in this conversation. Tickets are limited, so don’t delay. We hope you will join us as we champion collaborative progress and expanded possibility. 

Learn more: www.schoolofadaptiveagriculture.org/convergence

Source: Press Democrat

title: Sonoma Garden Park Volunteer Workday | Día de trabajo voluntario cada tercer viernes del mes
description:
\[Español abajo\] 

Every 3rd Friday of the month from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm we welcome existing and new volunteers for a fun morning of work and community building at Sonoma Garden Park. Depending on the season activities include prepping fields, planting, harvesting, weeding, pruning trees and prepping produce for the seasonal Saturday Harvest market.  

Join us for a fun opportunity to enjoy the bounty of each season, and to share and learn from other gardeners. Existing and new volunteers are encouraged to attend—no experience is necessary! Please be sure to bring your gardening gloves, hat, SPF and water. At noon you enjoy a light garden fresh lunch at our shady picnic area provided by Sonoma Ecology Center as a thank you to our wonderful volunteers! 

Los voluntarios juegan un papel vital en el Garden Park. ¡Te invitamos a ensuciarte las manos cada tercer viernes de mes! Únete a nosotros de 9:00 am. a 12:00 pm y conoce a los voluntarios existentes y nuevos. Las actividades incluyen deshierbe, siembra, poda y cosecha. Después del trabajo, disfruta de un almuerzo ligero proporcionado por el Centro Ecológico de Sonoma. 

Sonoma Garden Park está ubicado en 19996 7th St E, Sonoma, CA 95476 y es un proyecto del Sonoma Ecology Center.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?* art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?* is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit’s core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU’s Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Introduction to the Art of Bookmaking
description:
Schedule

Fridays, February 20 – March 13, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Other, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$220 – Registration Cost $30 – Materials Fee $250 – Total Registration CostLearn essential bookbinding techniques in this 4-week introduction to book arts. Create zines, pamphlets, accordion folds, and more using traditional paper-folding and stitching methods.

What you’ll do

Join guest artist, Bettina Pauly in this incredible introduction to book arts! The art of bookmaking, otherwise known as bookbinding, is the physical craft of creating an artistic book from start to finish. In this introductory 4-session class, you will learn the basic use of bookbinding tools and materials, along with simple bookbinding structures that utilize paper softcovers. Students will learn several basic bookbinding structures and stitches that every beginning book artist should know! Experience technical skills such as paper folding, cutting, sewing and gluing, mixed with artistic elements of design to create functional, elegant objects built for storytelling. The instructor will offer guided instruction in a supportive learning environment with a limited class size. Each 3-hour session will meet for four consecutive weeks and focus on the following core bookbinding techniques:

Session 1: Intro to tools and paper folding; one sheet wonder zine, ‘pants’ fold with and without cover, map folds

Session 2: Pamphlets, and Japanese stab hole binding; three hole pamphlet stitch, five hole pamphlet stitch, Japanese stab binding two holes / five holes 

Session 3: Accordion folds; accordion fold, accordion fold tipped into envelope cover, accordion fold with non-adhesive cover

Session 4: Magic wallets, and personal projects

The class materials fee will include paper and all the tools needed to create each of these projects. Students will be able to take home all of their book projects at the end of the workshop. Please note: This class requires some hand dexterity to maneuver bookbinding tools. Participants should feel comfortable using tools with sharp edges such as an awl, x-acto knife, and scissors.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Art Departments, Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

$230 Registration Fee $30 Materials Fee $260 Total Registration Fee

A class that is all about pinching! With instructor Dan, students will learn handbuilding methods to coil and pitch their vessels. With specific direction in learning the techniques to build any size of pot, from a large scale vessel to a small cup. We will learn how to support scaling up our forms through drying methods, interior ‘bone’ structure, and mastering directionality with our hands. There will be a focus on how we each make a mark upon a pot, and how to do so with purpose. Each student will create work that reflects the time-honored nature of handbuilding; when intention is given to the silhouette of a form, the lip of a cup, and/or the comfort of a handle. Each class will involve a warmup, a demo, and worktime. Most classes will have \(fun&thoughtful\) homework.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
**WHAT:** Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

**DATE:**            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

**TIME:** 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

**WHERE:**       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

**LINK:**             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

**DETAILS:**

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         **Offered Daily:** 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         **Experience length:** 2 hours

·         **Wines:** Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         **Cost:** $150 per Person

·         **Exclusive Member Price:** $95 per Member

**ADMISSION:** Members $95 | Non-members $150

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. In inclement weather, this experience will be hosted in our charming tasting room.

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sparkling Valentine’s Tasting at Cuvaison
description:
Celebrate Valentine’s season with a sparkling experience surrounded by the beauty of the Tai vineyard, where rolling vineyards and tranquil scenery set the mood.

Guests will enjoy a curated flight featuring elegant sparkling wine alongside expressive estate selections, perfect for savoring together. The experience invites you to slow down, toast to February, and indulge in the beauty of wine country.

**Group Size**:

Up to 4 guests, including non-tasters

**Duration:**

Please allow 60-90 minutes for this experience

**Admission:** $60 per person

**Available:** Daily through the month of February, reservation required

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Shut Up & Write!™ Santa Rosa REMOTE ZOOM FRIDAY
description:
Shut Up & Write!® Wine Country
**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We’ve discovered that it’s strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it’s true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal

Source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

description:

Located in Sonoma’s historic firehouse just steps from the square, Gehricke Tasting Room pours small-lot wines made with minimal intervention so you can enjoy the truest representation of each appellation.

description:
Machado Burgers’ weekly car show event is held every Friday 4pm-7pm. We gather with good cars, people, music and food. Every classic car that comes down receives a raffle ticket and entry into our best-of-show for a weekly trophy. Raffle drawings are 4:30, 5:30 and 6:30 and the best of the show is named at 6:45. Winners must be present for both raffles and trophies as the trophy features a picture of you and your car. Come on down and join us for some good community fun.

title: Our Wild Watershed- The Beauty Of Mushrooms with David Campbell
description:
Hosted by the Laguna de Santa Rosa Foundation, this engaging presentation invites you to join David Campbell as he uncovers the hidden world of mushrooms in our wild watershed—guaranteed to leave you in awe.

As the rainy season begins, wild mushrooms are popping up all over Sonoma County, and there’s no better time to learn about them!

Join David Campbell for a presentation full of photos and a lifetime of insight into the rich wild fungal activity in local forests and watersheds. This is an interactive, welcoming session where open discussion and questions are encouraged. Attendees are invited to bring recently collected mushroom specimens of interest for observation and identification during the meeting.

Come learn, explore, and deepen your understanding of the fascinating world of local mushrooms—all from the comfort of the presentation space.

Presenter Bio: David Campbell has been studying, teaching, and safely enjoying wild mushrooms for over 50 years. He served more than a decade on the council of the Mycological Society of San Francisco \(MSSF\), including two terms as president, and was the original president of the Mycological Society of Marin County \(MycoMarin\). Focused on edible and poisonous mushrooms, he has led numerous fungal forays for MSSF, the Sonoma Mycological Association \(SOMA\), and the annual Napa Truffle Festival.

David has decades of experience with the San Francisco Poison Control Center responding to mushroom-related incidents and has facilitated mycological seminars with author David Arora. As an expert mycophagist and long-time educator, he is the principal of Wild About Mushrooms Company, teaching basic mycology and organizing wild mushroom events across California. His international tour company, MycoVentures, offers truffle, mushroom, and wine tours in Italy and Croatia.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. No experience is necessary to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Beginner Salsa Friday
description:
Join our beginner salsa class. No experience or partner is needed. Just comfortable shoes and desire to have fun!

Great for first timers!

No dance experience required

Non-marking shoes soles

No partner necessary

We know it can be challenging to learn something new. As such, the beginner salsa class is geared for people who are starting out or those that are returning to refresh their skills. Our relaxed environment is perfect for learning salsa basics, as we make it fun and enjoyable. In this class you will learn basic directional steps, proper frame for partner-work and simple turn patterns. We organize our curriculum so that the movements are easy to remember. Join us to learn the fundamentals! No experience is necessary and no partner is required. Drop-in fee is $20.

Date & Time: Fridays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM

Instructor: Lucie Ebnerova

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway #8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Intermediate Salsa with Tyler
description:
Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?

Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. In this class, you’ll go beyond the basics to learn intricate footwork, enhance your leading and following skills, and master the body movement that will make you shine on the dance floor. This class is for anyone ready to learn the techniques and intermediate steps needed to take their dancing to the next level.

You’ll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

Master complex turn patterns and combinations.

Strengthen your lead and follow for seamless, connected dancing.

Adapt to different partners and music with ease on the social dance floor.

What to Expect: Instructor Tyler blends a fun, supportive atmosphere with structured lessons, so you’re always challenged but never overwhelmed. Helping you progress steadily while keeping the joy of salsa front and center.

Details:

No partner necessary—rotations ensure everyone dances.

Please wear non-marking shoes to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

When: Fridays, 6:30 PM – 7:30 PM

Instructor: Tyler Crandall

Where: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8, San Rafael, CA

title: EIRINIE CARSON
description:
PETALUMA -- Copperfield's Books welcomes friend and beloved local author Eirinie Carson to Petaluma for the launch of her hypnotic new Gothic thriller - Bloodfire, Baby: A Novel! Join us for a chilling reading and discussion followed by an audience Q&A and book signing with photo opportunities. This is a free event, registration required due to limited seating. A maternal gothic tale of new motherhood and the torment of a centuries-old haunting Before the shadow appeared, Sofia thought mothering would be all sun-drenched light and white linen sheets, as seen advertised by the momfluencers of Instagram. In her gorgeous home anchored in a posh suburb, far removed from her origins, Sofia revels in her success. Motherhood seems like the natural next step, but when her husband travels for a work trip, leaving Sofia all alone with their unnamed three-week-old baby, she can't quite square how mothering falls solely in her lap. Nobody seems able or willing to help her: not her husband, not her best friend, and certainly not the zealot mother she cut off long ago. Her postpartum reality is overtaken by an ominous figure. Sleep-deprivation collides with a darkness that creeps in and begins to spread, threatening to consume her entirely. As her grip on reality slips away, Sofia learns of an insidious haunting that has plagued the eldest daughters in her family for generations. With her baby's safety on the line, Sofia realizes she must confront her murky history or risk losing more than just the veneer of perfection. Author: Eirinie Carson is a member of the Writers Grotto in San Francisco and a frequent contributor to Mother magazine. Her work has also appeared in LitHub, Notre Dame Review, Mortal Mag, Electric Literature, The Sonora Review, and others. Bloodfire, Baby is her first novel. Praise: ‘Eirinie Carson's BLOODFIRE, BABY arrives kicking and screaming with flames in its hair and lightning in its hands as it heralds a new powerful literary voice being born. Raw, honest, mysterious and ultimately courageous, BLOODIFRE, BABY is the book that will peel away your misconceptions and lay bare the power and the beauty of the feminine mystique. Not to be missed.' -S.A. Cosby author of King of Ashes ‘BLOODFIRE, BABY is a ferocious, hypnotic descent that burrows under your skin and refuses to let go. Carson expertly plunges us into the sleepless, paranoid depths of new motherhood where ancestral ghosts collide with the present-day terror of a negotiable reality. A fever dream, a psychological thriller, and a whip smart commentary on modern motherhood, BLOODFIRE, BABY is destined to be a novel people press into each other's hands, whispering 'you have to read this.'-Chelsea Bieker, author of Madwoman ‘The most nuanced examination of postpartum I have ever read, BLOODFIRE, BABY spans continents and generations in its kaleidoscopic portrayal of motherhood, race, and class. Rarely is a novel as propulsive as it is illuminating, but this is uncannily infused with a heavy, knowing dread that intensifies with each turn of the page. That expert pacing--along with the novel's exquisite language, depth, and scope--announces Eirinie Carson as a refreshing and essential new voice in contemporary fiction.' -Margaret Wilkerson Sexton, author of On The Rooftop ‘BLOODFIRE, BABY is a novel of crackling honesty, daring, and vigor that only a mother could write. Carson's relentless, page-turning plot weaves the frank, uninhibited sensualities of motherhood and body horror into a thick, powerful rope, then ties you tightly to the page right alongside our heroine. Carson's novel is a wild, transformative ride written in neon from the first page to the last. Yes, only a mother could create this haunting, mighty book, but everyone must read it.' --Savala Nolan, Don't Let it Get You Down: Essays on Race, Gender, and the Body

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description:
In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Scrooge! The Musical
description:
The heroine in this actor’s tour-de-force is an ordinary middle class English housewife. As she prepares chips and eggs for dinner, she ruminates on her life and tells the wall about her husband, her children, her past, and an invitation from a girlfriend to join her on holiday in Greece to search for romance and adventure. Starring Jennifer King \(Bad Dates, Belle of Amherst.\)

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

title: Benise
description:
Emmy Award Winning Spanish Guitar and Dance Spectacular.

It’s one hot night as Benise celebrates 25 years of fiery Spanish guitar and dance. 

Benise \(pronounced Buh-nes-say\) shattered the mold of Spanish guitar by combining world music and dance – the only show of its kind! 

2025 marks the year that Benise, “The Prince of Spanish Guitar,” launches his 25th Anniversary Tour and 8th PBS Special “25 Years of Passion!” 

 Armed with his Spanish guitar and a stage full of musicians and elaborately choreographed dancers, Benise takes the audience on a musical journey through Spanish Flamenco, Cuban Salsa, Brazilian Samba, Parisian Waltz, exotic drumming, and more! 

The 25th Anniversary tour establishes Benise’s Emmy Award winning show as one of the longest running Latin-themed theatrical productions touring the world.

For Benise, music has always been a journey. From his humble beginnings as a street performer, to being featured on the \#1 rated show in the USA – Dancing With The Stars. Guitarist and creative force behind the event, Benise, comments “I wanted to push the boundaries of Nuevo Flamenco/Spanish guitar while combining the elements of dance and theater. This show is a celebration of all the shows we’ve done over the last 25 years.” 

The Emmy Award-winning composer along with an international cast of musicians and dancers will entertain audiences with a two-hour show that “is an escape from all of their problems,” Benise says. Beyond the new material, Benise says “the live show will incorporate some fan favorites from my street performing days and rock classics like Led Zeppelin’s Kashmir and AC/DC’s Thunderstruck.” In addition, Benise adds his signature touch to classics such as “Ave Maria, “Moonlight Sonata,” and Vivaldi’s “Summer” from The Four Seasons.

Benise adds, “This is a great show for the whole family; I really think we have something for everyone. I hope people will be inspired by our story, by the music, by the production--and have the passion to follow their own dreams.” 

The Theatrical World Music and Dance spectacle that has been called “The Latin Riverdance” 

‘The Prince of Spanish Guitar’  - Dancing With The Stars

‘Bennissimo!’ - Chicago News

‘Extreme Flamenco Fusion’ - Screen India

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Cheese & Butter Classes
description:
Join award-winning cheesemaker Sheana Davis and wine expert Ben Sessions for unforgettable cheese and butter making classes. Perfect for team building, celebrations, and educational events, our classes are interactive, fun, and easy for everyone. 

From classes on how to make Creme de Ricotta wheel to Mozzarella Pulling to butter-making classes, guests will always leave with a creamy treat to take home \(if it makes it that far!\) – so bring a small cooler with you.  

Food has a remarkable ability to bring people together. 

Cheesemaking classes are perfect for team-building activities, company meetings, team celebrations, staff events, corporate fun, bridal parties, couples classes, girlfriend getaway weekends, LGBT events, EBT education courses, and more. Classes held year-round on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, 12:00-2:00 and 3:30-5:30pm. 

See the full schedule of all our cheese and butter making classes here.  

With each class, we give back to the community by providing meals for food-insecure seniors in Sonoma Valley. After learning how to make cheese, our guests can prepare these meals and write personal notes for the seniors on the lids.  

Join us in making a positive impact while having fun and learning a new skill.   

Your Cheesemaking Experience: 



Begin with local wine and an artisanal cheese tasting.

Learn to make cheese and compound butter with everyday ingredients and tools.

Enjoy specialized classes for dishes like lasagna and gourmet grilled cheeses.

Exclusive guest cheesemakers often share their techniques.

Ideal for corporate events, bridal parties, getaways, and more.



Sheana and Ben pride themselves on using ingredients readily available in any local grocery store, with cooking supplies used reside in most home cooks’ kitchens. Guest cheesemakers are often available to showcase their own cheeses and techniques, making the class a truly unique experience. 

Check the schedule for Wine Country-based cheesemaking classes.  

Customize Your Class:To arrange private or corporate classes at venues like Sonoma Fairmont Mission Inn or Silverado Resort, contact us at sheanadavis@gmail.com. We can help create a unique and unforgettable experience for your entire group! Private and corporate classes may be arranged and are hosted at various Wine Country venues, including The Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn, Silverado Resort, The Lodge in Sonoma, and private homes and estates. 

To register: 

https://theepicureanconnection.com/events/

Source: Press Democrat

title: 11th Annual Farmers' Convergence
location: University of California Hopland Research and Extension Center
description:
The School of Adaptive Agriculture invites you to the 11th Annual Farmers’ Convergence on February 21, 2026, at the UC Hopland Research & Extension Center in Hopland, CA. 

This beloved farmer-to-farmer gathering is entering an exciting new chapter. After a decade of grassroots success, the Farmers’ Convergence is expanding to UC Hopland REC, marking a significant evolution that bridges lived farming experience with deep ecological practices. This partnership represents a deeper commitment to regenerative land stewardship and our local food economy. 

The event will bring together farmers, gardeners, schools and food activists, from beginners to seasoned veterans, conventional to experimental, for innovative solutions, knowledge exchange, and forward-thinking strategies. Together, we’ll explore soil regeneration, biodiversity, systems thinking, and economic sustainability while renewing our collective inspiration and momentum. It will include events the day before, and after. 

Everyone belongs in this conversation. Tickets are limited, so don’t delay. We hope you will join us as we champion collaborative progress and expanded possibility. 

Learn more: www.schoolofadaptiveagriculture.org/convergence

Source: Press Democrat

title: Trail Crew Saturdays
description:
Help Sugarloaf with trail restoration work by coming to our monthly Saturday Volunteer Trail Crew, 9:00 am-1:00 pm. Activities include bridge and step construction, installing signs, clearing, lifting, carrying, and hiking. 

Meet at the White Barn. Bring gloves, hat, and water that you can carry hands-free (i.e. bring a backpack). Wear long pants, boots or sturdy shoes and sunscreen. Long sleeves are suggested as poison oak is present. We have tools and trained crew leaders with tasks for all. Minors must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. We will provide tools and refreshments.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Pediatric CPR First Aid Certification Class for Childcare Providers
description:
Pediatric CPR First Aid Class for Childcare Providers

American Heart Association training and certification in CPR, AED use, choking treatment, and first aid.

This Pediatric CPR First Aid class is intended for those who work in licensed childcare facilities \(such as daycare providers and preschool teachers\) and meets state / EMSA requirements for CPR First Aid training for CA childcare providers. American Heart Association "Heartsaver Pediatric First Aid CPR AED" certifications are issued on the same day.

Vive CPR is a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/pediatric-cpr-first-aid-certification/

Contact Us: \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Park Rx—Beginner Hiking for Fitness
description:
The Hiking for Fitness Series is back! Join us on this fitness program, where the leaders will guide you on a series of 8 weekly hikes with the challenge increasing each week. Before the first hike, the leader will discuss proper shoes, hydration, incorporating hiking poles, proper pacing, etc. The group's final hike aims for the long route up Brushy Peaks Trail, where hikers can enjoy the beautiful vistas.

The following is a list of possible routes selected for this hiking series: 1) Sat 1/3 - White Barn to Uranus, 2.1 miles, 180 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 2) Sat 1/10 - Meadow- Hillside loop, 3 miles, 490 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 3) Sat 1/17 - Lake Ralphine & Spring Lake loop, 4.3 miles, 420 ft elev \[meet @ Howarth Park's Boathouse\] 4) Sat 1/24- Jack London State Historic Park, May’s Clearing, 3.5 miles, 820 ft elev \[meet @ upper parking lot, 2400 London Ranch Road, Glen Ellen, CA 95442\] 5) Sat 1/31 - Vista Trail loop, 3.5 miles, 830 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\] 6) Sat 2/7 – Stern + Waterfall loop, 2.7 miles, 750 ft elev \[meet @ main lot\] 7) Sat 2/14 – Sonoma Valley Regional Park & Lake Suttonfield loop, 4.3, miles, 770 ft elev \[meet at Valley of the Moon Trailhead on Arnold Dr.\] 8) Sat 2/21 – Hillside to Neptune picnic table, 4.4 miles, 970 ft elev \[meet @ white barn\]

Please note these routes or dates are subject to change depending on logistics such as heavy rains or non-passable water crossings. Wear appropriate footwear for rocky/slippery trails and layers. Bring at least a quart (32oz) of water, and if desired, a snack. The group will be limited to 35 participants. 

The hiking series costs $80 (plus a $10 parking fee per visit. Note that the Sugarloaf Annual Pass is $59 and valid at Sugarloaf and Jack London SHP), or free-of-cost for participants with a November 2025 or newer Park Rx from a Sonoma County Medical Provider. Go to https://sugarloafpark.org/activities/parks-rx-program/ for information on our Park Rx program and to download the form. The number of **available Park Rx tickets is limited**; **please have your Rx ready at the time of sign up**.

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That’s why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps: You’ll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work: Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns: We’ll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We’ve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required: Whether you’ve never danced before or it’s been a while, you’re welcome here!

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

Date & Time:

Thursdays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM Fridays @ 5:30PM – 6:30PM Saturdays @ 9:00 AM – 10:00 AM

Instructor: Lucie Ebnerova

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Lunar New Year Printed Paper Lanterns
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 21, 2026 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

14\+

$30 – Registration Cost $15 – Materials Fee $45 – Total Registration CostCelebrate Lunar New Year 2026 by creating a handmade paper lantern with LED lights. Design personalized panels using stencils, block printing, and fiber techniques.

What you’ll do

Join us in our print studio to welcome in the Year of the Fire Horse for 2026! In many Asian cultures, the Lunar New Year holiday brings families and friends together to celebrate. Lanterns symbolize good luck, health and prosperity and their light is a way to set an intention, make a wish and spread good fortune. In this special annual workshop, participants will design and build a unique handmade foldable lantern using kozo paper, chipboard, fiber and small LED lights. Guests will be encouraged to experiment, craft and create their own printed personal imagery on four panels using a variety of stencils, block printing tools, and fiber. Each participant will make one personalized functional box lantern in our studio to take home and enjoy in celebration! All materials will be provided. No prior experience is necessary.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Afro Fusion
description:
This annual dance and music event is a vibrant celebration of Black history, cultural awareness, and unity through the universal languages of movement and sound. Bringing together rich traditions from across the African diaspora, the event creates a powerful space where culture is honored, stories are shared, and communities connect through the love of dance and music.

Featuring special guest artists and cultural leaders:

Nigerian Dance \(Igbo\) – Uzo Nwankpa

Guinée Traditional Rhythm and Dance – Naby Bangoura

Conscious Musicality/Capoeira– Mestre Negoativo

Orixás in Sound: Afro-Brazilian Music and Song Traditions – Mestra Minha Velha

Together, these artists offer an immersive experience that celebrates ancestral roots, living traditions, and the collective power of rhythm, movement, and cultural expression.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Insight into Health: Matters of the Heart
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 21, 2026 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Culinary Arts, Wellness

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$50 – Registration Cost

Learn heart-healthy eating with Registered Dietitian Allison McKeany. Discuss cardiovascular health, key medical tests, and cook nutritious frittatas.

What you’ll do

How healthy is your heart? Join Registered Dietitian, Allison McKeany, for a discussion all about the top cause of death for both men and women in the U.S., including key labs and tests to discuss with your doctor and how lifestyle habits can—and can’t—shape heart health. Continue the conversation in the kitchen with a cooking demo and taste test featuring an unexpected heart-healthy dish: Mix & Match Frittatas.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Inner Beloved: The Heart's Journey to Divine Unity
description:
with Hameed Ali (A. H. Almaas)

Experience an exploration of the spiritual journey as a path of love, where the heart’s discontent becomes the doorway to ultimate fulfillment.

Although the heart seeks fulfillment in people, possessions, and experiences, no external love can truly satisfy our deepest longing. Our discontent is an opportunity—a sacred invitation to turn inward. True fulfillment arises only when we empty our hearts to make space for the formless and intangible inner Beloved that is our true nature.

Join A. H. Almaas, founder of the Ridhwan School and the Diamond Approach, on a transformative journey of the heart. Discover how the search for love leads us through emptiness into a luminous darkness—a place where the mind is confounded, but the heart awakens to a passionate love for the unknown and to its potential for resting into the deepest fulfillment possible.

This half-day program is based on the new book, *The Inner Beloved: The Heart’s Journey to Divine Unity (Shambhala, 2026)*. Copies of the book will be available for purchase at the bookstore, and onsite participants may have their copy of the book signed.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Free Rowing Lessons in Classic Rowboats
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn the timeless—and beautiful—art of rowing? The Floathouse crew is here for you! This season, every Saturday from January 17 to March 28, we’ll host free rowing lessons for adults. Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Early Spring Wildflowers & Plant Uses
description:
Join Certified CA Naturalist John Lynch as we walk through the sublime beauty of sage green lichen on burgundy manzanita bark and moss-bedecked oaks down to the 25-foot dramatic plunge of Sonoma Creek. Beginning at the Visitor Center, we’ll follow Pony Gate Trail’s grassy slope, into mixed evergreen forest, along Canyon Trail’s shady riparian corridor (with the promise of newts and salamanders) to the waterfall. The return takes us back uphill to Adobe Canyon Rd and back to the Visitor Center. This stroll is approximately 2 miles with 595-feet of elevation gain. 

Meet at the Visitor Center. Tickets are $10 for general admission, $5 for youth (12-17 year olds), students, Sugarloaf members, Sugarloaf or RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Wear layers, appropriate footwear for muddy and/or slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water and if desired, a snack. Heavy rain cancels and will be announced early on the day of the hike. Parking fees apply.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Quilt Coats
description:
Join stitch extraordinaire Eva Valfer for a cozy and creative sewing workshop. Learn how to turn quilts—or other salvaged fabric—into wearable garments. Eva will guide you through simple techniques for cutting, assembling, and finishing your own quilt coat using hand-stitching and machine sewing methods. 

Bring your own quilt or fabric, or choose from Eva's stash of materials, and spend the day stitching something both beautiful and functional. Perfect for beginners and seasoned sewists alike.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Cuentos con Ritmo (Stories with Rhythm)
description:
Cuentos con Ritmo \(Stories with Rhythm\)



Cuentos con Ritmo | Cuentos \* Música \* Movimiento 

Presentado por Colors of Spanish 

Cuentos con Ritmo es una oportunidad única semanal para niños de 1 a 5 años y sus familias, el cual aporta alegría, comprensión y aprecio por la lengua española a toda la comunidad. Durante Cuentos con Ritmo, los pequeños visitantes y sus familias participan de forma lúdica en historias interactivas con música y movimiento fortaleciendo nuestra diversa comunidad y entusiasmo por la lengua meta. 

Cuentos con Ritmo es presentado por Guadalupe Tausch en colaboración con la organización que fundó, Colors of Spanish. Originaria del estado de Guanajuato en México, tiene una maestría en español con énfasis en la adquisición de una segunda lengua para la primera infancia y continúa sus estudios enfocada en la primera infancia especializándose en la adquisición de idiomas a través de la música/movimiento. Colors of Spanish ofrece talleres para profesores, bibliotecarios y cuidadores y organiza programas de cuentos en español con música y movimiento en escuelas, bibliotecas y museos locales. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Cuentos con Ritmo | Cuentos \* Música \* Movimiento 

Presented by Colors of Spanish 

Cuentos con Ritmo \(Stories with Rhythm\) is a weekly one-of-a-kind opportunity for children ages 1-5 and their families that brings joy, understanding and appreciation for the Spanish language to Spanish- and English-speaking speakers alike. During Cuentos con Ritmo, young visitors and their families playfully engage in interactive stories with music and movement that build community and an excitement for language! 

Cuentos con Ritmo is presented by Guadalupe Tausch in collaboration with the organization she founded, Colors of Spanish. Originally from the state of Guanajuato in México, she has a master’s degree in Spanish with emphasis in second language acquisition for early childhood and continues her study of childhood and music/movement trainings. Colors of Spanish provides workshops for teachers, librarians and caregivers and hosts Spanish story time with music & movement programs at local schools, libraries, and museums. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Designed for kids 1-5, families, and siblings.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Salsa Beginner Marin – Saturday
description:
**Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?** Join on on Saturday – Salsa Beginner Marin

Are you a beginner who’s always wanted to learn salsa? Salsa classes are designed to help you build a strong foundation. In this class, you’ll learn the fundamental footwork, practice the basic turns, and understand the essential body movement that will make you feel confident on the dance floor. This class is perfect for anyone ready to learn the techniques and foundational steps needed to start their salsa journey.

Salsa is fun, and we make learning it stress-free! Our relaxed, beginner-friendly class is the ideal starting point. You don’t need a partner, nor any dance experience!

In this class you will learn:

Basic directional steps that form the foundation of salsa.

Proper frame for comfortable and effective partner-work.

Simple, easy-to-remember turn patterns.

Get ready to learn the fundamentals and have a great time!

**Details:**

**No partner necessary**—rotations ensure everyone dances

Please wear **non-marking shoes** to protect the floor

Arrive 10 minutes early; warm up and settle in

**When:** Saturday, 10:00 am – 11:00 am

**Where:** 4140 Redwood Highway #8, San Rafael, CA

title: Afro Fusion
description:
This annual dance and music event is a vibrant celebration of Black history, cultural awareness, and unity through the universal languages of movement and sound. Bringing together rich traditions from across the African diaspora, the event creates a powerful space where culture is honored, stories are shared, and communities connect through the love of dance and music.

Featuring special guest artists and cultural leaders:

**Nigerian Dance (Igbo)** – *Uzo Nwankpa*

**Guinée Traditional Rhythm and Dance** – *Naby Bangoura*

**Conscious Musicality/Capoeira**– *Mestre Negoativo*

**Orixás in Sound: Afro-Brazilian Music and Song Traditions** – *Mestra Minha Velha*

Together, these artists offer an immersive experience that celebrates ancestral roots, living traditions, and the collective power of rhythm, movement, and cultural expression.

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Inner Beloved: The Heart's Journey to Divine Unity
description:
with Hameed Ali \(A. H. Almaas\)

Experience an exploration of the spiritual journey as a path of love, where the heart’s discontent becomes the doorway to ultimate fulfillment.

Although the heart seeks fulfillment in people, possessions, and experiences, no external love can truly satisfy our deepest longing. Our discontent is an opportunity—a sacred invitation to turn inward. True fulfillment arises only when we empty our hearts to make space for the formless and intangible inner Beloved that is our true nature.

Join A. H. Almaas, founder of the Ridhwan School and the Diamond Approach, on a transformative journey of the heart. Discover how the search for love leads us through emptiness into a luminous darkness—a place where the mind is confounded, but the heart awakens to a passionate love for the unknown and to its potential for resting into the deepest fulfillment possible.

This half-day program is based on the new book, The Inner Beloved: The Heart’s Journey to Divine Unity \(Shambhala, 2026\). Copies of the book will be available for purchase at the bookstore, and onsite participants may have their copy of the book signed.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Free Rowing Lessons in Classic Rowboats
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn the timeless—and beautiful—art of rowing? The Floathouse crew is here for you! This season, every Saturday from January 17 to March 28, we’ll host free rowing lessons for adults. Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Rise & Shine With Olive Oil - A Demo at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:
What if your favorite breakfast dishes could be healthier without sacrificing flavor? Join us for a cooking demonstration where you'll learn how extra virgin olive oil can enhance your morning meals and support your wellness.

This demonstration comes at a great time—the USDA's recently released Dietary Guidelines for Americans encourage using oils rich in essential fatty acids, like olive oil, when cooking or adding fats to meals.

In this hour-long demonstration, Gold Ridge Organic Farms' Lori Myers will walk you through two delicious recipes that prove olive oil isn't just for lunch and dinner:

Customizable EVOO Granola – Learn how to create a crunchy, nutrient-rich granola using Gold Ridge Organic Farms' award-winning extra virgin olive oil. We'll share creative ways to enjoy it beyond the breakfast bowl, making it a versatile staple in your kitchen.

Olive Oil Hollandaise – Discover how to prepare a smooth hollandaise sauce made with olive oil instead of butter—perfect for eggs Benedict, asparagus, or your Sunday brunch spread.

Your Experience Includes: • Scenic ride to our charming Apple Cottage in our apple-themed trolley or apple blossom-pink VW van • Expert cooking demonstration with tips and techniques you can use at home • Generous tastings of both recipes, plated as you'd serve them at home • A take-home bag of olive oil granola • 10% discount on all Farm Shop purchases

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Urchin Dye a Beanie
description:
In this workshop, you’ll help the kelp by dyeing a beanie with the overpopulation of purple sea urchins!

Sea Urchins are incredible creatures. However, due to human impact, their populations have gone unchecked, and they have consumed 95% of the kelp forests in California.

In efforts to help the kelp and honor these magnificent animals, you’ll dye a Climate Beneficial Verified Beanie using urchins from the waters surrounding Sea Ranch. $180 per person.

Source: Press Democrat

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:

title: Redwood Writers General Meeting - Christine Walker
description:
Christine Walker: SENSORY, WHOLE-BODY WRITING: How to bring Memorable Characters Alive on the Page!

Please bring something savory or sweet to share in our potluck!

Note: The February meeting will be in Room 5 at the Finley Center, in the Senior Wing.

How do writers make the “fabulous” feel real so that readers suspend disbelief? When we are writing from “reality,” how do we guide readers’ emotions in the direction of the story? In this presentation, we’ll examine work by accomplished authors and our own writing for ways to paint vividly with words, enliven narrative, and awaken readers’ awareness through sensory details within a realm of sensory information that says “these characters, this place, this time, this story.”

About the Presenter:Christine Walker is a visual artist and author of the novel “Tap Dancing at the Bluebird” \(Sibylline Press\) and the memoir “A Painter’s Garden: Cultivating the Creative Life” \(Warner Books\), and co-author and illustrator of the children’s book “Wooleycat’s Musical Theater.” She has an MFA in Writing and Literature in Fiction from Bennington College and an MA in Creative Arts Interdisciplinary. She is also a consultant in strategic visioning and a writing teacher. She teaches in community venues and online through Sibyl Writing Craft. She lives in Sonoma County.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Layered Impressions: Exploring Texture & Pattern in Gel Print Monotypes
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 21, 2026 11:00 Am – 3:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Drawing & Painting, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

16\+

$115 – Registration Cost $10 – Materials Fee $125 – Total Registration CostCreate unique gel plate prints using acrylics as you explore texture, color layering, and playful monoprinting techniques. All materials provided.

What you’ll do

Create beautiful, one-of-a-kind designs on paper using a gel plate and acrylic paint. Mixed media artist Catherine Cruz will guide you through the basics of this playful printing process, sharing her techniques for building texture, layering colors, and creating unique designs. You will produce a collection of unique prints—perfect for use in collage, mixed media artwork, or handmade cards. This workshop is ideal for anyone curious about this exciting monoprinting method and is perfectly suited for beginners. What you’ll get from this workshop:

Methods for applying paint and pulling successful prints

Techniques for creating unique and intricate layered designs

Creative use of mark-making tools and masks

Strategies for combining techniques

All materials are provided: Gel plate, brayer roller, acrylic paint, stencils, mark-making tools, paper. A variety of papers will be provided but you are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to experiment on. Examples of suitable papers include tissue paper, Japanese rice papers, calligraphy paper, recycled book pages, and basically any paper that is porous and absorbent. Class will start with a demonstration so please arrive a few minutes early to get set up so we can start on time. We will take a short lunch break from 12:30pm-1:00pm so kindly bring your lunch and a beverage.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

title: Jazz & Ballet Combo: Ages 8-12
description:
Saturdays, January 17 – March 14, 2026 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Categories: Dance & Movement, Kids

Ages

8 – 12 years old

$200 Total Registration Fee

Registration Fee includes full enrollment for 9 weeks of instruction and the recital costume fee

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps.

About the Class

A fun and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps. Instruction will include warm up exercises, increased vocabulary and beginning mini ballet barre ballet positions, across the floor exercises, beginning turns and leaps and beginning choreography is taught at the end of class to different styles of music. Exercises will be modified or enhanced to the individual’s level. Class will be conducted in a positive and attentive environment and is designed to develop memorization, flexibility, and musicality. This class will help the student gain coordination and confidence to take into their daily lives. Small performing opportunities based upon a child’s interest but is not mandatory. There will be a recital on Saturday, March 21. More details to follow. Benefits include listening skills and concentration, increased coordination, and an understanding of movement, i.e. time, space, directions and balance, social skills and development of creativity.

Required Supply List

Dance shoes, ballet slippers or barefoot \(Need shoes, see below\) Please no socks \(grippy kind ok\) or just tights as the floor can be slippery. Comfortable clothing to move in or dancewear such as leotards, skirts, skirted leotards and tights \(with shoes\) of any color or style. Please no tutus or pajamas in class. Hair pulled off of face. Dress in layers as it can go from chilly to warm fast! Being dressed and ready for class is part of the experience and encourages focus and participation.

Room 213, Dance Studio

description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Redwood Writers General Meeting - Christine Walker
description:
**Christine Walker: SENSORY, WHOLE-BODY WRITING: How to bring Memorable Characters Alive on the Page!**

Please bring something savory or sweet to share in our potluck!

*Note: The February meeting will be in Room 5 at the Finley Center, in the Senior Wing.*

How do writers make the “fabulous” feel real so that readers suspend disbelief? When we are writing from “reality,” how do we guide readers’ emotions in the direction of the story? In this presentation, we’ll examine work by accomplished authors and our own writing for ways to paint vividly with words, enliven narrative, and awaken readers’ awareness through sensory details within a realm of sensory information that says “these characters, this place, this time, this story.”

**About the Presenter:**Christine Walker is a visual artist and author of the novel “Tap Dancing at the Bluebird” (Sibylline Press) and the memoir “A Painter’s Garden: Cultivating the Creative Life” (Warner Books), and co-author and illustrator of the children’s book “Wooleycat’s Musical Theater.” She has an MFA in Writing and Literature in Fiction from Bennington College and an MA in Creative Arts Interdisciplinary. She is also a consultant in strategic visioning and a writing teacher. She teaches in community venues and online through Sibyl Writing Craft. She lives in Sonoma County.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Barrel Tasting: A Family Affair
description:
Experience wine in the making at Dry Creek Vineyard, a family-owned winery with more than 50 years of history in Sonoma County’s Dry Creek Valley. This immersive Barrel Tasting invites guests beyond the tasting room and into the heart of the winemaking process — sampling wines straight from the barrel before they’re released to the public.

Hosted by the winery’s winemakers and longtime family grower partners, guests will hear directly from the people who farm the land, craft the wines and shape each vintage from vine to barrel.

Adding to the excitement, a skilled cooper will be on hand with a live barrel-making demonstration, showcasing the time-honored craft behind the oak barrels that influence flavor, texture and aging. It’s a dynamic, behind-the-scenes experience that blends wine, storytelling and hands-on artistry.

Perfect for curious wine lovers and anyone looking for a memorable wine country experience.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Early Childhood - Let's Make Music! (Ages 0 - 5 Years)
description:

All Levels

Event Categories: Family, Kids, Music

Age\(s\)

0-5

$10 – Single Session Registration Cost $70 – 7 Session Package Drop-in’s are welcome! Please arrive ten minutes before and register in the main office.

What you’ll do

This class is active and jam-packed with children and folk songs. Together we sing, dance, twirl, skip and fly while we experience the joy of making music. During each class children learn the words of simple songs, anticipate the timing of echo songs and glow with excitement during our movement songs. Taking turns and simple role play are all part of this class. Children will feel encouraged when parents model these interactions and they happily follow their leads. Language development with an increased vocabulary is naturally absorbed by young children, and the rhythmic beat of clapping and stomping guides our breathing. Come join us!

Membership has its benefits
