Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Naturalization and Citizenship  with Christine Cohen
description:
The Sonoma County Genealogical Society Presents

**Naturalization and Citizenship**

 with Christine Cohen

 Naturalization is the process by which a non-citizen becomes a citizen of the United States of America. Naturalization records can provide valuable information such as a person’s date of  birth and location, occupation, immigration year, marital status, spouse information, witnesses' names and addresses. Naturalization and the individual steps to citizenship could be done at any “court of record” in the United States.

 Christine is the Program Director of the Whittier Area Genealogical Society. She is also a member of the Tualatin Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution, the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames and the Association of Professional Genealogists.  Her interest in genealogy began in 1977 with the airing of the TV mini-series “Roots”. Her enthusiasm was piqued when she was given a typed pedigree chart, commissioned by her maternal grandfather, of their Dutch heritage from the New Netherlands in the 1650’s.

FREE

 Via ZOOM

 Register at **https://www.scgsonline.org**

title: Live Author Event - Jordan O'Halloran
description:
"Welcome to the whacky brain of Jordan O'Halloran - where aliens give out magic chocolates, shapeshifters exist, and Woodstock never really ended. 

Not a Novel is a collection of short stories that don't follow the rules - because life doesn't either. It's funny, surreal, and unexpectedly heartfelt, blending science fiction, humor, and a deep l ove for the messy miracle of being alive. 

These stories aren't about perfection or plot twists - they're about connection, curiosity, and the joy of imagining something wild."

description:
Learn how to save a life!

Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use, handling choking as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more.

Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use and handling choking, as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more.

We'll be using modern manikins and equipment in a small-group setting, and answering questions along the way. Your American Red Cross certificate will be valid for 2 years.

title: Monte Schulz: Undercity
description:
Join author Monte Schulz as he talks about, reads from, and signs his newest novel, Undercity. Schulz has written several books, including Crossing Eden and Naughty, and released the innovative album Seraphonium. His latest book is a companion to his award-winning novel Metropolis, and dives deeper into the upside-down dystopian underground labyrinth of cast-outs, misanthropes, and disenfranchised masses. Monte Schulz is the son of Peanuts creator and cartoonist Charles M. Schulz.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Scrooge! The Musical
description:
The heroine in this actor’s tour-de-force is an ordinary middle class English housewife. As she prepares chips and eggs for dinner, she ruminates on her life and tells the wall about her husband, her children, her past, and an invitation from a girlfriend to join her on holiday in Greece to search for romance and adventure. Starring Jennifer King \(Bad Dates, Belle of Amherst.\)

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use and handling choking, as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more. This is an American Red Cross-certified blended learning class: 50% online learning and 50% instructor-led. After booking you will receive a link directly from the American Red Cross with instructions on how to log in to complete the online portion of the class. This can be done at your convenience before we meet in person to practice our new skills with your friendly and experienced instructor. We'll be using modern manikins and equipment in a small-group setting, and answering questions along the way. Your American Red Cross certificate will be valid for 2 years.

description:

title: Sea Chantey and Songs of the Sea Singalong
description:
Please note the change of venue and time from our previous sing-alongs.\* Avast, ye saucy sailors! Come brave the perilous waters of Point Reyes and join us for a rollicking good time at Point Reyes National Seashore's Sea Chantey Sing-along at the Ken Patrick Visitor Center. Please bring your arsenal of sea chanteys, any musical instruments you'd like, and a willingness to laugh a lot!  It's so much fun when audience members lead shanties for the rest of us to join in on the chorus, and leading a song is encouraged! If you'd like to find a song \(or songs\) to share, I highly recommend setting one of your online music services to a sea chantey radio station and hear what's out there! Practice lyrics! Teach the chorus to our audience at the singalong! Our format is informal, mellow, and supportive, so if you've been wanting to push your comfort edge and lead a song, this is a perfect low-pressure opportunity. If you'd rather just singalong with the chantey choruses, that's fine too. We always have a great time no matter what. This free event is for chantey singers of all levels. Due to the nature of sea chanteys, there may be lyrics that are not appropriate for children. Reservations not required. To be added to the notification email list for future singalong dates, please email pore\_info@nps.gov For more information, please visit: nps.gov/pore/planyourvisit/calendar.htm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Barrel Tasting
description:
Experience wine in the making at Dry Creek Vineyard, a family-owned winery with more than 50 years of history in Sonoma County’s Dry Creek Valley. This immersive Barrel Tasting invites guests beyond the tasting room and into the heart of the winemaking process — sampling wines straight from the barrel before they’re released to the public.

Hosted by the winery’s winemakers and longtime family grower partners, guests will hear directly from the people who farm the land, craft the wines and shape each vintage from vine to barrel.

Adding to the excitement, a skilled cooper will be on hand with a live barrel-making demonstration, showcasing the time-honored craft behind the oak barrels that influence flavor, texture and aging. It’s a dynamic, behind-the-scenes experience that blends wine, storytelling and hands-on artistry.

Perfect for curious wine lovers and anyone looking for a memorable wine country experience.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Unplugged & Uncorked Music Series at Gehricke Tasting Room
description:
Join us for ***Unplugged & Uncorked***, a live music series at **Gehricke Tasting Room**. Enjoy performances by acclaimed local musicians paired with Gehricke wines, plus **Mary’s Pizza Shack** available to order. 

Located in Sonoma’s historic firehouse just steps from the square, Gehricke Tasting Room pours small-lot wines made with minimal intervention so you can enjoy the truest representation of each appellation.  

Walk-ins are welcome, and seating is available on a first-come, first-served basis. Reservations are recommended. 

*Unplugged & Uncorked* runs on Saturdays from 5 to 7:30 p.m.

Source: Press Democrat

description:

title: 14th Annual Crab Feast at Buena Vista
description:
The night begins in our elegant Bubble Lounge, where guests will enjoy thoughtfully prepared appetizers paired with vibrant sparkling wines, setting a festive and indulgent tone. From there, the experience continues into the renowned Wine Tool Museum for a decadent three-course cracked crab dinner, expertly paired with an exceptional selection of wines.

To elevate the evening even further, select Library wines will be poured, offering rare and distinguished expressions that add depth, history, and sophistication to this celebration of flavor, heritage, and hospitality.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Crab Feast at Buena Vista Winery
description:
Buena Vista Winery invites guests to the 14th Annual Crab Feast, a beloved tradition held in the winery's historic Champagne Cellar. The evening begins in the elegant Bubble Lounge with carefully crafted appetizers paired with lively sparkling wines, setting a festive and indulgent tone. Guests then move to the Wine Tool Museum for a decadent three-course cracked crab dinner, thoughtfully paired with exceptional wines. To enhance the experience, select Library wines are available, offering rare and distinguished vintages that bring depth, history, and sophistication to the evening. This celebration combines culinary excellence and fine wines creating an unforgettable night for food and wine enthusiasts alike.

title: Queen of Hearts Dance
description:
Step into the Queen of Hearts Rock 'n' Roll Dance Party! Big O and Company will keep the dance floor packed all night with rock 'n' roll favorites, irresistible rhythms, and the kind of showmanship that gets the whole room moving.

Two bars will be serving wine, beer and non-alcoholic beverages while the HopMonk food truck serves up delicious bites. Whether you come dressed in red, channel your inner royalty, or simply show up ready to dance, you'll be swept into an atmosphere of pure rock‑and‑roll spirit.

It's an unforgettable night of music, dancing, and community: Sonoma‑style. Tickets are limited, so grab yours now and get ready to rule the dance floor.

Tickets: $20 online or $30 at the door

title: Comedian Mark Christopher Lawrence
description:
The Laugh Cellar presents: 

Headliner Comedian Mark Christopher Lawrence in the Reserve Room at Balletto Vineyards

Mark Christopher Lawrence (MCL) is an accomplished actor and comedian, celebrated for his versatility on both stage and screen. Known for his clean, clever, and laugh-out-loud comedy.  He’s a two-time Emmy Award nominee and a recipient of the San Diego Critics Circle’s prestigious Craig Noel Award for Outstanding Actor of the Year. Audiences know and love him as “Big Mike” from the hit NBC series Chuck, and his recent work includes starring in the holiday film on Amazon Bringing Back Christmas, and Season 4 of All The Queen’s Men on BET+.

title: Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo
description:
Verismo Opera presents Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo

Free Admission. Become a member to support our new free admission policy.  Membership will be good for a year from purchase and will entitle members to early seating \(before non-members\) for performances.

 Stage Directors: Kristin Lund and Jennifer Rineman 

Conductors: Jonathan Khuner and Paul Schrage

Chamber Orchestra with English Supertitles 

In association with Mira Theatre Guild

For company information and to purchase memberships visit www.verismoopera.org

Dido and Aeneas is a monumental English Baroque opera masterpiece.  The story is based on Virgil’s The Aeneid and tells the tale of love and tragedy between Dido, Queen of Carthage, and the Trojan hero Aeneas.  This beloved gem includes stunning choruses, duos, trios and the iconic aria "Dido’s Lament".  In contrast to Dido and Aeneas’ measured passions, Pagliacci is full of uncontrollable passion, jealousy, tragedy, murder, and betrayal.  Laugh and weep with Canio as he sings "Vesti la giubba" \(the clown who cries behind his makeup\).

Mira Theatre Guild, 51 Daniels Avenue, Vallejo, CA 94590

- February 21, 2026 \(Saturday 7:00pm\)

- February 22, 2026 \(Sunday 3:00pm\)

- February 28, 2026 \(Saturday 7:00pm\)

- March 1, 2026 \(Sunday 3:00pm\)

- March 7, 2026  \(Saturday 7:00pm\)

- March 8, 2026  \(Sunday 3:00pm\)

title: René Jenkins & Ian Dogole - Sacred Spaces and Wild Places
description:
Two adventurous musical spirits who delight in the here and now. Over the last few years, internationally acclaimed recording artist and multipercussionist **Ian Dogole** (www.iandogole.com) and master multi-instrumentalist and sound healer **René Jenkins** (www.vibetherapy.org) have developed a symbiotic chemistry that knows no bounds. Their musical forays are deeply rooted in the ancestral indigenous music cultures of the Americas, Africa and beyond, and when combined with their irrepressible spirit of adventure, the result is a sonic feast for the senses and an uplifting, healing experience that is transformational.

·        **René Jenkins –** Native American, Zapotec and Mayan drone flutes, didjeridu, trombone, condor quill antara (Andean pan flute), djembe and assorted bowls, bells and rattles

·        **Ian Dogole** – udu, kalimbas, hang, doumbek, talking drum, bells and shakers

title: Will Marsh & Integration Ensemble
description:
Will Marsh is an accomplished global sitarist & guitarist who carries on the rich tradition of many genres with elegance, imagination and innovation. This performance features Will along with other master musicians to complete the ensemble, bringing rich melodies and extraordinnairy combinations of instruments that blend cultures and cross traditional boundaries.  Tickets are $30, $25 for OCA members. Get tickets online or at the door.  Get Tickets   The Ensemble The Integration is the creative expression of Will Marsh's \(sitar/guitar\) unique musical journey of many years devoted to both western music and hindustani classical music. He became initiated into the rich tradition of hindustani classical music as a sitarist under the legendary Ustad Aashish Khan. Will has since become a shining expression of this tradition with international performances in the realm of traditional sitar. As a kid, Will had an insatiable curiosity for exploring the world's music. He found profound depth in the traditional music of the world and nurtured that itch by studying World Music Performance at the California institute of the Arts, completing his World Music performance MFA in 2013. Since then, Will's musical journey has been rich and diverse. He believes passionately that music is essential to all of humanity. Hearing the rich tapestry of melody for sitar, guitar, cello, saxophone and tabla in the Integration Ensemble connects audiences to the richness of the world's traditions in a vibrant, fresh expression of humanity's greatest gift, music! The ensemble performs this dynamic music at venues and festivals internationally.  Learn more about Will at  willmarshmusic.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: Hands on a Hardbody
location: Spreckels Center for the Performing Arts
description:
In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95; Under 18 $31.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Mahler's Third
description:
Mahler's Third February 21, 22 & 23, 2026 Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor Gabrielle Beteag, mezzo-soprano Treble Voices of the SSU Symphonic Chorus, Jenny Bent, director Gustav Mahler: Symphony No. 3 in D minor Mahler's Third Symphony explores the human condition, nature, and the divine. With six movements, it reflects Mahler's philosophical quest to "embrace everything." Mezzo-soprano Gabrielle Beteag and the Treble Voices of the SSU Symphonic Chorus, directed by Jenny Bent, return to Weill Hall to perform what is regarded as one of the greatest symphonies of all time. Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are nonrefundable and subject to availability.

title: CBC Events and Producciones Vigil Presentan Tierra Cali de Humberto Plancarte
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Back to All Shows

CBC Events and Producciones Vigil Presentan

Tierra Cali de Humberto Plancarte

Saturday, February 21, 2026

8:00 pm

BUY TICKETS 

Humberto Plancarte, originario del Rancho Las Juntas de Poturo, municipio de Churumuco, Michoacán, inició su carrera musical en 1998 con el objetivo de dejar un legado duradero en el público. Dos años después, en el año 2000, fundó el grupo “Tierra Cali”. 

Humberto ha sido conocido por revitalizar la música grupera, fusionando elementos del estilo norteño, banda, ritmos tropicales, entre otros, para crear un sonido único que representa la cultura mexicana. En 2008 consolidó su éxito al colocar tres de sus álbumes en el Top 100 de ventas, según Soundscan y Billboard, logrando múltiples premios, incluyendo Discos de Platino y el reconocimiento como Mejor Grupo de Tierra Caliente. 

En esta nueva etapa Humberto Plancarte, busca brindar a sus fanáticos una nueva propuesta musical, mezclando las raíces del regional mexicano con arreglos musicales orquestados, baladas, cumbias y el icónico sabor de Tierra Caliente, apostando por sus letras honestas y románticas que veneran el amor. 

Humberto Plancarte, originally from Rancho Las Juntas de Poturo in the municipality of Churumuco, Michoacán, began his musical career in 1998 with the goal of leaving a lasting legacy with his audience. Two years later, in 2000, he founded the group Tierra Cali. 

Humberto became known for revitalizing música grupera, blending elements of norteño, banda, tropical rhythms, and more to create a unique sound that proudly represents Mexican culture. In 2008, he solidified his success by placing three of his albums in the Top 100 sales charts, according to SoundScan and Billboard, earning multiple awards, including “Discos de Platino” and the title of Best Tierra Caliente Group. 

Now entering a new chapter in his career, Humberto Plancarte offers fans a fresh musical proposal that fuses the roots of Regional Mexican music with orchestral arrangements, ballads, cumbias, and the iconic Tierra Caliente flavor—anchored in honest, romantic lyrics that celebrate love. 

 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Lake County Restaurant Week 2026
description:
Celebrate Lake County, California restaurants by experiencing delicious dishes and deals in 2026! Restaurant Week is a limited-time event where participating restaurants offer special menus designed to showcase their culinary strengths and attract new diners. These menus often feature multiple courses and highlight seasonal ingredients or signature dishes. Held in cities across the country, Restaurant Week typically takes place during slower seasons and can last anywhere from a few days to several weeks, giving people a chance to explore a variety of dining experiences and support local establishments.. With that in mind, the Lake County Chamber of Commerce and the Lake County Economic Development Corporation partnered with several local restauranteurs to create a Restaurant Week in Lake County.

Source: Press Democrat

title: 11th Annual Farmers' Convergence
location: University of California Hopland Research and Extension Center
description:
The School of Adaptive Agriculture invites you to the 11th Annual Farmers’ Convergence on February 21, 2026, at the UC Hopland Research & Extension Center in Hopland, CA. 

This beloved farmer-to-farmer gathering is entering an exciting new chapter. After a decade of grassroots success, the Farmers’ Convergence is expanding to UC Hopland REC, marking a significant evolution that bridges lived farming experience with deep ecological practices. This partnership represents a deeper commitment to regenerative land stewardship and our local food economy. 

The event will bring together farmers, gardeners, schools and food activists, from beginners to seasoned veterans, conventional to experimental, for innovative solutions, knowledge exchange, and forward-thinking strategies. Together, we’ll explore soil regeneration, biodiversity, systems thinking, and economic sustainability while renewing our collective inspiration and momentum. It will include events the day before, and after. 

Everyone belongs in this conversation. Tickets are limited, so don’t delay. We hope you will join us as we champion collaborative progress and expanded possibility. 

Learn more: www.schoolofadaptiveagriculture.org/convergence

Source: Press Democrat

title: Steeping Knowledge - Tea Demonstration
description:
Come to Sugarloaf for an interactive demonstration on tea lead by local culture bearer, TekTekh, a Native of Sonoma and Napa. We'll take a walk around Meadow and Hillside Trails, hearing about what she's learned from her elders while looking for cleavers, which TekTekh will harvest (permit-sanctioned) and process into a tea back at the picnic tables next to the White Barn.

Meet at the White Barn parking lot. Tickets are $20 for general admission, $10 for youth (12-17 year olds; all minors must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian), students, Sugarloaf members, Sugarloaf or RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Wear layers, appropriate footwear for muddy and/or slippery trails, bring a small mug/cup for tea tasting, at least a quart of water, sun protection, and if desired, a snack. Heavy rain cancels. Parking fees apply.

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Wildflowers are early this year, and I have already seen some Orchids. Join me in search of early wildflowers at Lake Sonoma. We'll hike through a magical madrone forest, take in beautiful expansive views of the Mayacamas Mountain range as well as the Dry Creek and Warm Springs arms of Lake Sonoma. We will visit some of the largest manzanita and madrone trees I've seen. Best for individuals and dogs with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Important Directions**
Little Flat Parking (A large gravel parking lot)
From Hwy 101 take Dry Creek Road west towards Lake Sonoma. Go up the hill and across the bridge over the lake. Pay Attention, it's the first right turn into "Little Flat" parking lot.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive. It's often farther than you think.

**Group Hike #333**
Dry Creek, No Name, North Slope and Bummer trails - a loop hike
Length - +/-5 miles/8 kilometers
Elevation change - +/-900 feet/274 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 some short steep rocky sections
Must be sure footed (confident and competent)!
Exposures - +/-30 % sun/70% shade - creek crossings, rocky, muddy, poison oak, ticks/insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters!
Dogs - Yes, must be healthy, well behaved and on a leash.
Facilities at trail head - None - Port O Potti about 1.5 miles in.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking -$7-day pass can be purchased on-site using a credit card through the Recreation.gov mobile app. Once on-site, follow the posted Scan & Pay instructions. You will need to download the free Recreation.gov mobile app prior to your arrival as some remote areas have limited or no cellular service. For more information about paying on-site, click here: [How Do I Use a Scan & Pay QR Code to Purchase an Activity Pass?](https://recreationonestoptest.servicenowservices.com/external?id=kb_article&sys_id=2011ea4a1b84bcd076c1dbdbe54bcb1d)
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water for your dog too, a hat, snack, layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**After Hike Gathering?**
Quail & Condor
Bakery and Café
44 Mill St Unit J
Healdsburg, CA 95448
[https://www.quailandcondor.com/](https://www.quailandcondor.com/)
(707) 473-8254
Outstanding new location with plenty of parking and a beautiful cafe. Behind the Parish Café at the roundabout.

**When We Meet**
Sunday February 22, 2026
9:00 am - 12:00 pm
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

title: Mushroom Foraging
description:
Wild mushroom season has arrived on the Sonoma Coast, where misty forests and coastal meadows nurture a dazzling diversity of fungi for curious foragers and culinary enthusiasts alike.

Join Ty the Fungi, a seasoned local forager with nearly 15 years of experience, and learn how to find, identify, and responsibly harvest wild mushrooms—from prized edibles to those best left untouched. Discover the principles of ethical foraging and deepen your connection to the landscape through this immersive, hands-on exploration.

Meet at The Lodge’s Fireside Lounge, and we’ll caravan together to the foraging site.

$160 per person, $100 \(ages 10-16\). Space is limited. This adventure is recommended for participants with moderate to advanced hiking experience.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Online: The Inheritance of Wholeness
description:
with Amana Brembry Johnson

There is a knowing that lives beneath thought, an ancient intelligence woven into the fabric of our being. The Buddha taught that everything needed for liberating the heart is already here, within this body. The path is not about becoming different, but remembering all that has been obscured by the habits of conditioning and forgetfulness.

By returning to the body as a living archive that has never stopped guiding us, we reconnect with the sacred inheritance of wholeness—a continuity passed down through the Buddhadharma and the unbroken line of ancestors whose memories flow within us. This daylong will include silent sitting meditation, Dharma reflections, breath awareness, and gentle interpersonal connections. During our time together we will reconnect with what is already ours, a sense of belonging, spacious presence, and the dignity of simply being alive. Open to both new and experienced practitioners.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:

Develop and improve your throwing skills while exploring a range of forms through multiple class projects in this all-level throwing class. The instructor guides you through the basic steps of throwing, shaping, and trimming of pottery on the wheel. This class is a great opportunity for students to hone basic techniques of throwing on the wheel and expand skills in all aspects of pottery. Surface decoration techniques will be explored. title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE  1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:  January 26 – February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 – 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery’s free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.  Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.  Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.  In Gray’s “Love Abstractly” an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color.  Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her “Bowl of Strawberries,”  fruit rendered so realistically, one’s mouth waters.  Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays – tulips and scarlet buglers.  Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta’s jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in “Raven Heart” and Rapp’s little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in “Foxy Flowers.”  Shore’s “Showering You with Gifts” catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.  “As we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine’s Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,” noted Gray.   

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney’s Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.  And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.  In “Hold Me Tight” one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine’s Day.  Another couple joyfully whoops it up in “Bust a Move.” Bring on the music – these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am – 6 pm.    **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Arts Guild of Sonoma Presents: For the Love of Art
description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Learn more at  artsguildofsonoma.org .

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Open Chapel (2nd & 4th Sundays)
description:
Visit St. Peter's Chapel, home to the largest collection of Tiffany stained-glass windows in a single location. The chapel is open to the public on the 2nd and 4th Sundays of each month for self-guided visits and quiet reflection. Volunteers are on-site to share history, answer questions, and help you experience the beauty and heritage of Mare Island's most beloved landmark.

location: St Peter's Chapel: Open for Viewing
description:
Visit Mare Island's historic chapel during our Open Chapel days and experience its serene beauty and rich history at your own pace. Step inside to admire the famous Tiffany stained glass windows and take in the intricate details of this iconic site. Docents will be on hand to answer any questions and share insights about the chapel's history and unique features. Note: This is not a guided tour. Dates are subject to change due to private events. Come and enjoy a peaceful, self-guided visit to one of Mare Island's most treasured landmarks. Suggested Contribution: $5 per person Event website

title: Cool Team Leader Half-Day Training
description:
Cool Petaluma is about to launch a new cohort of Cool Team Leaders! 

In the current day, some of our strongest resources are our communities and neighbors. What better way to kick off 2026 than by building bonds with the people around you?

The Cool Teams program brings people together to take care of each other while taking care of the planet. Neighborhood-based Cool Teams are the most popular option, but the program has expanded to include friend groups, faith-based groups, and coworkers–whoever forms your team.

Our Team Leader Training is where dedicated community members can step up and learn how to become Team Leaders. This training will show you how to gather neighbors or friends and kickstart community climate action! Including information on climate change, guides on how to host a cool event, and how to create real change, this training will give you everything you need to know so you can become a Team Leader in your own community.

Remember to bring a water bottle and a snack for the day!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Charm School: Resin Charm-Making Workshop
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 22, 2026 1:00 PM – 4:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Drawing & Painting, Fiber Arts

Age\(s\)

16\+

$40 – Registration Cost $10 – Materials Fee $50 – Total Registration CostCreate personalized resin charms filled with tiny treasures and meaningful mementos. All supplies provided. Make 3-5 unique mini collage keepsakes in three hours.

What you’ll do

Resin charms are little metal frames you can fill with tiny gems, bits of paper ephemera, beads… anything itty bitty! I’ll provide all the tools, supplies, and inspiration needed to make as many charms as you like during a three-hour event! Crafters can also bring meaningful little bits and bobs such as an earring that has lost its mate, a photo of a loved one, petals or tiny flowers, a snippet of a ticket stub, yarn from a beloved, or a stamp from a special letter. Students will graduate Charm School with 3-5 unique mini collage keepsakes!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Knitting Basics
description:
Ready to get cozy with some yarn? Join Becca Schillinger for a chill intro to knitting where you'll learn the basics and make a small project to take home!

Never picked up needles before? No worries! Becca will walk you through everything from casting on \(aka getting started\) to nailing the knit stitch. You'll work on a small project using the garter stitch, then learn how to cast off when you're done. She'll also demo some handy tricks like increases, decreases, and how to read patterns without your brain melting.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sugarloaf New Volunteer Orientation
description:
When you join Sugarloaf's 200+ member volunteer community, you gain access to a whole new appreciation for your local State Park. Make meaningful connections with fellow volunteers, learn new skills, enjoy time outdoors in a beautiful setting, and play an integral role in keeping Sugarloaf Ridge State Park open and accessible for everyone.

 Join us at our next volunteer orientation to learn what it takes to steward a state park! We'll cover the history of Sugarloaf, how Sonoma Ecology Center operates the park, and the various volunteer opportunities available. Beyond the mandatory initial orientation, trainings and docent enrichment activities will take place periodically, depending on your interests and role. The orientation takes place at the Robert Ferguson Observatory classroom, located at Sugarloaf Ridge State Park. Bring: a notepad, pen, reusable drink container for warm beverages, and warm layers.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Free Concerts on the Corner Presents: The Kyle Athayde Dance Party
location: Christ Presbyterian Church in Terra Linda
description:
Kyle Athayde Dance Party presents a one-of-a-kind children’s jazz concert that offers something for everyone. Built around imaginative, jazz-infused arrangements of beloved children’s songs like “If You’re Happy and You Know It,” “The Wheels on the Bus,” and “Five Speckled Frogs,” the show is a celebration of music that is fun and accessible for all audiences. Through thoughtful programming, Kyle strikes a rare balance—creating music that delights young audiences, educates newcomers to jazz, and satisfies even the most seasoned listener. Each tune turns familiar melodies into vibrant, jazz experiences that introduce kids to rhythm, improvisation, and musical storytelling. Whether you’re a toddler, a jazz-curious parent, or a lifelong music lover, this is a show where everyone walks away with joy, discovery, and a deeper appreciation for jazz.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

February 13th, 14th, 15th, 19th, 20th, 21st, 22nd, 27th, 28th, March 1st. 

Friday and Saturday Shows: 7:30 PM

Sunday Matinee: 2:00 PM

\*Value Thursday: 7:30 PM

Adults: $25

Student w/ID: $10

Special Value Thursday Performance:  Pay What You Can

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Northern Still at Passaggio Wines
description:
Dawn Angelosante (piano), Tony Gibson (guitar) and Michael Fecskes (cello) are a trio of Sonoma County-based musicians known around the North Bay for their Folk-pop, Americana-infused acoustic sound. Their intimate and heartfelt songs captivate audiences around Northern California with haunting melodies and lush harmonies. They return to Passaggio Wines in Glen Ellen, CA, now with the new moniker, ***The Northern Still*** on Sunday, February 22nd from 2-4pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Train Talk
description:
Railroad historian and former Northwestern Pacific and Southern Pacific officer Fred Codoni will discuss the history of the railroad in Sonoma County, from the early horse-drawn streetcars – ‘horse car lines’ – to the formation of the Petaluma & Santa Rosa Railroad \(P&SR\) that went through Sebastopol. The current West County Museum in downtown Sebastopol was the terminal.  Fred Codoni’s collection of over 14,000 railroad images across this history represents a powerful and unique set of artifacts that bring to life an amazing century of change across transportation, manufacturing, and rural life. He has worked for the railroad industry since 1956, and is the last surviving member of the Northwest Pacific Railroad. As a member of the Western Railway Museum, Fred often ran P&SR passenger car No. 63 at the Western Railway museum at Rio Vista junction, the only remaining operating car from that railroad.

This talk is a project from the Western Sonoma County Historical Society. It will be preceded by a short update by the society board about what is happening at the Historical Society.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

An entrancing afternoon with two esteemed poets, **Donna Emerson and Gerald Fleming**, with selected readings from their recent collections, respectively, *Daphne Lifts Up* and *The Bastard & The Bishop.* musical interludes on various stringed instruments from award-winning composer and musician, **Jared Emerson-Johnson**. description:
In this quirky, high-stakes musical based on real events, ten Texans compete to keep one hand on a brand-new truck the longest—and the last one standing wins it. But this is more than just a contest; it’s a hilarious, heartfelt look at resilience, community and what drives us. This soulful, country-rock musical is filled with a moving score and unforgettable characters. Hands on a Hardbody is a ride you’ll want to take!

title: Poetry, Music and Art! A Trifecta!
description:
Join us for an entrancing afternoon with two esteemed poets, Donna Emerson and Gerald Fleming, with selected readings from their recent poetry collections, respectively, Daphne Lifts Up and The Bastard & The Bishop. Our audience will be swept away by musical interludes on various stringed instruments from award-winning composer and musician, Jared Emerson-Johnson. Local watercolor artist and college instructor, Barbara Marlin, creator of the Daphne Lifts Up book cover will display the original artwork and selected prints of other work at the event. Following the readings and music, a Q&A will follow, with book sales and signing in the lobby. Refreshments will be available for sale. This is free event, all donations always gratefully accepted.    Donna Emerson divides her time between Petaluma, California, and her family homestead near Ithaca, New York. Retired from teaching at Santa Rosa Jr. College and her clinical social work practice, her recent poetry publications include La Pressa, The Paterson Literary Review, and Weber: The Contemporary West. Her chapbooks: This Water, 2007, Body Rhymes, 2009, Wild Mercy, 2011, and Following Hay, 2013. Her poetry books are The Place of Our Meeting \(Finishing Line Press, 2018\) and Beside the Well \(Cherry Grove Collections. 2019\). And now, Daphne Lifts Up \(Finishing Line Press, 2025\). Donna has received two nominations for the Pushcart Prize, one for "Best of the Net," two nominations for the California Book Award \(Body Rhymes, 2009, The Place of Our Meeting, 2018\), five awards from the annual Allen Ginsberg Contests, and numerous regional awards for her poetry, creative non-fiction, and prose. Many of her poems appear in journals or anthologies with her black and white or color photography. Anais Nin used Donna's portraits of Anais in her late diaries and press coverage in the New York Times.  Donna has taught poetry to elementary school children and made it part of her community college classrooms \(1990-2015\). She worked as a volunteer with Alzheimer's patients at a residential facility to help them create individual and group poems and served as Board member and Events Chair for the Marin Poetry Center \(2012-2014\). Donna's latest book, "Daphne Lifts Up" includes poems about nature around us, nature within us, and relationships with many different people, from family to counseling clients, to students, colleagues at work, animals, birds, and strangers. It addresses birth, illness, death, and resiliency in all these verses.    Gerald Fleming is the author of the poetry collections The Bastard and the Bishop \(Hanging Loose Press, 2021\), One \(Hanging Loose, 2016\), The Choreographer \(Sixteen Rivers Press, 2013\), Night of Pure Breathing \(Hanging Loose, 2011\), and Swimmer Climbing onto Shore \(Sixteen Rivers, 2005\). His work has appeared in many magazines over the decades, including New Letters, Michigan Quarterly Review, Hanging Loose, Carolina Quarterly, New World Writing, Volt, Paris Lit Up, and Versal.  Fleming edited the print magazines Barnabe Mountain Review and Forward to Velma, the vitreous magazine One \(More\) Glass, and The Collected Poetry & Prose of Lawrence Fixel \(Sixteen Rivers, 2021\). He has written numerous books for teachers, including Rain, Steam, and Speed \(Jossey-Bass/Wiley, 2005\), and lives most of the year near San Francisco, part of the year in Paris. Fleming, a master of the prose poem, is never satisfied to sing the same song, and this adventuresome spirit pays dividends in these new prose poems. Constantly surprising and inventive,  The Bastard and the Bishop offers stories within stories that effortlessly merge the personal and the archetypal, breathing new life into a genre that has increasingly, and often sadly, become predictable.     Jared Emerson-Johnson is a video game music composer, sound designer, voice director and voice actor. He is the Music Supervisor and lead composer at Bay Area Sound, an audio production company specializing in sound design, music a

title: Free Concerts on the Corner Presents: The Kyle Athayde Dance Party
description:
Kyle Athayde Dance Party presents a one-of-a-kind children’s jazz concert that offers something for everyone. Built around imaginative, jazz-infused arrangements of beloved children’s songs like “If You’re Happy and You Know It,” “The Wheels on the Bus,” and “Five Speckled Frogs,” the show is a celebration of music that is fun and accessible for all audiences. Through thoughtful programming, Kyle strikes a rare balance—creating music that delights young audiences, educates newcomers to jazz, and satisfies even the most seasoned listener. Each tune turns familiar melodies into vibrant, jazz experiences that introduce kids to rhythm, improvisation, and musical storytelling. Whether you’re a toddler, a jazz-curious parent, or a lifelong music lover, this is a show where everyone walks away with joy, discovery, and a deeper appreciation for jazz.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

title: Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo
description:
Verismo Opera presents Dido and Aeneas by Purcell together with Pagliacci by Leoncavallo

Free Admission. Become a member to support our new free admission policy.  Membership will be good for a year from purchase and will entitle members to early seating \(before non-members\) for performances.

 Stage Directors: Kristin Lund and Jennifer Rineman 

Conductors: Jonathan Khuner and Paul Schrage

Chamber Orchestra with English Supertitles 

In association with Mira Theatre Guild

For company information and to purchase memberships visit www.verismoopera.org

Dido and Aeneas is a monumental English Baroque opera masterpiece.  The story is based on Virgil’s The Aeneid and tells the tale of love and tragedy between Dido, Queen of Carthage, and the Trojan hero Aeneas.  This beloved gem includes stunning choruses, duos, trios and the iconic aria "Dido’s Lament".  In contrast to Dido and Aeneas’ measured passions, Pagliacci is full of uncontrollable passion, jealousy, tragedy, murder, and betrayal.  Laugh and weep with Canio as he sings "Vesti la giubba" \(the clown who cries behind his makeup\).

Mira Theatre Guild, 51 Daniels Avenue, Vallejo, CA 94590

- February 28, 2026 \(Saturday 7:00pm\)

title: Benise
description:
Emmy Award Winning Spanish Guitar and Dance Spectacular.

It’s one hot night as Benise celebrates 25 years of fiery Spanish guitar and dance. 

Benise \(pronounced Buh-nes-say\) shattered the mold of Spanish guitar by combining world music and dance – the only show of its kind! 

2025 marks the year that Benise, “The Prince of Spanish Guitar,” launches his 25th Anniversary Tour and 8th PBS Special “25 Years of Passion!” 

 Armed with his Spanish guitar and a stage full of musicians and elaborately choreographed dancers, Benise takes the audience on a musical journey through Spanish Flamenco, Cuban Salsa, Brazilian Samba, Parisian Waltz, exotic drumming, and more! 

The 25th Anniversary tour establishes Benise’s Emmy Award winning show as one of the longest running Latin-themed theatrical productions touring the world.

For Benise, music has always been a journey. From his humble beginnings as a street performer, to being featured on the \#1 rated show in the USA – Dancing With The Stars. Guitarist and creative force behind the event, Benise, comments “I wanted to push the boundaries of Nuevo Flamenco/Spanish guitar while combining the elements of dance and theater. This show is a celebration of all the shows we’ve done over the last 25 years.” 

The Emmy Award-winning composer along with an international cast of musicians and dancers will entertain audiences with a two-hour show that “is an escape from all of their problems,” Benise says. Beyond the new material, Benise says “the live show will incorporate some fan favorites from my street performing days and rock classics like Led Zeppelin’s Kashmir and AC/DC’s Thunderstruck.” In addition, Benise adds his signature touch to classics such as “Ave Maria, “Moonlight Sonata,” and Vivaldi’s “Summer” from The Four Seasons.

Benise adds, “This is a great show for the whole family; I really think we have something for everyone. I hope people will be inspired by our story, by the music, by the production--and have the passion to follow their own dreams.” 

The Theatrical World Music and Dance spectacle that has been called “The Latin Riverdance” 

‘The Prince of Spanish Guitar’  - Dancing With The Stars

‘Bennissimo!’ - Chicago News

‘Extreme Flamenco Fusion’ - Screen India

Source: North Bay Bohemian

With six movements, it reflects Mahler's philosophical quest to "embrace everything." Mezzo-soprano Gabrielle Beteag and the Treble Voices of the SSU Symphonic Chorus, directed by Jenny Bent, return to Weill Hall to perform what is regarded as one of the greatest symphonies of all time. title: Overeaters Anonymous (OA) Newcomer Meeting in Santa Rosa
description:
**Is Food a Problem for You? You Are Not Alone.**

Overeaters Anonymous (OA) is a fellowship of people who support each other in recovering from compulsive eating and food behaviors. If you feel you have a problem with food, OA welcomes you—no matter what your background, beliefs, or eating habits.

We hold an in-person newcomer meeting on **Sundays from 4:00 – 5:00 PM** **at Christ Church United Methodist, 1717 Yulupa Ave., Room #4, Santa Rosa**. Contact: Abigail (707) 293-5888. You may view all North Bay OA in-person and online meetings at https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html .

In OA, members experience **spiritual, emotional, and physical recovery** by practicing the **Twelve Steps** and living by their spiritual principles—one day at a time.

OA is **not** a diet club or calorie-counting program.

Members have different plans of eating.

OA does **not** endorse any specific food plan.

If food is causing problems in your life, you don’t have to struggle alone. Recovery is possible, and help is available.

**Visit:** https://www.northbayoa.org/

**Find a meeting:** https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Stay With Us - On The House
description:
Now through February 22, The Lodge at Dawn Ranch is inviting guests to linger longer and make a staycation out of dinner, offering complimentary accommodations at the 22-acre creative retreat Dawn Ranch.

The 1-night hotel stay is gifted to those who reserve the ‘All That’ tasting menu for two, alongside the ‘The Timeless Wine Pairing,’ carefully crafted by award-winning Advanced Sommelier Genaro Gallo. The 12-course journey takes guests through a series of small bites, composed dishes and mains, a pre-dessert, and a final dessert - each paired with a glass of wine representing a different decade, from the 1970s to today. A few signature dishes featured this season include:

A Thousand-Layer Potato and Caviar

Three Corn Polenta with Black Truffle and Egg Yolk

Sea Urchin Bucatini; and Dates with Tonka Bean Ice Cream and Orange Bourbon Glaze

Following dinner, diners will be treated to a stay in one of Dawn Ranch’s 86 cottages and cabins. Reservations for the “Stay With Us – On The House” promotion can be made through OpenTable for Sunday or Monday evenings, for bookings through February 22.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 50 mins including intermission

title: Beneath the Canopy at Jack London State Historic Park
description:
Explore the fascinating world of mosses and lichens, along with other small wonders of the forest on a guided walk at Jack London State Historic Park.  Learn to notice their unique forms, textures, and colors, and gain insight into how these often overlooked organisms interact with their environment. Whether you are a naturalist or simply curious about the details beneath your feet and along the trail, this event offers something for everyone. Slow down, look closely, and deepen your appreciation for the small but essential elements that help shape and support the park’s ecosystems.  This hike will be about 1.2 miles roundtrip on uneven terrain. Sturdy walking shoes and weather appropriate layers are recommended.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sonoma County Restaurant Week
description:
Come out and Restaurant Week 2026 from February 23 - March 1! This is your chance support the vibrant and diverse culinary scene of Sonoma County and taste the unique flavors that our local restaurants have to offer. By dining out during the week, you'll be supporting small businesses and helping to sustain our local economy.

There are no tickets or passes required. Simply dine out at as many participating restaurants as you would like during Sonoma County Restaurant Week. Each restaurant will have at least one prix fixe menu to choose from.

This year, Restaurant Week is celebrating eateries that feature entrées sourced from 100% Sonoma County sourced ingredients and/or pour Sonoma County wines. Dining farm-to-table has never been so easy!

So gather your friends, family, and foodie companions, and make a reservation at one of our participating restaurants today. Your taste buds will thank you, and you’ll be supporting our local community at the same time. **Let’s make this Restaurant Week one to remember!**

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?* art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?* is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit’s core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU’s Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Handbuilding 101
description:
Mondays, January 26 – March 23, 2026 9:30 AM – 12:30 PM Exceptions: February 16, Presidents Day

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

$265 – Registration Cost $30 – Materials Fee $295 – Total Registration Cost

Learn the fundamentals of creating handbuilt, functional objects with clay in this 8 week course. Thoughtfully explore the tried and true techniques of ceramic work!

What you’ll do

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in hand building in this 8 week course. Designed for all levels \(beginners and those more experienced\) Deborah thoughtfully explores the tried and true techniques of ceramic work with her students through structured assignments, allowing her students to develop their own creative voice in the process. This course will emphasize building functional forms with creative surface design in mind; focusing on forms with large areas to explore texture, painterly surface techniques, and much more. Students will receive instruction in hand building, and basic glazing techniques. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ½ off during the duration of their class. Sign ups for membership will be included in your pre class email 

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: The Chromatic Voice: Oil Painting Journey
description:
Mondays, January 5 – MAdvance your oil painting skills in a supportive, solvent-free studio while exploring color,arch 9, 2026 9:30 AM – 12:30 PM No class January 19 and February 16

Experience Level

Intermediate and Advanced

Event Category: Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$350 – Registration Cost $35 – Optional Materials Packet

Advance your oil painting skills in a supportive, solvent-free studio while exploring color,light, and challenging subjects to deepen technique and expression.

What you’ll do

This 8-week course is designed for artists ready to deepen their technical skills and personal expression in a calm, supportive, and solvent-free studio. It serves as the natural continuation of the Fall 2025 course “Palette & Possibility,” and is also open to experienced oil painters who wish to advance their practice within a framework focused on cognitive stimulation and emotional well-being. We will move beyond simple objects to tackle subjects that introduce new cognitive challenges, such as atmosphere, reflective surfaces, and simplified portrait elements. Emphasis remains on process over product, nurturing focus, spatial reasoning, and emotional insight. Through an explorative journey into composition, light, and “The Chromatic Voice”—your unique use of color— students will strengthen their artistic voices while continuing to reap the rewards of enhanced mental agility and profound emotional well-being.

Optional Materials Packet & Supply List

$35 includes all necessary paints, mediums, brushes, surfaces \(canvas panels\), and cleaning supplies for the 8 weeks. Students who wish to bring their own materials should view the supply list. You can view the full supply list here.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Developing Your Drawing Eye
description:
Mondays, January 5 – February 23, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM No class January 19 & February 16.

Experience Level

Beginning

Event Category: Drawing & Painting

$250 – Registration Fee $10 – Materials Fee $260 – Total Registration Fee

Learn to draw from observation in this beginner-friendly six-week class that teaches you to see like an artist and build foundational skills at your own pace.

What you’ll do

Whether you are an abject beginner, haven’t picked up a pencil since high school, or you’re a creative who has always felt intimidated by observational drawing, this six-week class is offered with you in mind. We’ll take the mystery – and the pressure – out of drawing from observation. You’ll learn how to really see like an artist, practice simple techniques step by step, and build skills at your own pace. No talent required, and perfection is off the table. Studying observational drawing offers a foundational skill set that you will carry into every medium you might wish to explore. Discover the joy of drawing and build practical skills to expand your creative expression! All materials are provided.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 116

Shut Up & Write!® Wine Country
**Coworking for writers in Petaluma!**

This session is about getting some writing done, whether you're working on a novel, memoir, short story, dissertation, job application, blog, poetry, a song or just want to journal.

10:30 - 10:45am: Introduce yourself and what you're working on today
10:45 - 11:45am: Write in silence for 1 hour
11:45am - 12pm: Check in with one another and exchange how it went

* Aqus has WiFi for guests

* Please thank our hosts by purchasing something
* If music or ambient noise are distracting, please bring ear plugs or headphones
* There are a few outlets available if you need to charge your device

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
**WHAT:** Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

**DATE:**            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

**TIME:** 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

**WHERE:**       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

**LINK:**             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

**DETAILS:**

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         **Offered Daily:** 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         **Experience length:** 2 hours

·         **Wines:** Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         **Cost:** $150 per Person

·         **Exclusive Member Price:** $95 per Member

**ADMISSION:** Members $95 | Non-members $150

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: Arts Guild of Sonoma Presents: For the Love of Art
description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Learn more at  artsguildofsonoma.org .

description:

Guests will enjoy a curated flight featuring elegant sparkling wine alongside expressive estate selections, perfect for savoring together. The experience invites you to slow down, toast to February, and indulge in the beauty of wine country.

Up to 4 guests, including non-tasters

Please allow 60-90 minutes for this experience

description:

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
WHAT: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

DATE:            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

TIME: 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

WHERE:       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

LINK:             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

DETAILS:

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         Offered Daily: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         Experience length: 2 hours

·         Wines: Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         Cost: $150 per Person

·         Exclusive Member Price: $95 per Member

ADMISSION: Members $95 | Non-members $150

Source: Press Democrat

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

description:
Sit & Stitch is offered the 2nd & 4th Mondays of the month from 3:30 to 5:30 pm. You can drop in for any amount of time. You may continue needle felting as we now have all of the supplies. We will also have tea and cookies, so bring your favorite covered drink container. Sit and Stitch is for people to come and work on any fiber arts activity that they have while visiting with others. Most people will bring their own projects, but we always have hooks, needles, and yarn and sometimes we will offer a project with instructions that people may choose to make. Let us know what you would like to learn this year. We share ideas, skills, and encouragement with each other. This winter we will be adding sewing, weaving, and decorative mending to our regular projects of knitting and crocheting. Starting in January, we will also have a sewing machine available for use. Children can come if they are accompanied one to one with an adult.

title: Tap for Kids: Ages 6-10
description:
Mondays, January 26 – March 16, 2026 4:00 PM – 4:45 PM No class Monday, February 16

Recital Date

Saturday, March 21, 2026 Time TBA

Beginning and Intermediate
