title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we’re expanding the exhibit to include bags—think totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It’s a joy to see your art find a new home—and to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 15, 2026 1:00 PM – 4:00 PM

Location

Room 201, Fiber Arts Studio

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Programming, Sustainability

Age\(s\)

All Ages are welcome to attend Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult

$25 – One Bag or Doll Entry $40 – Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 – 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we’ll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we’re expanding the exhibit to include bags—think totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It’s a joy to see your art find a new home—and to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Encaustic + Mixed Media Open Studio
description:
Join us at Encaustic Open Studio, a monthly workshop designed for you to refine your encaustic painting skills under the guidance of knowledgeable instructor Susan Heeringa Piper. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced artist, this is the perfect opportunity to immerse yourself in the captivating world of encaustic art.

Encaustic painting is an ancient technique that involves using molten beeswax and pigments to create stunning, textured masterpieces. This unique medium allows for endless possibilities, as it can be layered, carved, scraped, and fused to create mesmerizing effects and depth. From ethereal landscapes to abstract creations, encaustic painting offers a truly immersive and tactile experience. 

Bring your own substrate or project to work on, or start something new!

title: Encaustic + Mixed Media Open Studio
description:
Join us at Encaustic Open Studio, a monthly workshop designed for you to refine your encaustic painting skills under the guidance of knowledgeable instructor Susan Heeringa Piper. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced artist, this is the perfect opportunity to immerse yourself in the captivating world of encaustic art.

Encaustic painting is an ancient technique that involves using molten beeswax and pigments to create stunning, textured masterpieces. This unique medium allows for endless possibilities, as it can be layered, carved, scraped, and fused to create mesmerizing effects and depth. From ethereal landscapes to abstract creations, encaustic painting offers a truly immersive and tactile experience. 

Bring your own substrate or project to work on, or start something new!

title: Oil Painting Atelier: Guided Growth & Project Realization
description:
Thursdays, January 8 – February 26, 2026 5:00 PM – 8:00 PM

Experience Level

Intermediate and Advanced

Event Category: Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$350 – Registration Cost

A mentored studio for long-term oil painting projects with personalized guidance, weekly reviews, and support tailored to each artist’s level and goals.

What you’ll do

This continuous Atelier studio offers sustained, personalized mentorship for students working on long-term oil painting projects. It is structured to serve artists at various stages of development, from those applying foundational knowledge to advanced students exploring profound expressive concepts.

Phase 1: Project Proposal & Private Consultation: All students submit a project proposal. You will meet individually and privately with the instructor to define the scope, set challenging yet achievable goals based on your current skill level, and create a comprehensive roadmap for the duration of the course. This ensures a productive and focused experience, regardless of whether you are a recent beginner or an advanced painter.

Phase 2: Weekly Problem-Solving Studio: You work independently on your project, benefiting from the structure of a studio environment. The instructor conducts weekly, dedicated review time, providing customized guidance. This support scales precisely to your needs, ensuring you receive the appropriate technical advice to overcome obstacles specific to your project and your level of experience.

Integration with The Chromatic Voice \(taught on Monday mornings\): This course is the essential practical partner, ensuring that both foundational knowledge and advanced conceptual exploration are successfully translated into realized, high-quality paintings. Prerequisite: Students must have completed at least one introductory course in oil painting or demonstrate equivalent foundational knowledge \(e.g., knowledge of basic setup, brush cleaning, and layering principles\).

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 208

title: When Whales Speak - Presentation by Firuze Gokce
description:
Join the Laguna de Santa Rosa Foundation in welcoming artist and marine conservation advocate Firuze Gokce for an inspiring talk that blends art, science, and storytelling. In this presentation, Firuze shares her creative process of transforming whale songs, spectrograms, and real marine research into vibrant visual art. Through the true stories of individual whales and the scientific discoveries behind her pieces, she explores how storytelling can spark emotional connection and drive conservation action. This talk invites audiences to listen more deeply to the ocean, understand the lives of the whales who inhabit it, and discover the power of art as a voice for the natural world.

Firuze Gokce reached a significant milestone with the debut of her first solo art exhibition on May 23rd, showcasing her "Whale Sounds on a Canvas" collection. This exhibition featured her prints and immersive videos that blended visual art with the auditory experience of whale songs, offering a multi-sensory exploration of marine life. Firuze’s innovative approach incorporates actual whale sound recordings into her artwork. Additionally, her piece "Brave Little Hunter" was requested by Bay Cetology on Vancouver Island, highlighting her ability to convey the emotional depth of the natural world. Firuze was also accepted into the prestigious Sonoma County Art Trails Program in October 2024, further solidifying her place in the art community. Her artwork “Diving into the Depths of the Ocean” received an “Honorary Mention Award” from the Marine Society of Artists.

Guests are welcome to arrive early and enjoy Firuze Gokce’s art exhibit, Whale Sounds on a Canvas II, currently on view at the Laguna Environmental Center from January 10 – April 24, 2026.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, rosé, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Writers Forum
description:
**Debra Koehler** will share her writing journey, from believing she couldn't possibly be imaginative enough to write fiction, to producing a four-book fantasy series, the first of which she self-published August, 2025.

She will share tips on how to keep going with your writing project even when you get so fed up you want to throw it away. Which she did. Multiple times. Only to pull it out of the recycling bin, smooth out the pages, and keep going. Debra will also cover how using intuition to trust her story, as well as her writing process, helped her move beyond the setbacks and blocks that can be part of any writer's journey.

title: Sip, Savor, Serve fundraiser Feb. 26 in Healdsburg
description:
An event to raise funds for refurbishing the parish-hall kitchen at St. Paul's Episcopal Church takes place on Thursday, Feb. 26, in Healdsburg. "Sip, Savor, Serve" begins at 6 p.m. at the Paul Mahder Gallery, 222 Healdsburg Ave., and will feature wine, hors d'oeuvres and a silent auction with many tantalizing prizes, among them trips to lovely resorts, tickets to a San Francisco Giants baseball game with an overnight stay in that city, restaurant gift certificates, merchandise from high-end women's clothing stores, hair salon gift certificates, wine experiences and much more.

St. Paul's is a leader in serving Healdsburg residents who need food, personal care items, a place to take a hot shower, or assistance with transportation and clothing. The church's Shower Ministry is open three days per week and in 2025 provided 1,164 showers. Every Tuesday the church serves a hot soup-and-bread luncheon. Food is available the other two days the Shower Ministry is open each week. And the parish hall at 209 Matheson St. is the site of Healdsburg's weekly Sunday dinner. Produced by a cooperative of seven of Healdsburg's churches, the Sunday meal traditionally served about 40 people weekly but in recent months has grown to serving 80 or more.

The cost of producing the fundraiser has been covered by sponsors. All money raised from ticket sales and the silent auction will be used for upgrading the parish hall facilities. Tickets are $125 each and are available through Eventbrite; go to www.eventbrite.com and search "Sip Savor Serve" for Feb. 26.

title: Samba no Pé - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro! Samba no Pé \(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no Pé.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout—all while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM – 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: OLIVER JAMES & MYCHAL THREETS
description:
PETALUMA -- Copperfield's Books and Read On Sonoma are honored to welcome literacy advocate and motivational speaker Oliver James for the launch of his powerful new memoir - Unread: A Memoir of Learning \(and Loving\) to Read on TikTok! Oliver will be joined in conversation by beloved friend and local librarian, Mychal Threets. Join us for an unforgettable evening of literary insight followed by an audience Q&A and book signing with photo opportunities. All event proceeds will be donated to local non-profit and vital literacy initiative,  Read On Sonoma . This is a free event, registration required due to limited seating. Honest and thought-provoking, Unread is an inspiring, hopeful memoir of growth and change - Booklist As a result of childhood learning disabilities and educational neglect, Oliver James graduated from high school and became one of approximately 45 million functionally illiterate Americans. However, at age 32, with big dreams and few tools to actualize them, he dedicated himself to learning the key skill that had evaded him his entire life: reading. Oliver has become a TikTok/BookTok sensation for the way he's candidly documented his decision to learn to read as an adult, and his struggles and triumphs along the way. Here, he tells the full story behind his journey for the first time through the 21 key books that shaped and informed his experience. His story reveals the ways in which reading can teach each of us how to be better, more empathetic people. In just 365 days, Oliver went from barely being able to read a restaurant menu to closing in on his goal of finishing 100 books in a year. Unread is a moving reminder to all of us that words and stories have power, and that, no matter our past, it's never too late to grow. Author: Oliver James is a California-based personal trainer, motivational speaker, literacy activist, and influencer. He has been featured in or on Today, NPR, Jennifer Hudson Show, Los Angeles Times, Newsweek, Rachael Ray, and ABC News, among many others. Additionally, he is the recent recipient of the 2023 Barbara Bush National Literacy Award. He lives in Costa Mesa, California. Mychal Threets is a librarian, literary ambassador, and the library's number one fan \(according to himself, admittedly\). He was raised in his local library as a home-school kid and grew up in Fairfield, CA, right between Sacramento and San Francisco. Online, he shares videos of affirmations to assure people that their mental health always matters, and he encourages everyone to know they belong at the library. A former PBS kid himself, Mychal is proud to serve as PBS resident librarian.  I'm So Happy You're Here \(coming 2/3/26\) is his first book. His cats, Machine Gun Kitty and Kissin' Kat Barlow, did not help at all, but he still appreciates them. Read On Sonoma a dedicated group of professionals, educators and volunteers promoting literacy within our elementary schools. Donate directly, meet the Executive team, and learn more about the tremendous work that they do by joining us that evening. For more information, please visit their  website . Praise: "Unread feels like both story and concordance, a good read and a great resource for others who are on their way up the mountain of literacy. But mostly, this book is a testament to human will. It's a reminder that in order to enunciate resilience, one must learn the phonetics of desire, survival, and freedom. Oliver James is a marvel." -Jason Reynolds, New York Times bestselling author of the Track series "An inspiring and deeply human story about resilience, courage, and the transformative power of literacy. . . . Oliver's honest and public journey, shared with millions online, has shone a much-needed light on America's literacy crisis. . . . He not only tells his personal story but reminds us that it's never too late to learn, to dream, and to rewrite your own story." -Andrew Roberts, President, Barbara Bush Foundation for Family Literacy "Oliver James is a big dreamer whose life was transformed through books-and he made the brave, bold choice to dive headfirst into wherever this would take him. . . . He's the living, breathing, thriving example of what reading can do for a person. Though Oliver found the light at the end of the tunnel, there are quite likely millions of children who are headed down the dark road he went through-but if their parents, educators, and leaders would read this memoir . . . there is still a chance to turn it all around for them, too. This raw, unfiltered deep-dive into the mind's eye of a man who has been through it all should be a must-read for educators of our at-risk youth." -I. C. Robledo, author of 365 Quotes to Live Your Life By "Unread isn't just inspiration-it's motivation for each of us to become the hero of our own story. This book is a testament both to the power of reading and to the strength within all of us to overcome our greatest obstacles. Oliver James is a role model for us all." -Kelley Coleman, author of Everything No One Tells You About Parenting a Disabled Child "A thoughtful and inspiring story about vulnerability and courage. Poignant proof that reading helps to change lives." -Kirkus

title: Forró Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of Forró! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forró is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forró.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‘Caminhada’ \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forró—from the mellow ‘Xote’ to the faster, more energetic ‘Pé-de-Serra.’

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Date & Time: Thursdays @7:30PM – 8:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

title: Ambrosia
description:
The year is 1970, and four young musicians from the South Bay of Los Angeles, come together to create a new invigorating style of music exploring the possibilities of progressive, classical and world influences; rooted with the soul of the blues and R&B.

 

Originally labeled as America’s answer to progressive English acts such as “Yes” and “King Crimson”, the group quickly proved that and much more, garnering an impressive 5 Grammy Nominations, 5 Hit Singles, heavy airplay, and the admiration and respect of the musical community.  All this was in addition to sold out concerts around the world; attracting  collaborations with such cultural icons as Leonard Bernstein, Kurt Vonnegut Jr., and Alan Parsons.

 

Today, the band is more alive and compelling than ever with founding members Joe Puerta on bass & lead vocals, Burleigh Drummond on drums, and Christopher North on organ/synth; with the additions of Doug Jackson on electric guitar, Mary Harris on keyboards, and the powerful and contemporary lead vocals of Kipp Lennon… Together Ambrosia is exploring new musical territory and continuing to wow life-long fans and new converts alike !

www.ambrosialive.net 

www.facebook.com/Ambrosiatheband  

www.instagram.com/ambrosiatheband

AMBROSIA:

Joseph Puerta - bass /lead vocals

Burleigh Drummond - drums / vocals

Christopher North - organ/keyboard synth

Doug Jackson - electric guitar / vocals

Mary Harris - keyboard / vocals

Kipp Lennon - lead vocals

title: Vallejo, CA - Spinning Babies® Workshop w/ Nikki
description:
Spinning Babies® begins with fetal rotation to reveal the lesser known physiology of birth anatomy. Your passion, our approach. Start seeing solutions in labor progress with this new lens on childbirth. After this workshop you will be able to: -Facilitate comfort in pregnancy and ease in childbirth for your clients -Improve fetal position without manipulation of the fetus - Identify issues faster; gentle actions to shorten a long labor or avoid a cesarean -Use less\(or no\) force to resolve malposition and labor dystocia And much, much more! Spinning Babies® Three PrinciplesSM. Three BalancesSM, and Three Levels Solutions offers the world’s first complete system of birth preparation and labor ease concepts using baby’s position. Physiological techniques change the effective size of the pelvis through the body’s own innate capacity to resolve or prevent labor dystocia. Who May Attend We welcome all professionals who serve people in their pregnancy and birth. Ideal for midwives, nurses, nurse practitioners, doulas and childbirth educators. Also attended by obstetricians, family medicine doctors, prenatal yoga instructors, chiropractors, acupuncturists, massage therapists, perinatal case managers, and community health workers. Recommended for people new to Spinning Babies®, as well as those practiced in it for years. CEs are available for some participants, as noted in the Continuing Education section below. Food and Refreshments Snacks, coffee, and tea will be provided. We will take a 60-minute lunch break. Bring a lunch or go out with new friends.  Special Notes Dress comfortably as we will be moving around and practicing techniques with each other. Please contact the organizer if you are able to supply a massage table for the workshop.   Public Host Information: Host Name: Kaitlyn Pfeiffer Host Email: kaitlynepfeiffer@gmail.com Cancellation Policy If you will miss this workshop due to attending a birth, you must notify the organizer before the workshop begins. Refunds will not be granted without prior notification. If you need to cancel for other reasons, please contact the organizer. About the Trainer - Nikki Zerfas Nikki Zerfas is an experienced Labor & Delivery nurse. She actively participates in the orientation and mentorship of new staff and works to bring educational opportunities to her colleagues, with emphasis on implementing physiology-based birth practices, continuous labor support, and emphasizing breastfeeding-friendly care of new families. She is especially focused on supporting physiological birth in complex medical situations. Nikki maintains her certifications in Electronic Fetal Monitoring and as an International Board Certified Lactation Consultant. She continues to work as a bedside nurse and enjoys bringing birth workers of all disciplines together in the goal of improving the care and outcomes of new families. Continuing Education Maternity House Publishing, Inc. \(dba Spinning Babies ®\) is accredited as a provider of Nursing Continuing Professional Development by the American Nurses Credentialing Center's Commission on Accreditation \(ANCC\). This activity has been awarded 7 contact hours through ANCC. The American Academy of Family Physicians has granted Spinning Babies® Workshop 7.0 Contact hours of Elective Continuing Medical Education credits for the One-day workshop. Many doula and childbirth education organizations accept these contact hours; check your organization’s policies. Advanced Offerings See our Spinning Babies® online course catalog for current list of virtual workshops and trainings. The Spinning Babies® Workshop is the prerequisite for taking Spinning Babies® Integration Workshops, the Spinning Babies® Certified Parent Educator Training or Spinning Babies® Aware Practitioner Workshop. You can attend a Resolving Shoulder Dystocia and Breech Basics Workshops before you have attended a Spinning Babies® workshop, but we recommend you attend the Spinning Babies® workshop workshop first. Terms of Use This workshop does not provide a certification in Spinning Babies®️ only a document of attendance. Participants will not be able to use the name Spinning Babies® to describe their services, such as offering Spinning Babies®️, sessions, or saying “trained in Spinning Babies” after registering for or attending this workshop. Participants may use concepts and techniques introduced in the workshop in the participant’s practices. Further training is available for eligible participants which does lead towards a contractual relationship for listing or certification and use of Spinning Babies®️ brand and name. Tax Exemption If you are associated with an organization that is tax exempt, you will be able to indicate this on the payment page. If someone from your organization has submitted a tax exemption form to Spinning Babies®️ previously, please contact your organization to use a tax exemption form code. Otherwise, you can upload a .pdf version of your tax exemption form on the payment page and will be required to pay tax at time of purchase, but will be refunded if/when your form is accepted by Spinning Babies®️.

title: Cool Team Leader Half-Day Training
description:
Cool Petaluma is about to launch a new cohort of Cool Team Leaders! 

In the current day, some of our strongest resources are our communities and neighbors. What better way to kick off 2026 than by building bonds with the people around you?

The Cool Teams program brings people together to take care of each other while taking care of the planet. Neighborhood-based Cool Teams are the most popular option, but the program has expanded to include friend groups, faith-based groups, and coworkers–whoever forms your team.

Our Team Leader Training is where dedicated community members can step up and learn how to become Team Leaders. This training will show you how to gather neighbors or friends and kickstart community climate action! Including information on climate change, guides on how to host a cool event, and how to create real change, this training will give you everything you need to know so you can become a Team Leader in your own community.

Remember to bring a water bottle and a snack for the day!

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?* art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?* is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit’s core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU’s Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU’s Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: Introduction to the Art of Bookmaking
description:
Schedule

Fridays, February 20 – March 13, 2026 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Other, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$220 – Registration Cost $30 – Materials Fee $250 – Total Registration CostLearn essential bookbinding techniques in this 4-week introduction to book arts. Create zines, pamphlets, accordion folds, and more using traditional paper-folding and stitching methods.

What you’ll do

Join guest artist, Bettina Pauly in this incredible introduction to book arts! The art of bookmaking, otherwise known as bookbinding, is the physical craft of creating an artistic book from start to finish. In this introductory 4-session class, you will learn the basic use of bookbinding tools and materials, along with simple bookbinding structures that utilize paper softcovers. Students will learn several basic bookbinding structures and stitches that every beginning book artist should know! Experience technical skills such as paper folding, cutting, sewing and gluing, mixed with artistic elements of design to create functional, elegant objects built for storytelling. The instructor will offer guided instruction in a supportive learning environment with a limited class size. Each 3-hour session will meet for four consecutive weeks and focus on the following core bookbinding techniques:

Session 1: Intro to tools and paper folding; one sheet wonder zine, ‘pants’ fold with and without cover, map folds

Session 2: Pamphlets, and Japanese stab hole binding; three hole pamphlet stitch, five hole pamphlet stitch, Japanese stab binding two holes / five holes 

Session 3: Accordion folds; accordion fold, accordion fold tipped into envelope cover, accordion fold with non-adhesive cover

Session 4: Magic wallets, and personal projects

The class materials fee will include paper and all the tools needed to create each of these projects. Students will be able to take home all of their book projects at the end of the workshop. Please note: This class requires some hand dexterity to maneuver bookbinding tools. Participants should feel comfortable using tools with sharp edges such as an awl, x-acto knife, and scissors.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

A class that is all about pinching! With instructor Dan, students will learn handbuilding methods to coil and pitch their vessels. With specific direction in learning the techniques to build any size of pot, from a large scale vessel to a small cup. We will learn how to support scaling up our forms through drying methods, interior ‘bone’ structure, and mastering directionality with our hands. There will be a focus on how we each make a mark upon a pot, and how to do so with purpose. Each student will create work that reflects the time-honored nature of handbuilding; when intention is given to the silhouette of a form, the lip of a cup, and/or the comfort of a handle. Each class will involve a warmup, a demo, and worktime. Most classes will have \(fun&thoughtful\) homework.

title: Marin Arts & Crafts Show
description:
Join us February 27–March 1 at the Marin Spring Arts & Crafts Show and explore over 200 artisan exhibits in a vibrant handcraft marketplace. Inspired by the Arts & Crafts movement, the show celebrates handcraft in all its forms — a wonderful way to welcome the spring season while discovering beautifully made, one-of-a-kind work and supporting today’s makers.

Discover a wide variety of handcrafted goods, including woodwork, textiles, ceramics, jewelry, furniture, artisan foods, and more — all created by the artisans themselves.

Beyond shopping, enjoy live music, hands-on workshops, door prizes, and wine tasting. It’s a lively and inspiring celebration of art and handcraft, perfect for a spring outing in Marin.

📅 February 27–March 1 📍 Marin Center Exhibit Hall 🕒 10 AM – 5 PM daily 🎟️ Free admission & free parking

\#MarinArtsAndCrafts \#MarinEvents \#SpringInMarin \#Handcrafted \#ShopHandmade \#SupportArtisans \#BayAreaEvents

For more details, visit MarinArtsAndCraftsShow.com

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
**WHAT:** Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

**DATE:**            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

**TIME:** 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

**WHERE:**       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

**LINK:**             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

**DETAILS:**

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         **Offered Daily:** 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         **Experience length:** 2 hours

·         **Wines:** Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         **Cost:** $150 per Person

·         **Exclusive Member Price:** $95 per Member

**ADMISSION:** Members $95 | Non-members $150

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. In inclement weather, this experience will be hosted in our charming tasting room.

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Machado Burgers’ weekly car show event is held every Friday 4pm-7pm. We gather with good cars, people, music and food. Every classic car that comes down receives a raffle ticket and entry into our best-of-show for a weekly trophy. Raffle drawings are 4:30, 5:30 and 6:30 and the best of the show is named at 6:45. Winners must be present for both raffles and trophies as the trophy features a picture of you and your car. Come on down and join us for some good community fun.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Longboard Vineyards Wine, Dine & Dance
location:
Longboard Vineyards Barrel Room Address: 5 Fitch Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
Friday Night Music, Wine & Dine at Longboard Vineyards

**Featuring Rootstocks Band & Jamerikan Jerk Food Pop-UP**

Join us for a lively Friday night at Longboard Vineyards in our Barrel Room, located in downtown Healdsburg, featuring live music, award-winning wine, and classic comfort food. Our Music, Wine & Dine Night pairs the upbeat, crowd-friendly sounds of Rootstocks and in support of Black History Month, we are excited to have Chef Kingsley with Jamerikan Jerk Caribbean Food. Enjoy Longboard’s wines by the glass or bottle while Jamerikan Jerk Brings real-deal Caribbean flavor to the event with crowd-favorite jerk chicken (smoky, tender, perfectly spiced), rice & peas, sweet plantains, sandwiches and sauces that hit. Fast service, big portions, and food that keeps people talking long after the music stops.

Friday | 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM Free entry

Please note: This is an over-21 event inside the Barrel Room. Under-21 guests and leashed pets are welcome on the patio only.

Come grab a seat early and enjoy a classic Sonoma County night of great music, great wine, and great food.

Wine available for purchase Live music by Rootstocks and Food by Jamerikan Jerk Location: Longboard Vineyards Barrel Room Address: 5 Fitch Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Elevated Sessions at The Lounge with Sweet Sisters Family Farm 2/27/26
description:
Step into a higher class of cannabis. Elevated Sessions is an intimate, sommelier-led tasting experience featuring the premium, sungrown flower of Sweet Sisters Family Farm—thoughtfully curated for the true cannabis connoisseur. Rooted in native Mendocino soils, Sweet Sisters Farm represents the enduring legacy of the Emerald Triangle and a proud Mendocino craft tradition. Founded by Sara and David, the farm has been cultivating exceptional cannabis for decades with care, integrity, and deep respect for the land.

Join us for a refined 60 minute session designed to awaken the senses. Your cannabis sommelier will guide you through 4 exceptional cultivars — exploring their terpene profiles, aromas, flavors, and effects — while you savor a drink from the natural soda bar, curated snacks, and palate cleansers.

This is more than a tasting — it’s an immersive journey through craft cannabis, where every detail is designed to elevate your evening, from the intimate atmosphere to the exclusive perks awaiting guests.

Date & Sessions

Date: Friday, February 27, 2026

Two Sessions: 6:00 PM & 8:00 PM

Capacity: 16 guests per session \(32 tickets total\)

What’s Included

Enjoy a refreshing Natural Soda – A cannabis-infused palate opener

Guided Tasting of 4 Curated Strains –Guests enjoy exclusive cultivar drop

Tasting Passport – Track aromas, effects, and personal favorites

Charcuterie & Palate Cleansers – Light bites designed for the session

Meet The Grower – Learn how this award-winning flower was grown

Exclusive Perks – Discounts \+ access to limited drops

Ticket Tiers \(Limited to 16 Guests per Session\)

6:00 PM Flight Tasting Pass - $75: Includes 🌱 $50 Goodie Bag, 4 Curated Tastings, Tasting Passport, Natural Soda Bar, Snacks & Exclusive Deals

8:00 PM Flight Tasting Pass - $75: Includes 🌱 $50 Goodie Bag, 4 Curated Tastings, Tasting Passport, Natural Soda Bar, Snacks & Exclusive Deals

21\+ Only | DCC \# C12-0000420-LIC

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. No experience is necessary to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Beginner Salsa Friday
description:
Join our beginner salsa class. No experience or partner is needed. Just comfortable shoes and desire to have fun!

Great for first timers!

No dance experience required

Non-marking shoes soles

No partner necessary

We know it can be challenging to learn something new. As such, the beginner salsa class is geared for people who are starting out or those that are returning to refresh their skills. Our relaxed environment is perfect for learning salsa basics, as we make it fun and enjoyable. In this class you will learn basic directional steps, proper frame for partner-work and simple turn patterns. We organize our curriculum so that the movements are easy to remember. Join us to learn the fundamentals! No experience is necessary and no partner is required. Drop-in fee is $20.

Date & Time: Fridays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM

Instructor: Lucie Ebnerova

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway #8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Intermediate Salsa with Tyler
description:
Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?

Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. In this class, you’ll go beyond the basics to learn intricate footwork, enhance your leading and following skills, and master the body movement that will make you shine on the dance floor. This class is for anyone ready to learn the techniques and intermediate steps needed to take their dancing to the next level.

You’ll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

Master complex turn patterns and combinations.

Strengthen your lead and follow for seamless, connected dancing.

Adapt to different partners and music with ease on the social dance floor.

What to Expect: Instructor Tyler blends a fun, supportive atmosphere with structured lessons, so you’re always challenged but never overwhelmed. Helping you progress steadily while keeping the joy of salsa front and center.

Details:

No partner necessary—rotations ensure everyone dances.

Please wear non-marking shoes to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

When: Fridays, 6:30 PM – 7:30 PM

Instructor: Tyler Crandall

Where: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8, San Rafael, CA

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life’s curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate—and an impromptu happy hour—and decide it’s high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they’ve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment—and most importantly, realize it’s never too late to make new old friends.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: John Reischman and the Jaybirds
description:
Bluegrass, old time and acoustic roots music with outstanding musicianship Like the powerful mandolinist and composer at its helm, John Reischman and the Jaybirds fashion a stylish take on bluegrass that seamlessly blends original songs and instrumentals with Appalachian old-time music for a truly unique band sound. Now in their 20th year, with seven acclaimed albums and two Juno nominations, the Jaybirds are simultaneously innovative and unadorned, sophisticated and stripped-down, happily old-fashioned and 21st-century contemporary.  Tickets are $35 advance, $40 at the door. Discount for OCA members. Doors open at 6:30 PM. OCA is wheelchair accessible. Art gallery open during intermission, refreshments for sale.  Get Tickets  Bluegrass Unlimited calls John Reischman "one of the world's undisputed masters" of the mandolin, famed for outstanding tone and taste. Many of his dozens of original instrumentals have become popular favourites for sessions and covers, such as the jam standard Saltspring. He has three critically-acclaimed solo instrumental albums and has recorded on many other projects, including the Grammy-winning True Life Blues: The Songs of Bill Monroe. John also plays Latin-based jazz and choro music with highly regarded finger-style acoustic guitarist/composer John Miller; the duo has released three superb albums. John began his career in the San Francisco Bay area in the early '80s with the eclectic Good Ol' Persons bluegrass band. He was an original member of the legendary "new acoustic" quartet, the jazz-influenced Tony Rice Unit, renowned for highly skilled instrumentals. John moved to Vancouver in the early '90s and in 1999 formed the Jaybirds. Of their latest album, Folk Radio UK said "On That Other Green Shore showcases an accomplished, experienced band at the peak of their powers, with musicianship of the very highest order." Peghead Nation called it "one of the most beguiling bluegrass-rooted recordings of 2017." Los Angeles, CA-based guitarist Patrick Sauber joined the Jaybirds in 2017. The veteran performer has played with, among others, Doc Watson, Richard Greene, John Jorgensen, Peter Rowan, Tim O'Brien and John Fogerty. He played on the 2016 Grammy-nominated album The Hazel and Alice Sessions by Laurie Lewis, and appeared in the film A Mighty Wind with Christopher Guest. Bluegrass Unlimited describes Patrick's playing on John's tune Daylighting the Creek as "a glorious flatpicking solo that hews back to the glory days of early bluegrass guitar." Chilliwack, BC-based Trisha Gagnon is portrayed by Sing Out! as "one of the most versatile" and "irresistible" lead vocalists in bluegrass, her strong and distinctive style ranging from "mournful and plaintive" to "hopeful and yearning." Trisha anchors what Dirty Linen magazine calls "gorgeous three-part harmonies." She's also known for songwriting, dating back to her early days with the award-winning B.C. bluegrass band Tumbleweed. Her solo album includes guests Vince Gill and Peter Rowan. Nanaimo, BC-based Nick Hornbuckle has developed his own voice on the five-string banjo - a two-finger roll unlike other contemporary banjo players. "Nick Hornbuckle's banjo can be downright spine-tingling," said the L.A Daily News. His solo album 12×2 \(\+/-1\), was nominated for a Canadian Folk Music Award in 2015, and Nick is a composer who also digs for rare old-time gems. His sprightly instrumental Wellesley Station on the new Jaybird album "showcases Nick's sharp picking and sense of melody," said Green Man Review. Spokane, WA-based Greg Spatz is hailed as a "world-class bluegrass fiddler" by Fiddler Magazine. Audiophile Audition says Greg's "virtuosic playing is flawlessly delivered time after time," while Bluegrass Unlimited says he "lays down some seriously fine bluegrass fiddle" on the latest Jaybirds release. His strong chops have made him a popular fixture down through the years on the West Coast, where he's played with iconic mandolinist Frank Wakefield, resophonic guitar master Rob Ickes, and many others including Laurie Lewis, Bryan Bowers, and Eli West and Cahalen Morrison. Greg also plays and records with Mighty Squirrel, has a solo album called Fiddler's Dream and a duo recording with his wife called All Along the Sea, and is an award-winning

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Water Tower
description:
Water Tower is the current moniker of multi-instrumentalist Kenny Feinstein’s musical brainchild, originally founded in 2005 in Portland. While their lineup has evolved over time, fuelled by Feinstein’s masterful song-crafting, fiercely DIY approach, and genre-bending sonic identity, Water Tower have established themselves as a global force to be reckoned with.

Pioneers of a new wave of bluegrass and old-time with a distinctly punk rock flair, Water Tower take influences from Foghorn Stringband and Bill Monroe to Rancid and Black Flag, passing them through a unique lens that magnifies the individual strength of their core and auxiliary members while remaining faithful to the revivalist spirit.

In 2015, the band moved to LA, where their current lineup of Kenny Feinstein \(lead vocals, guitar, fiddle, mandolin\), Tommy Drinkard \(banjo, vocals\), Taylor Estes \(Bass, Vocals, and Nicholas Leahy \(mandolin, vocals\) can often be found busking while not in the studio or on tour.

Since then, Water Tower have built major momentum, releasing a concept album Fly Around \(ft. guest vocals from Black Flag’s Ron Reyes and produced by Don Bolles of The Germs\), filming 1m\+ view viral videos, and catching the eye of A-listers including Katy Perry, whose 2023 NYE party they played at, and Riff Raff, who shouted out “Take Me Back”, the debut single from their upcoming album Live from Los Angeles, to be released later this year. A slew of tour dates in the US and the UK has already been announced.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Healdsburg After Dark Stand-Up Comedy with Steve Ausburne
description:
We said we were a community hub, right? We said we bring Healdsburg to life? Well… it’s time to put our money where our mouth is. And we’re doing it right! We’re kicking off a brand-new series of stand-up comedy nights with one of the best standup comedians in town (in our opinion, in other people’s opinions, and soon, in your opinion too): Steve Ausburne!

Maybe you laughed your face off at our last comedy night in November - or maybe you didn’t… because you weren’t there. Either way, Steve is back. He’s our main man, living-room ringmaster, and the producer behind the show. Steve’s comedy career got its start as an MC for friends’ bands, which eventually led to his first stand-up set - a set so memorable it earned him a lifetime ban from a church in Grants Pass, Oregon. But Steve didn’t let that slow him down. Instead, he embraced the stage as a place for brutally honest, painfully awkward life confessions - the kind usually reserved for therapy, or very, very funny comedy.

And he’s not coming alone.

Jalisa Robinson joins the lineup - a proud Midwesterner now living in California, and a 2022 Semi-Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition. She’s a favorite at The Punchline San Francisco, Cobb’s, San Jose Improv, Rooster T. Feathers, and Don’t Tell Comedy, and performs regularly at clubs and festivals across California and beyond. If sharp, witty, and hilarious is your vibe, Jalisa’s got you covered.

And then there’s Ronn Vigh - our headliner. Ronn has written for *Fashion Police* on E! Television and performs stand-up at clubs, colleges, and venues across the country. He still dreams of becoming a weatherman (we support the dream). In the meantime, he’s an avid yogi (when not hungover), a devoted *Golden Girls* fan, and - despite being gay - a lifelong football lover.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Steel Magnolias
description:
Set in Truvy’s beauty salon in Chinquapin, Louisiana, Steel Magnolias centers around a group of ladies who frequent the parlor to get their hair done and gossip about anyone and everyone in town – not necessarily in that order. Alternately hilarious and touching, the play is a loving exploration of the profound bond that connects these six wildly different women. This smash hit play became a smash hit movie that audiences loved!

February 13th, 14th, 15th, 19th, 20th, 21st, 22nd, 27th, 28th, March 1st. 

Friday and Saturday Shows: 7:30 PM

Sunday Matinee: 2:00 PM

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***“It’s a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.“* — Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers’ timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing—until the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious,” this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible—especially with a little magic in the air!**

title: Sonoma Guitar Series Sérgio & Odair Assad 60th Anniversary Tour
description:
Brazilian-born brothers Sérgio and Odair Assad celebrate 60 years of setting the standard of guitar innovation, ingenuity and expression. Their exceptional artistry and uncanny ensemble-playing come from a family rich in Brazilian musical tradition and studies under guitarist/lutenist Monina Távora, a disciple of Andrés Segovia. Their virtuosity has inspired a wide range of composers to write for them including Astor Piazzolla, Terry Riley, Radamés Gnattali, Marlos Nobre, Nikita Koshkin, Roland Dyens, Jorge Morel, Edino Krieger, and Francisco Mignone. Sérgio has added to their repertoire by composing music for the duo that showcases their virtuosity.

title: Sonoma County Restaurant Week
description:
Come out and Restaurant Week 2026 from February 23 - March 1! This is your chance support the vibrant and diverse culinary scene of Sonoma County and taste the unique flavors that our local restaurants have to offer. By dining out during the week, you'll be supporting small businesses and helping to sustain our local economy.

There are no tickets or passes required. Simply dine out at as many participating restaurants as you would like during Sonoma County Restaurant Week. Each restaurant will have at least one prix fixe menu to choose from.

This year, Restaurant Week is celebrating eateries that feature entrées sourced from 100% Sonoma County sourced ingredients and/or pour Sonoma County wines. Dining farm-to-table has never been so easy!

So gather your friends, family, and foodie companions, and make a reservation at one of our participating restaurants today. Your taste buds will thank you, and you’ll be supporting our local community at the same time. **Let’s make this Restaurant Week one to remember!**

title: Caring for Your Olive Trees with Paul Vossen at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:
Join us at Gold Ridge Organic Farms for a half-day workshop dedicated to the successful management of olive trees. Whether you're a home grower with a few backyard trees or an orchard management professional, you'll gain valuable insights from this focused session. Paul will explore essential topics including the definition and physiological causes of alternate bearing, best practices for pruning, irrigation, and nutrition, as well as practical strategies to reduce alternate bearing and improve overall olive production. The class covers both organic and conventional farming methods, giving you a comprehensive toolkit for cultivating healthier, more productive olive trees.

The session will be held in our milling area, with portions taking place in the orchards if weather permits. Please dress in comfortable layers to accommodate changing conditions and wear closed-toe, non-slip footwear suitable for walking on uneven terrain. Coffee and tea will be provided throughout the event.

Paul Vossen is a legendary local Farm Advisor and Emeritus Extension Agent who retired from UC Davis in 2016 after 35 years of distinguished research and teaching. He holds an M.S. in Tree Crops Production and a Certificate in Olive Oil Production from Cordova, Spain, and is passionate about helping farmers and home growers cultivate exceptional fruit. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from a seasoned expert and gain new insights to enhance the health and productivity of your olive trees.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: BLS Certification Class (American Heart Association)
description:
BLS Certification Class \(AHA\) - In Person, Instructor-Led

American Heart Association BLS certification class \(in-person, instructor-led class in our Rohnert Park classroom\). BLS \(Basic Life Support\) is the required CPR class for healthcare providers. Includes cardiac and respiratory arrest management, CPR, AED use, and choking treatment for all ages. This class is appropriate for initial BLS or BLS renewal.

Vive CPR is an American Heart Association \(AHA\) Training Site. AHA "BLS Provider" certifications are issued on the same day.

We also offer Blended Learning BLS certification courses \(online course plus in-person Skills Session\).

Learn from a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/bls-certification/

Questions? Call/text \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That’s why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps: You’ll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work: Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns: We’ll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We’ve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required: Whether you’ve never danced before or it’s been a while, you’re welcome here!

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: Overeaters Anonymous (OA) Newcomer Meeting
description:
**Is Food a Problem for You? You Are Not Alone.**

Overeaters Anonymous (OA) is a fellowship of people who support each other in recovering from compulsive eating and food behaviors. If you feel you have a problem with food, OA welcomes you—no matter what your background, beliefs, or eating habits. 

We hold an in-person newcomer meeting on first, second and fourth **Saturdays of the month from 9:45 - 10:15 AM at** ​**Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Marin, 240 Channing Way, San Rafael CA 94903**. Contact: Sue M. 415-298-6792​. You may view all North Bay OA in-person and online meetings at https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

In OA, members experience **spiritual, emotional, and physical recovery** by practicing the **Twelve Steps** and living by their spiritual principles—one day at a time.

OA is **not** a diet club or calorie-counting program.

Members have different plans of eating.

OA does **not** endorse any specific food plan. 

If food is causing problems in your life, you don’t have to struggle alone. Recovery is possible, and help is available.

**Visit:** https://www.northbayoa.org/

**Find a meeting:** https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

description:

Her ongoing series, Woman and Fox, A Journey, present rich, metaphorical paintings that invite you to pause on your own path and enjoy the distance you have come.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Forest Bathing Walk
description:
Come enjoy a gentle, guided Forest Bathing Walk where East meets West at the Sonoma Botanical Garden. This event is inspired by the Japanese practice of shinrin yoku or “forest bathing.” Forest bathing is the intentional practice of slowing down and immersing oneself in the sights, sounds, smells, and sensations of the natural world in order to restore well-being and deepen our relationship with nature.

This walk will be led by Susan Karle, a Certified Forest Therapy Guide, who brings over a decade of experience guiding nature connection practices with people of all ages. Her approach integrates her background in grief and trauma work with a deep respect for the healing power of nature.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Naturally Arising Samādhi and Insight
description:
with Phillip Moffitt

The Naturally Arising method starts meditation practice in a different manner. It begins with a preliminary, preparatory practice in which all the attention is systematically and repeatedly oriented inwardly. During this weekend non-residential retreat, Phillip will teach two practices that create the conditions for what he terms an “inward staying mind” to naturally arise.

The first of these practices is “The Three Renunciations,” which establishes a discerning mind that is free of reactivity and self-judgment. The second practice, the Arriving Sequence, establishes a mind state that is available for practice and aligned with the Dhamma. When combined, the fruition of these practices is a naturally arising responsive mind. In this way, we become free of the efforting that so often plagues our practice.

From there, we turn toward the Four Foundations of Mindfulness and we explore different capacities of consciousness that enhance insight. Throughout the meditation practice periods, there is continual emphasis on directly knowing experience through the felt sense. The result is a mind that has great clarity and is available to the natural emergence of wisdom and compassion.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Free Rowing Lessons in Classic Rowboats
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn the timeless—and beautiful—art of rowing? The Floathouse crew is here for you! This season, every Saturday from January 17 to March 28, we’ll host free rowing lessons for adults. Register online, and we’ll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain’s Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

This opportunity is available to all from January though March, 2026. Come once, come every weekend, or just now and then. Make this the year you learn to row, on Petaluma’s Longest Park, the Petaluma River.

Register online, and we’ll see you on the dock!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sugarloaf Through the Ages
description:
Join Sugarloaf docent Susan Perkins in a geology hike to learn about more about the geological formations that give Sugarloaf Ridge State Park its namesake, how soil composition influences native flora to thrive, and take a lightning-fast journey (in geological terms) through the history of the area, from the time California was underwater to today's volcanic caldera remains. 

Meet at the White Barn parking lot. Tickets are $10 for general audiences, $5 for youth (12-17 year olds; must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian), students, Sugarloaf Members, Sugarloaf or RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Wear layers, appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water, and if desired, a snack, binoculars, and/or a camera. We invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rains cancel. Parking fees apply.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian
