title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         Offered Daily: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         Experience length: 2 hours

·         Wines: Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         Cost: $150 per Person

·         Exclusive Member Price: $95 per Member

ADMISSION: Members $95 | Non-members $150

Source: Press Democrat

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:

description:

Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. In this class is about making sure you can do what you want to do, for as long as you want to do it. It’s about creating that strong foundation for a truly active lifestyle. Dance, Exercise, and Staying Fit.

low impact

building muscles

movement

confidence

We focus on the most important things: building strong muscles using safe, low-impact movements. We’ll also dedicate time to flexibility and balance, because true fitness isn’t just about strength—it’s about moving through the world with ease and confidence.

title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM – 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 – Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you’ll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist:  Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\), Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\) . Inspired by their playful styles, students will design and develop their very own characters—deciding where these characters live, work, play, eat, and sleep! Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.  Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

 watercolor, paint, pens, and collage

 recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use watercolor techniques to add color and mood

How scale helps characters and environments feel real

The arc of a story—beginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Room 116

title: After-School Adventure Gaming
description:
Tuesdays, February 10 – April 7, 2026 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM Exception: No class March 24

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Teens

Age\(s\)

10-15

$360 – Registration CostPresented by the Sonoma Community Center in partnership with The Game Academy

Join Adventure Gaming classes with The Game Academy! Play D&D, build community, and grow empathy through weekly storytelling sessions.

About the class

class descriptionAdventure Gaming classes presented by The Game Academy are held weekly for 2-hour sessions over an 8-week term. Participating players explore collaborative storytelling in a mentorship model using games like Dungeons & Dragons to build community, foster empathy, and support social-emotional growth. Our trained Educator-Gamemasters guide players in choosing the kinds of stories that interest them, then support unique and dynamic character creation, and finally present an engaging narrative filled with puzzles and mysteries to be solved, social role-play to navigate, and tactical challenges to be overcome… all based on the players’ interests. This uniquely tailored experience provides a rich context of personal investment, and engages our players with a fun and collaborative activity that helps them overcome social and emotional challenges, teaches them to engage with a growth mindset, supports the development of critical thinking and cooperative problem-solving skills, and helps them form lasting bonds with their peers. We hope your child will join us for a new adventure this coming Fall Term at the Sonoma Community Center.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

title: Wise Girl Workshops - School Year Wellness Workshops
description:
Whose ready to be a part of an amazing group of girls and youth who are open minded and hearted—ready to make new friends AND develop essential life skills to help them learn to live well?

We are now enrolling for our School Year Wellness Workshops for girls in 3rd-8th grades.

Meeting for a full 15 weeks, members make fantastic friendships, have fun engaging in activities and art projects, and learn social-emotional-physical tools that will help them throughout their lifetime.

We’ve got 3 amazing facilitators and workshops are hosted at McKinley School in Petaluma-though members come from a variety of schools and towns to attend opening up even further opportunities for making even more friends!

Pride Parenting is a dedicated space for LGBTQIA\+ parents and caregivers to connect, share experiences, and build community. Designed for adults raising children, this group offers a welcoming environment where Queer families can find support, exchange resources, and celebrate joy together.

Each session centers on connection, learning, and strengthening the bonds within our community. Pride Parenting is a confidential, closed group with limited space to ensure safety and meaningful participation.

When: Starting March 3, 2026 6 weekly group meetings Tuesdays 5:30pm - 7:30pm

Where: Keystone Therapy & Training Services, 4415 Sonoma Hwy. Santa Rosa, CA 95409

Cost: Free for Partnership Medi-Cal participants, $25 per session \($150 total\) for Private Insurance participants

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Independent Projects with Amy Hamley; Two Sessions
description:
Schedule

Session 1: Tuesdays, January 27 – February 17, 2026 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM Session 2: Tuesdays, February 24 – March 17, 2026 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM

Event Category: Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

Single Session – 4 weeks: $140 Registration Fee $30 Materials Fee $170 Total Registration Fee

Both Sessions – 8 weeks: $265 Registration Fee $30 Materials Fee $295 Total Registration Fee

Work independently on personal projects with the direct support of an instructor by your side in this Independent Projects Class with Amy Hamley.

What you’ll do

This session has been split into 2, 4 week sessions – you can enroll in each session independently or enroll in both as a package deal!This course is for students interested in exploring both wheel throwing AND handbuilding, and the combination of both in one class! Learn from Hamley’s years of expertise in the field and enjoy creating handbuilt, thrown, and altered forms. Amy caters each syllabus closely to her group of students, ensuring that every project fits the desires of participants. This course encourages folks to work on independent projects in the class, receiving one on one support from Amy throughout the time. This course will include demos, exercises, and utilize a variety of methods to achieve the desired goal for each student. Some projects may include wheel thrown vases with altered adornments, best practices for slump and hump molds, and more.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 117, Ceramics Studio

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
We’re offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur every Tuesday & Friday from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you’ve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves. No experience is necessary to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you’re a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they’ll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at: info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we’ll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We’ll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We’ll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary — rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM – 7:30PM

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We’ll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our intermediate bachata class is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We’ll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you’re ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required. We’ll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary: Come solo or bring a friend—either way, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can’t wait to see you on the dance floor.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Jewish Course in Novato Explores Dreams, Astrology, and the Evil Eye
description:
NOVATO, CA — Chabad Jewish Center of Novato is launching a new fascinating 4 week class: Jewpernatural: Signs, Spirits, and Superstition in Jewish Belief, a new four-week course from the beginning Monday, February 24.

The course addresses questions many people are asking today: Do dreams have meaning? Is there such a thing as destiny? What does Judaism say about astrology and the “evil eye”? How does Jewish tradition understand souls and the afterlife?

Drawing on Talmud, Jewish philosophy, and Kabbalah, Jewpernatural offers a grounded, thoughtful approach to topics that often generate curiosity, skepticism, and uncertainty.

The four sessions include:

Dreams & Direction

Stars & Signs

Jinx & The Evil Eye

Para & Normal (souls, angels, spirits, and the afterlife)

“People are curious about these topics, but they also want serious, authentic answers,” said Rabbi Menachem Landa of Chabad Jewish Center of Novato. “This course helps participants separate myth from meaning and gain practical Jewish perspective for real life.”

The course is open to all, regardless of background or prior Jewish learning.

Event Details What: Jewpernatural (4-weekcourse) When: Begins Monday, February 24 Where: Chabad Jewish Center of Novato Format: In person and Zoom Registration: Jewishnovato.com/Jewpernatural Contact: info@Jewishnovato.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Art Of Acrylics
description:
Suzanne will demonstrate each week as students follow along with weekly painting projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We'll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life. Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State. For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience
description:
WHAT: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur’s Experience

DATE:            Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

TIME: 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

WHERE:       Markham Vineyards

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

                        707-963-5292

                        https://markhamvineyards.com/ 

LINK:             https://markhamvineyards.com/visit/winery-experiences/

DETAILS:

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector’s journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

·         Offered Daily: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm and 2:00 – 4:00 pm

·         Experience length: 2 hours

·         Wines: Selections of library, limited single-vineyard, and a barrel tasting of yet-to-be-released Cabernet Sauvignon

·         Cost: $150 per Person

·         Exclusive Member Price: $95 per Member

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. In inclement weather, this experience will be hosted in our charming tasting room.

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: Press Democrat

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: Press Democrat

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: Press Democrat

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Next-Level Drawing
location:
20″ x 26″ drawing board with clips, 18 “x 24” Strathmore drawing pad \(other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality\), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal \(Char-kole brand black\), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black \(one fine-tip and one medium-tip\).Membership has its benefits

Source: Press Democrat
description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 11 – April 22, 2026 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$225 – Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20″ x 26″ drawing board with clips, 18 “x 24” Strathmore drawing pad \(other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality\), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal \(Char-kole brand black\), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black \(one fine-tip and one medium-tip\).Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Stitch Together 🧵
description:
Join us for **Stitch Café**, a cozy open studio held twice a month. Whether you're working on your own project or eager to explore new mending techniques like darning and appliqué, this is the perfect space to gather, share ideas, and sew together. We provide hand-sewing supplies and materials, but feel free to bring your own - it's all about community, creativity, and enjoying the process. By repairing what we already have and re-using materials, we're not just preserving memories and adding unique touches to our belongings - we’re also reducing waste and contributing to a more sustainable lifestyle. We can extend the life of our clothes and fabrics, and take small but meaningful steps toward caring for the planet.

title: Lawyers in the Library
description:
Local volunteer attorneys offer free legal information and referral for general law matters. These lawyer consultations will last up to 20 minutes. Sign-ups are first come, first served in person and begin at 4:30 pm. \(30 minutes before the program begins\) --- The attorneys are volunteers and provide only legal information. They do not provide specific legal advice and should not be considered as personal lawyers for any reason. You will be required to sign a waiver before speaking to an attorney that states that no attorney-client relationship is being created with this free service. No language translation services or interpreters are offered or provided by library staff. Participants must bring their own interpreter if one is needed. Participants may also bring support persons, family members or other affiliated persons to meet with the attorney together. For deaf and hard of hearing participants, the Sonoma County Bar Association will make arrangements for ASL interpretation with at least two days' advance notice. Please contact Reception@SonomaCountyBar.org or \(707\) 542-1190 ext.100 for assistance. The program is a partnership between the Sonoma County Library, the Sonoma County Law Library, and the Sonoma County Bar Association and is staffed by volunteer attorneys. Learn more about the Lawyers in the Library program here.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Wednesday Pottery on the Wheel; Advanced
description:
Wednesdays, January 28 – March 18, 2026 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM

Experience Level

Advanced

Event Category: Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

$265 – Registration Cost $30 – Materials Fee $295 – Total Registration Cost

A continuation of our intermediate course, this upper level / advanced course will help you hone your throwing skills in the studio.

What you’ll Create

This session is designed for people who have already taken multiple wheel throwing courses. A continuation of our intermediate course, this upper level / advanced course will help you hone your throwing skills through more complex demos, and nuanced approaches to technical throwing. In this 8 week course, students will dive deep into developing their own unique voice as they build a technical toolset for the independent maker. In addition to throwing, surface decoration techniques will be explored as well as the opportunity to experiment with different clay bodies. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ½ off during the duration of their class. title: Trisha Yearwood: The Mirror Tour An Intimate Acoustic Evening of Stories & Songs
description:
Back to All Shows


Trisha Yearwood: The Mirror Tour
An Intimate Acoustic Evening of Stories & Songs

Wednesday, March 4, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 
With a career spanning three decades, Trisha Yearwood is a Grammy®, CMA®, and ACM® award-winning icon whose powerhouse voice and passion have captivated millions. Singer, actress, author, chef, and entrepreneur, Yearwood has achieved multiplatinum success while continuing to evolve as an artist. Most recently, she released two acclaimed albums, The Mirror, a deeply personal collection of songs co-written by Yearwood, and Christmastime, a joyful holiday project featuring festive favorites, a new original, and sweeping orchestral arrangements. 
In 2019, Trisha released Every Girl, her first full-length country album in over a decade, which included an acoustic re-recording of her breakthrough single, “She’s in Love With The Boy,” the most-listened-to country song by a female artist in Billboard’s Country Airplay Chart history. Trisha’s influence continues to reach new heights, recently inducted into the Austin City Limits Hall of Fame, she also celebrated 25 years with the Grand Ole Opry, received the ACM Honors Icon Award and CMT Awards June Carter Cash Humanitarian Award. Beyond music, she is the Emmy® winning host of Trisha’s Southern Kitchen, authored four New York Times bestsellers, and co-owns Nashville’s largest honky-tonk. 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: Luther Burbank Center

title: Yoga Vinyasa Krama
description:
Nataraja School of Traditional Yoga
**Yoga Vinyasa Krama - Thursdays 9-10:30am**
**Soft Medicine Sanctuary - Loft**

Experience physical health & fitness, pranic flow, vital energy & stillness - through intelligent architecture with the metaphysics of deep conscious breathing & slow motion, yogic breathwork, mantra/sound/vibration, mudra, subtle & contemplative practices.

Yoga Vinyasa Krama is a comprehensive hatha-raja yogic system for purification, developing concentration, neuromuscular fitness and conditioning, mastering the breath, awakening subtle energy and stilling the mind. Based on deep breathing & the subtle movement of prana directed into the cartilage tissue, sinuous musculature, internal organs, nerve pathways and nadis. It has over 700 intelligently sequenced slow, conscious breath powered with precision movement variations with pause (vinyasas), exploring many aesthetic variations of each posture to correctly establish the main asanas while the mind merges with the breath.
Includes drishti, pratikriyas, bandha, vaseth, mudra, mantra, surya & ding namaskar with breath & mantra, cleansing kriyas, Himalayan pranayama including including ujjayi variations, heating & cooling breaths, solar, lunar & soli-lunar nadi shuddhi practices, pranava & samantraka pranayama, pratyahara, subtle & contemplative practices in 12 kramas (sequences).

The whole process gradually transforms the body and mind, releasing old patterns of physical and mental tension and dysfunctional patterns of movement, providing tonic, energetic and psychophysiological effects. This system is presented from the teachings Srivatsa Ramaswami learned through his over 33 years of one on one study with Sri Krishnamacharya and teachings from a similar Himalayan method.

This ongoing class will explore the entire system of 12 Kramas with each class focusing on a particular krama (sequence) & pranayama & contemplative practices.

Please practice on an empty stomach. Morning beverage ok but please take it 30min or more before class.

$25 Drop In, Discounted Class Passes & Memberships
Register -[https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true](https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true)

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9–March 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of bonsai and the season’s first flowers. Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year’s all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai—trees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot bonsai take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal—reminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through Hanami Strolls—guided walks through the Garden’s Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: Press Democrat

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

Source: Press Democrat

description:

                        2812 St Helena Hwy North, St Helena, CA 94574

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: Press Democrat

title: 2026 North Bay Housing Action Summit
description:
You are Invited to the the 5th Annual North Bay Housing Action Summit

Presented by Generation Housing | March 5, 2026

Generation Housing invites you to the 2026 North Bay Housing Action Summit, a gathering of leaders, advocates, and changemakers who are dedicated to advancing real housing solutions in our region. Held at The Backdrop in Santa Rosa, the Summit will feature dynamic and informative speakers, and share the tools needed to create meaningful change in your community.

What you can expect:

● Hear more about the Housing for Healthy Communities Initiative.

● Learn the practical steps associated with AB 1033, which allows the sale of

ADUs as separate homes through condoization—perfect for realtors, builders,

lawyers, and bankers involved in ADU sales, development, and construction.

● Gain powerful communication and advocacy skills to support more housing

(transferable skills you can use in your work and advocacy roles outside of

housing, too!)

● Build connections with others who care about housing & community action.

﻿The Housing Action Summit is designed to help you turn urgency into impact and bring the changes we need for our community to thrive. The program will include a reception designed to encourage continued discussion and deeper engagement in the work Generation Housing is leading throughout the North Bay.

RSVPs are open.

Tickets available on a sliding scale.

Visit us online at www.generationhousing.org/news/ to reserve your seat

What you’ll do

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in on the wheel in this 8 week course. Designed for all levels \(beginners and those more experienced\) Deborah thoughtfully explores the tried and true techniques of ceramic work with her students through structured assignments, allowing her students to develop their own creative voice in the process.Students will receive instruction in wheel work, glazing, and finishing pieces. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ½ off during the duration of their class. title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we’re expanding the exhibit to include bags—think totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It’s a joy to see your art find a new home—and to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: Press Democrat
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 15, 2026 1:00 PM – 4:00 PM

Location

Room 201, Fiber Arts Studio

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Programming, Sustainability

Age\(s\)

All Ages are welcome to attend Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult

$25 – One Bag or Doll Entry $40 – Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 – 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we’ll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we’re expanding the exhibit to include bags—think totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It’s a joy to see your art find a new home—and to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Samba no Pé - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro! Samba no Pé \(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no Pé.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout—all while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM – 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Give 'Em the Arrow Again!  Ladies Night at the Archery Range
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
I'm super excited to be able to offer another ladies' Archery night in Santa Rosa! If you've ever had a curiosity about archery, this is your chance to find out more with a fun, interactive lesson.

We have reserved a special event with the indoor range on a Wednesday evening. It will consist of a basic lesson, and then we all get to practice shooting. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment is provided by them, and we will probably get about an hour or hour and a half to practice.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy). Closed toe shoes recommended.

There are 17 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event in addition to the regular fee so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of the event. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Outback Presents Whitney Cummings: The Big Baby Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents 
Whitney Cummings: The Big Baby Tour

Saturday, March 14, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Whitney Cummings is a comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, and host of the hit podcast Good for You. Best known for creating and starring in the NBC series Whitney and co-creating the syndicated, Emmy-nominated CBS comedy 2 Broke Girls, she has become a leading voice in modern comedy. Cummings has released six stand-up specials, including Money Shot (2010), I Love You (2014), I’m Your Girlfriend (2016), Can I Touch It? (2019), Jokes (2022), and her latest, Mouthy, which debuted on OnlyFans in November 2023. She has also appeared in numerous television series and films, such as Good Mourning, Studio 666, How It Ends, and FOX’s Accused, further solidifying her presence on both the big and small screens. 
Beyond performing, Cummings is a successful author and filmmaker. In 2017, she published her memoir, I’m Fine… And Other Lies, and made her directorial debut with the feature adaptation of Louann Brizendine’s bestseller, The Female Brain. She continues to create, produce, and perform across platforms, bringing her sharp humor and fearless perspective to audiences worldwide. She currently lives in Los Angeles. 


POST-SHOW VIP MEET & GREET ADD-ON 
VIP Ticket to include: 

Post-Show Meet & Greet & Photo with Whitney Cummings.
Meet & Greet ticket DOES NOT include a seat for the show.
A separate show ticket MUST be purchased to attend Meet & Greet.

Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Live Nation Presents Ralph Barbosa: The Red 40 Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Live Nation Presents 
Ralph Barbosa: The Red 40 Tour

Sunday, March 15, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS
AGE RESTRICTION: 18 and above 
 
One of the shyest attention hogs ever to do comedy, Ralph Barbosa’s disarming and laid-back style has made him a stand-out on stage, on TV, and as host of the Formula Bean YouTube channel with Luis Cisneros. Last summer, Barbosa premiered his second hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Planet Bosa, as part of Hulu’s new Hularious comedy brand. 
His first hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Cowabunga, premiered on Netflix on October 31, 2023, and ranked as the #3 TV show on Netflix throughout its first week on the service. 
In July 2024, Barbosa was selected as one of Variety’s 10 Comics to Watch for 2024 and toured theaters throughout North America, including two sold-out theater shows as part of the Netflix Is A Joke Fest 2024, as well as hosting the kick-off show. 2023 was Barbosa’s break-out year, during which he was a guest on The Joe Rogan Experience, made his debut on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and performed Comedy Central Stand-up Featuring: Ralph Barbosa, which topped 6 million views on YouTube. 
Barbosa also starred in the HBO Max comedy special, Entre Nos: The Winners 3 in 2022, and earlier that year his Don’t Tell Comedy performance was released on YouTube and now has over 6 million views. 


Platinum Tickets are tickets that are dynamically priced up and down based on demand. Platinum Tickets are not part of VIP packages – they are tickets only. 
Platinum Seating provides fans with direct access to securing some of the best seats in the venue at market value. The market value for Platinum Seating is subject to change based on the overall demand and popularity for the event.  Platinum Seating allows fans to purchase tickets in a safe and secure environment without running the risk of purchasing tickets that may be considered lost, stolen, or counterfeit.

title: MP Matador Promotions Presenta Carlos Daniels: Homenaje a Juan Gabriel – Mas Vivo Que Nunca 2026
description:
Back to All Shows


MP Matador Promotions Presenta
Carlos Daniels: Homenaje a Juan Gabriel – Mas Vivo Que Nunca 2026

Friday, March 20, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
After four successful tours across the US, Colombian Latin-mariachi-pop singer, songwriter, and producer Carlos Daniels is back with Más Vivo Que Nunca  – Juan Gabriel Tribute (More Alive Than Ever), a spectacle that thousands of fans across the nation are waiting for. 
Known as one of the best interpreters of El Divo De Juarez’s music, Daniels has conquered fans’ hearts with impressive performances at renowned venues, including five shows at the House of Blues Mandalay Bay Casino in Las Vegas. On this new tour, Daniels, along with a Mariachi band, is determined to touch your soul by reviving some of Gabriel’s greatest hits, while delivering an unforgettable performance. Más Vivo Que Nunca – Juan Gabriel Tribute will bring you a sea of emotions and memories, promising they will keep you singing along to every tune from the beginning until the end of the show. 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series: The Pout-Pout Fish by TheaterWorksUSA
description:
Back to All Shows


Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
The Pout-Pout Fish 
by TheaterWorksUSA


Sunday, March 22, 2026

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
Can the poutiest fish frown turn upside down? Find out in this extraordinary musical, featuring whimsical puppets and live performers in a sweeping oceanic adventure. When Mr. Fish sets out on a quest to find Miss Clam’s missing pearl, he discovers there is more to him than his permanently plastered pout. Dive into this colorful adaptation of The New York Times bestseller, co-conceived, directed, and designed by the acclaimed puppeteers of AchesonWalsh Studios, whose work was featured in Broadway’s The King And I, On the Town and Radio City’s New York Spectacular. The writing team includes New Victory LabWorks Residency recipients Christopher Anselmo, Jared Corak, Matt Acheson, and Fergus Walsh. 
Recommended for ages 3-8, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 50 minutes 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 
 
Family Fun in the Lobby
Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It’s a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family’s budget in mind!   


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats®.) 

 Family Fun Series – Save 20% and see all 5 shows!
See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series 



Timeline

New Subscriptions go on sale for Members beginning June 24; General Public, June 27.
Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22.

Two ways to buy! Season ticket packages are available online or by downloading the form (linked below) and sending the completed form to us by mail or email. If you have any questions, call the Patron & Member Services Office at 707.546.3600. 

Purchase New Subscription ONLINE
Download New Subscription Form 
 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: Luther Burbank Center

Scottish Country Dancing

First time free, then $10 for first or second session, or $12 for whole evening.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, rosé, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

First time free, then $10 for first or second session, or $12 for whole evening.

title: ICON Concerts Presents Becky Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


ICON Concerts Presents 
Becky Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour

Saturday, April 4, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Originally from Portland, Oregon, Becky Robinson is an LA-based comedian, writer, actor, and voice-over star who has gone from viral sensation to a sold-out theater act. 
You may also know her as the “Entitled Housewife,” the outspoken viral golf character Robinson created to co-star in two self-produced virtual comedy variety specials that helped spread laughter during the pandemic. Her unique character antics and viral videos have racked up millions of views across social media and garnered fans across the country (and the country clubs). In 2022, she released the original song “Mama Needs a Claw.” 


VIP Add-On Option: 

Post Event Meet & Greet



 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don’t get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we’re not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Give 'Em the Axe! Ladies Night at the Range in Santa Rosa
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Join us for an axe-throwing session to blow off some steam. I'm super excited to be able to offer a ladies' Axe-throwing night in Santa Rosa. If you've ever had a curiosity about this fun activity, this is your chance to find out more!

We have reserved a group spot with the indoor range on a Wednesday night. It will consist of an introductory lesson, and then we all get to practice taking turns. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment and targets are provided by them, and we will probably get about 1 to 2 hours to enjoy ourselves.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy).

There are 10 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash. There may be standard liability forms to be filled out with the range. Closed-toed shoes are recommended.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

title: Annual Art of Dessert 2026
description:
Back to All Shows



The 23rd Annual Art of Dessert
The Art of Dessert is LBC’s biggest fundraising event of the year. Over the years, it has raised more than $8 million to help provide enrichment in the arts to over 1 million children, families, and educators. 
Much anticipated, spirited, and delicious, The Art of Dessert features sumptuous family-style dining, exceptional Rodney Strong Wine Estates wines, engaging entertainment, a silent and live auction, and, of course, decadent desserts by the best bakers in the county! Bid on unique live auction items and enjoy lively entertainment and engaging speakers. Sonoma County’s best fundraiser is a night to remember, and your support will make a difference for over 50,000 students, teachers, and families in the coming year. 
WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS 
Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay’s premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families. 
Tickets and more information coming soon! 


Why Your Support Matters
Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay’s premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families. 
Tickets and more information coming soon! 


Join the Fun – Join the Cause!
There are many ways to get involved with The Art of Dessert and support children, teachers, families, and artists in our community, even from home! 


April 4 – 13, 2026 
Online Auction 
Bid on amazing wine, baskets, gifts, and experiences in the online silent auction.  
If you have an item or experience that you’d like to donate, please contact Barbara Arriaga, Member and Donor Relations, at 707.800.7541 or barriaga@lutherburbankcenter.org 


Sponsorships 
Sponsorships are available for this beloved annual event. Get your name in front of hundreds of the most generous and connected members of the community. 
For more information, contact Ben Taylor, Director of Philanthropy, at 707.800.7505 or btaylor@lutherburbankcenter.org 



We gratefully acknowledge the LBC Naming Sponsor, Lytton Rancheria,
 and Wine Sponsor, Rodney Strong Wine Estates. 


Thank you to our generous Art of Dessert 2026 sponsors!

Time: 5:30pm

Limited number of tickets are available.
Reserve yours by Monday, March 3

title: Emmylou Harris
description:
Back to All Shows


Emmylou Harris

Friday, April 17, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Billboard Century Award recipient, Harris’ contribution as a singer and songwriter spans 40 years. She has recorded more than 25 albums and has lent her talents to countless fellow artists’ recordings. In recognition of her remarkable career, Harris was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2008 and earned a Grammy Lifetime Achievement award in 2018. 
Harris is one of the most admired and influential women in music. She has recorded with such diverse artists as Linda Ronstadt, Daniel Lanois, Bob Dylan, Mark Knopfler, Neil Young, Gram Parsons, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, Roy Orbison, Ryan Adams, Beck, Elvis Costello, Johnny Cash, Lucinda Williams, Lyle Lovett and Rodney Crowell. Few artists have achieved such honesty or have revealed such maturity in their writing. Forty years into her career, Harris continues to share the hard-earned wisdom that—hopefully if not inevitably—comes with getting older, though she’s never stopped looking ahead.

title: Outback Presents Justin Willman: One for the Ages Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents
Justin Willman: One for the Ages Tour

Saturday, April 18, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Fresh off the release of Magic Lover, Netflix’s first-ever magic comedy special, Justin Willman is hitting the road with his all-new One for the Ages tour. Willman is best known as the star and creator of Netflix’s Magic for Humans and Magic Prank Show, where his signature mix of mind-blowing magic and relatable humor has made him a streaming favorite, a viral hit (1 billion views and counting), and a fan favorite for families, comedy lovers, and skeptics alike. 
He’s appeared on The Tonight Show, The Today Show, The Kelly Clarkson Show, and Conan, and he was recently named “Stage Magician of the Year” by the Magic Castle. He’s performed at the White House, packed theaters across the country, and managed to make grown adults openly weep over a card trick. But the live show? That’s where the real magic happens. 
One for the Ages is Justin’s biggest tour to date, featuring brand-new material and more. It’s an interactive, laugh-filled, sleight-of-mind experience that’s smart, silly, and astonishing. And yes, it’s the kind of show you can bring your kids, your date, or your dad to. All ages. All generations. All-new. 
This is one for the ages! 


VIP Ticket to include: 

Best available seating
Poster
Post-show Meet & Greet with Justin Willman

The market value for Platinum Seating is subject to change based on the overall demand and popularity for the event.  Platinum Seating allows fans to purchase tickets in a safe and secure environment without running the risk of purchasing tickets that may be considered lost, stolen, or counterfeit.

description:
Back to All Shows


Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
Dinosaur World Live


Thursday, April 23, 2026

6:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
Dare to experience the dangers and delights of Dinosaur World Live in this Olivier award-winning interactive show for all the family. Adventurers all, grab your compass and join our intrepid explorer across uncharted territories to discover a pre-historic world of astonishing (and remarkably life-like) dinosaurs. Meet a host of impressive creatures, including every child’s favorite flesh-eating giant, the Tyrannosaurus Rex, a Triceratops, Giraffatitan, Microraptor, and Segnosaurus! Don’t miss this entertaining and mind-expanding jurassic adventure, live on stage. 
Recommended for ages 5 and up, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 60 minutes
 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 
 
Family Fun in the Lobby
Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It’s a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family’s budget in mind!   


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats®.) 

 Family Fun Series – Save 20% and see all 5 shows!
See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series

Beyond stand-up, Owen has appeared in a wide range of feature films and television. He continues to write, produce, and perform his own groundbreaking comedy specials. In addition to his on-stage and on-screen work, Owen hosts his own podcast, #GetSome with Gary Owen.

description:
Back to All Shows


David Sedaris

Friday, May 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
David Sedaris is one of America’s pre-eminent humor writers. He is a master of satire and one of today’s most observant writers. 
Beloved for his personal essays and short stories, David Sedaris is the author of the New York Times bestsellers Barrel Fever, Holidays on Ice, Naked, Me Talk Pretty One Day, Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim, When You Are Engulfed in Flames, Let’s Explore Diabetes with Owls, and Calypso. His book, The Best of Me, collects 42 previously published stories and essays. Sedaris also wrote Squirrel Seeks Chipmunk: A Modest Bestiary, a collection of fables with illustrations by Ian Falconer. He is the editor of Children Playing Before a Statue of Hercules: An Anthology of Outstanding Stories. His pieces regularly appear in The New Yorker and have twice been included in “The Best American Essays.”

title: Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars
description:
Back to All Shows


Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars

Saturday, May 9, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Modern Mississippi Hill Country band North Mississippi Allstars and blues legend Bobby Rush are co-headlining this unique event, with each artist performing separately before joining together to honor their Mississippi blues roots. 
North Mississippi Allstars was started by brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson in 1996 as a loose collective of musicians from their North Mississippi home. They were inspired by their father Jim Dickinson as well as neighbors and musical elders of their community, including RL Burnside, Junior Kimbrough, Otha Turner, and Fred McDowell. They have multiple Grammy® nominations for their acclaimed experimental albums, and the latest album, Still Shakin’, is out now. 
The 91-year-old Bobby Rush is a three-time Grammy Award® winner for “Best Traditional Blues Album” for Porcupine Meat, Rawer than Raw, and 2024’s All My Love for You. He is also a 16-time Blues Music Awards winner (with 56 career nominations) and has been inducted into the Blues Hall of Fame, Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame and Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame.

title: Paul Anka: A Man and His Music
description:
Back to All Shows


Paul Anka: A Man and His Music

Thursday, May 21, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
With his craftsmanship as a master songwriter and his youthful tenor sound, Paul Anka has been crooning his way to fans’ hearts with a polished blend of classic pop and rock-and-roll energy. 
His duets albums, Body of Work in 1998 that features Frank Sinatra, Celine Dion, Tom Jones and daughter Anthea Anka, and Duets in 2013 with Frank Sinatra, Michael Jackson, Tom Jones, Celine Dion, and Michael Bublé, celebrate his lifelong collaborations with a variety of artists. Duets set a milestone in Billboard Chart history because, with the CD, Anka became the only artist to have a CD on the Billboard Top 100 Chart for seven consecutive decades. 
At 81 years old, Paul Anka continues to write and record. His latest two albums, Making Memories and Sessions, were released in 2021 and 2022 respectively. The albums featured new and never-before recorded songs as well as new takes on old classics, notably “Put Your Head On My Shoulder,” with Olivia Newton John, one of her last recorded songs, and “My Way,” featuring Michael Buble and Andrea Bocelli.

title: LBC’s Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folklórico programs present 2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration
description:
Back to All Shows


LBC’s Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folklórico programs present
2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration

Thursday, May 28, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Celebrate the rich cultural traditions of Mexico through the vibrant artistry of the musicians and dancers in LBC’s afterschool Marichi and Ballet Folklórico programs at Voces y Pasos (Voices and Steps): A Cultural Celebration. Featuring more than 150 of Sonoma County’s talented youth, Voces y Pasos brings these traditions and celebrations to life in an unforgettable stage performance that pays tribute to their Mexican heritage. 
LBC’s Mariachi Ensemble and its sister program, LBC’s Ballet Folklórico, enroll students from all over the county. Together they deliver stunning performances that blend technical skill, stage presence, and heartfelt expression while embodying the grace and vibrancy of traditional Mexican folk music and dance. 
The young performers in these programs devote themselves to weekly rehearsals and regular performances at community events that continue to shape them into impressive artists. Thanks to the generosity of our donors and sponsors, they can participate at no cost to their families, with all equipment and costumes provided. Join us for an inspiring evening that shines the spotlight on the voices and steps of these talented students and honors the enduring power of culture, tradition, and community.

title: I’m With Her
description:
Back to All Shows


I’m With Her

Saturday, June 6, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


With the 2014 formation of I’m With Her, singer/songwriters Sarah Jarosz, Aoife O’Donovan, and Sara Watkins introduce an essential new force into the world of folk music: a close-knit alliance of highly esteemed musicians, each graced with a deep understanding of folk tradition and unbridled passion for expanding its possibilities. 
On their long awaited second LP, Wild and Clear and Blue, their luminous harmonies infuse a soul-searching body of work that explores themes of ancestry, lineage, and the collective human experience with stories about reaching into the past, navigating a chaotic present, and bravely moving forward into the unknown. It follows a critically lauded debut album, See You Around, and standalone singles, like “Call My Name” (winner of the 2020 Grammy for Best American Roots Song). 
All multi-Grammy-winners with deep roots in the folk scene, Watkins, Jarosz, and O’Donovan first discovered their chemistry during an impromptu performance at the 2014 Telluride Bluegrass Festival, then co-founded I’m With Her, and began touring extensively and performing at acclaimed festivals across the globe. 
Produced by Josh Kaufman—a member of Bonny Light Horseman and multi-instrumentalist/songwriter/arranger/producer who’s worked with Bob Weir and The National—Wild and Clear and Blue ultimately adds a bold new urgency to their delicate entangling of lived-in narrative, fable-like storytelling, and nuanced reflection on cycles of life. 
I’m With Her has partnered with PLUS1 so that $1 per ticket goes to supporting organizations working for equity, access, and dignity for all. www.plus1.org

title: Press Democrat Presents North Coast Wine & Food Festival
description:
Back to All Shows


Press Democrat Presents
North Coast Wine & Food Festival

Saturday, June 13, 2026

12:00 pm VIP Entry
1:00 pm General Admission


BUY TICKETS 


Get ready for a day of indulgence, discovery, and celebration at the North Coast Wine & Food Festival, the North Bay’s premier showcase of exceptional wines and culinary talent. The festival brings together gold-medal-winning wines from Sonoma, Napa, and Mendocino counties, alongside inspired bites from some of the region’s most celebrated chefs. Guests are invited to sip, savor, and connect—meeting the winemakers behind the pours and tasting dishes that reflect the rich agricultural and cultural diversity of the North Coast. 
From elegant caviar to bold barbecue and globally inspired flavors, the culinary offerings are as diverse as they are delicious, all complemented by live music and the vibrant energy of wine country. As festival attendee Dennis McCarter of McCarter Cellars shared, “The great food at the event elevates the great wine, and the great wine elevates the great food.” Established as a must-attend event for food and wine lovers alike, the North Coast Wine & Food Festival is more than a tasting—it’s a joyful celebration of craftsmanship, community, and the good life. 
Must be 21 or older to attend. 
Designated driver tickets are available, along with a limited selection of non-alcoholic beverages.
